wmiHardware.name: wmiHardware

revisions.description: Added Win32_Processor entries for L3CacheSize, L3CacheSpeed, NumberOfCores, and NumberOfLogicalProcessors which are new for Windows Vista.
The initial revision of this MIB module.

wmiHardware.contactinfo: Garth Williams 11135-23A Ave Edmonton, AB T6J4W5 Canada Tel: +1 780 434 4113 E-mail: garth.williams@wtcs.org
wmiHardware.description: The MIB module for informant hardware WMI entities.

wmiCoolingDevice.name: wmiCoolingDevice
wmiCoolingDevice.description: The Cooling Devices subcategory groups classes that represent instrumentable fans, temperature probes, and refrigeration devices.

win32FanTable.name: win32FanTable
win32FanTable.description: The Win32_Fan WMI class represents the properties of a fan device in the computer system. For example, the CPU cooling fan.

hwfanIndex.name: hwfanIndex
hwfanIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwfanActiveCooling.name: hwfanActiveCooling
hwfanActiveCooling.description: If TRUE, the cooling device provides active (as opposed to passive) cooling. This property is inherited from CIM_CoolingDevice.

hwfanAvailability.name: hwfanAvailability
hwfanAvailability.description: Availability and status of the device. Power Save - Unknown indicates that the device is known to be in a power save mode, but its exact status is unknown; Power Save - Low Power Mode indicates that the device is in a power save state but still functioning, and may exhibit degraded performance; Power Save - Standby indicates that the device is not functioning but could be brought to full power quickly; and Power Save - Warning indicates that the device is in a warning state, though also in a power save mode. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfanCaption.name: hwfanCaption
hwfanCaption.description: Short description of the object a one-line string. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwfanConfigManagerErrorCode.name: hwfanConfigManagerErrorCode
hwfanConfigManagerErrorCode.description: Windows Configuration Manager error code. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfanConfigManagerUserConfig.name: hwfanConfigManagerUserConfig
hwfanConfigManagerUserConfig.description: If TRUE, the device is using a user-defined configuration. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfanCreationClassName.name: hwfanCreationClassName
hwfanCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class to appear in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be identified uniquely. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfanDescription.name: hwfanDescription
hwfanDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwfanDesiredSpeed.name: hwfanDesiredSpeed
hwfanDesiredSpeed.description: Currently requested fan speed, defined in revolutions per minute, when a variable speed fan is supported (VariableSpeed is TRUE). The current speed is determined by a sensor (CIM_Tachometer) that is associated with the fan using the CIM_AssociatedSensor relationship. This property is inherited from CIM_Fan.

hwfanDeviceID.name: hwfanDeviceID
hwfanDeviceID.description: Identifies the fan device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfanErrorCleared.name: hwfanErrorCleared
hwfanErrorCleared.description: If TRUE, the error reported in the LastErrorCode property is now cleared. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfanErrorDescription.name: hwfanErrorDescription
hwfanErrorDescription.description: Free-form string supplying more information about the error recorded in LastErrorCode property, and information on any corrective actions that may be taken. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfanInstallDate.name: hwfanInstallDate
hwfanInstallDate.description: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwfanLastErrorCode.name: hwfanLastErrorCode
hwfanLastErrorCode.description: Last error code reported by the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfanName.name: hwfanName
hwfanName.description: Label by which the object is known. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwfanPNPDeviceID.name: hwfanPNPDeviceID
hwfanPNPDeviceID.description: Windows Plug and Play device identifier of the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: '*PNP030b'

hwfanPowerManagementCapabilities.name: hwfanPowerManagementCapabilities
hwfanPowerManagementCapabilities.description: Array of the specific power-related capabilities of a logical device. The Enabled value indicates that the power management features are currently enabled but the exact feature set is unknown or the information is unavailable. Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically indicates that a device can change its power state based on usage or other criteria. Power State Settable indicates that the SetPowerState method is supported. Power Cycling Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle). Timed Power On Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle) and Time set to a specific date and time, or interval, for power-on. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Not Supported 2 Disabled 3 Enabled 4 Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically 5 Power State Settable 6 Power Cycling Supported 7 Timed Power On Supported

hwfanPowerManagementSupported.name: hwfanPowerManagementSupported
hwfanPowerManagementSupported.description: If TRUE, the device can be power-managed (can be put into suspend mode, and so on). The property does not indicate that power management features are currently enabled, only that the logical device is capable of power management. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfanStatus.name: hwfanStatus
hwfanStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwfanStatusInfo.name: hwfanStatusInfo
hwfanStatusInfo.description: State of the logical device. If the property does not apply to the logical device, the value 5 (Not Applicable) should be used. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfanSystemCreationClassName.name: hwfanSystemCreationClassName
hwfanSystemCreationClassName.description: Value of the scoping computer's CreationClassName property. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfanSystemName.name: hwfanSystemName
hwfanSystemName.description: Name of the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfanVariableSpeed.name: hwfanVariableSpeed
hwfanVariableSpeed.description: If TRUE, the fan supports variable speeds. This property is inherited from CIM_Fan.

win32HeatPipeTable.name: win32HeatPipeTable
win32HeatPipeTable.description: The Win32_HeatPipe WMI class represents the properties of a heat pipe cooling device.

hwhpErrorDescription.description: More information about the error that is recorded in LastErrorCode, and information about any corrective actions that may be taken. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

win32TemperatureProbeTable.name: win32TemperatureProbeTable
win32TemperatureProbeTable.description: The Win32_TemperatureProbe WMI class represents the properties of a temperature sensor (electronic thermometer).

hwtmpIndex.name: hwtmpIndex
hwtmpIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwtmpAccuracy.name: hwtmpAccuracy
hwtmpAccuracy.description: Accuracy of the sensor for the measured property. Its value is recorded as plus or minus hundredths of a percent. Accuracy, and resolution and tolerance are used to calculate the actual value of the measured physical property. Accuracy may vary and depends on whether or not the device is linear over its dynamic range. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwtmpAvailability.name: hwtmpAvailability
hwtmpAvailability.description: Availability and status of the device. Power Save - Unknown indicates that the device is known to be in a power save mode, but its exact status is unknown; Power Save - Low Power Mode indicates that the device is in a power save state but still functioning, and may exhibit degraded performance; Power Save - Standby indicates that the device is not functioning but could be brought to full power quickly; and Power Save - Warning indicates that the device is in a warning state, though also in a power save mode. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwtmpCaption.name: hwtmpCaption
hwtmpCaption.description: Short description of an object a one-line string. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwtmpConfigManagerErrorCode.name: hwtmpConfigManagerErrorCode
hwtmpConfigManagerErrorCode.description: Windows Configuration Manager error code. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwtmpConfigManagerUserConfig.name: hwtmpConfigManagerUserConfig
hwtmpConfigManagerUserConfig.description: If TRUE, the device is using a user-defined configuration. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

When used with the other key properties of a class, the property allows all instances of the class and its subclasses to be identified uniquely. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwtmpCurrentReading.name: hwtmpCurrentReading
hwtmpCurrentReading.description: Current value indicated by the sensor. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwtmpDescription.name: hwtmpDescription
hwtmpDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwtmpDeviceID.name: hwtmpDeviceID
hwtmpDeviceID.description: Unique identifier of the current probe. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwtmpErrorCleared.name: hwtmpErrorCleared
hwtmpErrorCleared.description: If TRUE, the error reported in LastErrorCode is now cleared. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwtmpErrorDescription.name: hwtmpErrorDescription
hwtmpErrorDescription.description: More information about the error recorded in LastErrorCode, and information about any corrective actions that you can take. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwtmpInstallDate.name: hwtmpInstallDate
hwtmpInstallDate.description: Date and time the object is installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwtmpIsLinear.name: hwtmpIsLinear
hwtmpIsLinear.description: If TRUE, the sensor is linear over its dynamic range. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwtmpLastErrorCode.name: hwtmpLastErrorCode
hwtmpLastErrorCode.description: Last error code reported by the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwtmpLowerThresholdCritical.name: hwtmpLowerThresholdCritical
hwtmpLowerThresholdCritical.description: Sensor threshold value to specify the ranges (minimum and maximum values) that identify the sensor operating conditions, which can be normal, non-critical, critical, or fatal conditions. If CurrentReading is between LowerThresholdCritical and LowerThresholdFatal, the current state is critical. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwtmpLowerThresholdFatal.name: hwtmpLowerThresholdFatal
hwtmpLowerThresholdFatal.description: Sensor threshold value to specify the ranges (minimum and maximum values) that identify the sensor operating conditions, which can be normal, non-critical, critical, or fatal conditions. If CurrentReading is below LowerThresholdFatal, the current state is fatal. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwtmpLowerThresholdNonCritical.name: hwtmpLowerThresholdNonCritical
hwtmpLowerThresholdNonCritical.description: Sensor threshold value to specify the ranges (minimum and maximum values) that identify the sensor operating conditions, which can be normal, non-critical, critical, or fatal conditions. If CurrentReading is between LowerThresholdNonCritical and UpperThresholdNonCritical, the sensor is reporting a normal value. If CurrentReading is between LowerThresholdNonCritical and LowerThresholdCritical, the current state is non-critical. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwtmpMaxReadable.name: hwtmpMaxReadable
hwtmpMaxReadable.description: Largest value of the measured property that can be read by the numeric sensor. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwtmpMinReadable.name: hwtmpMinReadable
hwtmpMinReadable.description: Smallest value of the measured property that can be read by the numeric sensor. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwtmpName.name: hwtmpName
hwtmpName.description: Label for the object. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwtmpNominalReading.name: hwtmpNominalReading
hwtmpNominalReading.description: Normal or expected value for the numeric sensor. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwtmpNormalMax.name: hwtmpNormalMax
hwtmpNormalMax.description: Normal or expected value for the numeric sensor. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwtmpNormalMin.name: hwtmpNormalMin
hwtmpNormalMin.description: Guidance for the user as to the normal minimum range for the numeric sensor. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwtmpPNPDeviceID.name: hwtmpPNPDeviceID
hwtmpPNPDeviceID.description: Windows plug and play device identifier of the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: '*PNP030b'

hwtmpPowerManagementCapabilities.name: hwtmpPowerManagementCapabilities
hwtmpPowerManagementCapabilities.description: Array of the specific power-related capabilities of a logical device. The Enabled value indicates that the power management features are currently enabled but the exact feature set is unknown or the information is unavailable. hwtmpPowerManagementSupported.description: If TRUE, the device can be power-managed (can be put into suspend mode, and so on). The property does not indicate that power management features are currently enabled, only that the logical device is capable of power management. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwtmpResolution.name: hwtmpResolution
hwtmpResolution.description: Ability of the sensor to resolve differences in the measured property. This value may vary depending on whether the device is linear over its dynamic range. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwtmpStatus.name: hwtmpStatus
hwtmpStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. hwtmpStatusInfo.name: hwtmpStatusInfo
hwtmpStatusInfo.description: State of the logical device. If this property does not apply to the logical device, the value 5 (Not Applicable) should be used. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwtmpSystemCreationClassName.name: hwtmpSystemCreationClassName
hwtmpSystemCreationClassName.description: Value for the scoping computer's CreationClassName property. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwtmpSystemName.name: hwtmpSystemName
hwtmpSystemName.description: Name of the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwtmpTolerance.name: hwtmpTolerance
hwtmpTolerance.description: Tolerance of the sensor for the measured property. Tolerance, along with resolution and accuracy, is used to calculate the actual value of the measured physical property. Tolerance may vary depending on whether the device is linear over its dynamic range. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwtmpUpperThresholdCritical.name: hwtmpUpperThresholdCritical
hwtmpUpperThresholdCritical.description: Sensor's threshold values specify the ranges (minimum and maximum values) that identify the sensor operating conditions, which can be normal, non-critical, critical, or fatal conditions. If CurrentReading is between UpperThresholdCritical and UpperThresholdFatal, the current state is critical. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwtmpUpperThresholdFatal.name: hwtmpUpperThresholdFatal
hwtmpUpperThresholdFatal.description: Sensor's threshold values specify the ranges (minimum and maximum values) that identify the sensor operating conditions, which can be normal, non-critical, critical, or fatal conditions. If CurrentReading is above UpperThresholdFatal, the current state is fatal. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwtmpUpperThresholdNonCritical.name: hwtmpUpperThresholdNonCritical
hwtmpUpperThresholdNonCritical.description: Sensor's threshold values specify the ranges (minimum and maximum values) that identify the sensor operating conditions, which can be normal, non-critical, critical, or fatal conditions. If CurrentReading is between LowerThresholdNonCritical and UpperThresholdNonCritical, the sensor is reporting a normal value. If CurrentReading is between UpperThresholdNonCritical and UpperThresholdCritical, the current state is non-critical. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

wmiInputDevice.name: wmiInputDevice
wmiInputDevice.description: The Input Devices subcategory groups classes that represent keyboards and pointing devices.

win32KeyboardTable.name: win32KeyboardTable
win32KeyboardTable.description: The Win32_Keyboard WMI class represents a keyboard installed on a Windows system.

hwkbConfigManagerErrorCode.name: hwkbConfigManagerErrorCode
hwkbConfigManagerErrorCode.description: Windows Configuration Manager error code. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwkbConfigManagerUserConfig.name: hwkbConfigManagerUserConfig
hwkbConfigManagerUserConfig.description: If TRUE, the device is using a user-defined configuration. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwkbCreationClassName.name: hwkbCreationClassName
hwkbCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class that appears in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be identified uniquely. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwkbDescription.name: hwkbDescription
hwkbDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwkbDeviceID.name: hwkbDeviceID
hwkbDeviceID.description: Address or other identifying information to uniquely name the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwkbErrorCleared.name: hwkbErrorCleared
hwkbErrorCleared.description: If TRUE, the error reported in LastErrorCode is now cleared. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwkbErrorDescription.name: hwkbErrorDescription
hwkbErrorDescription.description: More information about the error recorded in LastErrorCode, and corrective actions that may be taken. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwkbInstallDate.name: hwkbInstallDate
hwkbInstallDate.description: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwkbIsLocked.name: hwkbIsLocked
hwkbIsLocked.description: If TRUE, the device is locked, preventing user input or output. This property is inherited from CIM_UserDevice.

hwkbLastErrorCode.name: hwkbLastErrorCode
hwkbLastErrorCode.description: Last error code reported by the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwkbLayout.name: hwkbLayout
hwkbLayout.description: Free-form string indicating the layout of the keyboard. This property is inherited from CIM_Keyboard.

hwkbName.name: hwkbName
hwkbName.description: Label by which the object is known. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwkbNumberOfFunctionKeys.name: hwkbNumberOfFunctionKeys
hwkbNumberOfFunctionKeys.description: Number of function keys on the keyboard. This property is inherited from CIM_Keyboard.

hwkbPassword.name: hwkbPassword
hwkbPassword.description: Status of hardware-level password enabled at the keyboard (value=4), preventing local input. This property is inherited from CIM_Keyboard.

hwkbPNPDeviceID.name: hwkbPNPDeviceID
hwkbPNPDeviceID.description: Windows Plug and Play device identifier of the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: '*PNP030b'

hwkbPowerManagementCapabilities.name: hwkbPowerManagementCapabilities
hwkbPowerManagementCapabilities.description: Array of the specific power-related capabilities of a logical device. The Enabled value indicates that the power management features are currently enabled but the exact feature set is unknown or the information is unavailable. Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically indicates that a device can change its power state based on usage or other criteria. Power State Settable indicates that the SetPowerState method is supported. Power Cycling Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle). Timed Power On Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle) and Time set to a specific date and time, or interval, for power-on. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Not Supported 2 Disabled 3 Enabled 4 Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically 5 Power State Settable 6 Power Cycling Supported 7 Timed Power On Supported

hwkbPowerManagementSupported.name: hwkbPowerManagementSupported
hwkbPowerManagementSupported.description: If TRUE, the device can be power-managed (can be put into suspend mode, and so on). The property does not indicate that power management features are currently enabled, only that the logical device is capable of power management. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwkbStatus.name: hwkbStatus
hwkbStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwkbStatusInfo.name: hwkbStatusInfo
hwkbStatusInfo.description: State of the logical device. If this property does not apply to the logical device, the value 5 (Not Applicable) should be used. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwkbSystemCreationClassName.name: hwkbSystemCreationClassName
hwkbSystemCreationClassName.description: Value of the scoping computer's CreationClassName property. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwkbSystemName.name: hwkbSystemName
hwkbSystemName.description: Name of the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

win32PointingDeviceTable.name: win32PointingDeviceTable
win32PointingDeviceTable.description: The Win32_PointingDevice WMI class represents an input device used to point to and select regions on the display of a Windows computer system. Any device used to manipulate a pointer, or point to the display on a Windows computer system is a member of this class.

hwptIndex.name: hwptIndex
hwptIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwptAvailability.name: hwptAvailability
hwptAvailability.description: Availability and status of the device. Power Save - Unknown indicates that the device is known to be in a power save mode, but its exact status is unknown; Power Save - Low Power Mode indicates that the device is in a power save state but still functioning, and may exhibit degraded performance; Power Save - Standby indicates that the device is not functioning but could be brought to full power quickly; and Power Save - Warning indicates that the device is in a warning state, though also in a power save mode. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwptCaption.name: hwptCaption
hwptCaption.description: Short description (one-line string) of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwptConfigManagerErrorCode.name: hwptConfigManagerErrorCode
hwptConfigManagerErrorCode.description: Windows Configuration Manager error code. . This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwptConfigManagerUserConfig.name: hwptConfigManagerUserConfig
hwptConfigManagerUserConfig.description: If TRUE, the device is using a user-defined configuration. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwptCreationClassName.name: hwptCreationClassName
hwptCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class to appear in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be uniquely identified. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwptDescription.name: hwptDescription
hwptDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwptDeviceID.name: hwptDeviceID
hwptDeviceID.description: Unique identifier of the pointing device with other devices on the system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwptDeviceInterface.name: hwptDeviceInterface
hwptDeviceInterface.description: Type of interface used for the pointing device.

hwptDoubleSpeedThreshold.name: hwptDoubleSpeedThreshold
hwptDoubleSpeedThreshold.description: One of two acceleration values. The sensitivity of the pointing device doubles (toggles from the first to the second value) when the pointing device moves a distance greater than this threshold value.

hwptErrorCleared.name: hwptErrorCleared
hwptErrorCleared.description: If TRUE, the error reported in LastErrorCode is now cleared. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwptErrorDescription.name: hwptErrorDescription
hwptErrorDescription.description: More information about the error recorded in LastErrorCode, and information on any corrective actions that may be taken. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwptHandedness.name: hwptHandedness
hwptHandedness.description: Configuration of the pointing device for left or right-hand operation. This property is inherited from CIM_PointingDevice.

hwptHardwareType.name: hwptHardwareType
hwptHardwareType.description: Type of hardware used for the Windows pointing device. Example: 'MICROSOFT PS2 MOUSE'

hwptInfFileName.name: hwptInfFileName
hwptInfFileName.description: Name of the .inf file for the Windows pointing device. Example: 'ab.inf'

hwptInfSection.name: hwptInfSection
hwptInfSection.description: Section of the .inf file that holds configuration information for the Windows pointing device.

hwptInstallDate.name: hwptInstallDate
hwptInstallDate.description: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwptIsLocked.name: hwptIsLocked
hwptIsLocked.description: If TRUE, the device is locked, preventing user input or output. This property is inherited from CIM_UserDevice.

hwptLastErrorCode.name: hwptLastErrorCode
hwptLastErrorCode.description: Last error code reported by the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwptManufacturer.name: hwptManufacturer
hwptManufacturer.description: Name of the processor's manufacturer. Example: 'GenuineSilicon'

hwptName.name: hwptName
hwptName.description: Label by which the object is known. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwptNumberOfButtons.name: hwptNumberOfButtons
hwptNumberOfButtons.description: Number of buttons on the pointing device. This property is inherited from CIM_PointingDevice. Example: 2

hwptPNPDeviceID.name: hwptPNPDeviceID
hwptPNPDeviceID.description: Windows Plug and Play device identifier of the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: '*PNP030b'

hwptPointingType.name: hwptPointingType
hwptPointingType.description: Type of pointing device. This property is inherited from CIM_PointingDevice.

hwptPowerManagementCapabilities.name: hwptPowerManagementCapabilities
hwptPowerManagementCapabilities.description: Array of the specific power-related capabilities of a logical device. The Enabled value indicates that the power management features are currently enabled but the exact feature set is unknown or the information is unavailable. Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically indicates that a device can change its power state based on usage or other criteria. Power State Settable indicates that the SetPowerState method is supported. Power Cycling Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle). Timed Power On Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle) and Time set to a specific date and time, or interval, for power-on. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Not Supported 2 Disabled 3 Enabled 4 Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically 5 Power State Settable 6 Power Cycling Supported 7 Timed Power On Supported

hwptPowerManagementSupported.name: hwptPowerManagementSupported
hwptPowerManagementSupported.description: If TRUE, the device can be power-managed (can be put into suspend mode, and so on). The property does not indicate that power management features are currently enabled, only that the logical device is capable of power management. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwptQuadSpeedThreshold.name: hwptQuadSpeedThreshold
hwptQuadSpeedThreshold.description: One of two acceleration threshold values. The system doubles the speed of the pointer movement when the pointer device moves a distance greater than this value. Because this speed increase occurs after the DoubleSpeedThreshold value has been met, the pointer effectively moves at four times its original speed.

hwptResolution.name: hwptResolution
hwptResolution.description: Tracking resolution. This property is inherited from CIM_PointingDevice. Example: 0

hwptSampleRate.name: hwptSampleRate
hwptSampleRate.description: Rate at which the pointing device is polled for input information.

hwptStatus.name: hwptStatus
hwptStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwptStatusInfo.name: hwptStatusInfo
hwptStatusInfo.description: State of the logical device. If this property does not apply to the logical device, the value 5 (Not Applicable) should be used. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwptSynch.name: hwptSynch
hwptSynch.description: Length of time after which the next interrupt is assumed to indicate the start of a new device packet (partial packets are discarded). In the event that an interrupt is lost, this allows the pointing device driver to synchronize its internalrepresentation of the packet state with the hardware state.

hwptSystemCreationClassName.name: hwptSystemCreationClassName
hwptSystemCreationClassName.description: Value of the scoping computer's CreationClassName property. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwptSystemName.name: hwptSystemName
hwptSystemName.description: Name of the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

wmiMassStorage.name: wmiMassStorage
wmiMassStorage.description: Classes in the Mass Storage subcategory represent storage devices such as hard disk drives, CD-ROM drives, and tape drives.

win32AutochkSettingTable.name: win32AutochkSettingTable
win32AutochkSettingTable.description: The Win32_AutochkSetting WMI class represents the settings for the autocheck operation of a disk.

hwasIndex.name: hwasIndex
hwasIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwasCaption.name: hwasCaption
hwasCaption.description: Short description (one-line string) of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_Setting.

hwasDescription.name: hwasDescription
hwasDescription.description: Description of the autocheck setting. This property is inherited from CIM_Setting.

hwasSettingID.name: hwasSettingID
hwasSettingID.description: Date and time when the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_Setting.

win32CDROMDriveTable.name: win32CDROMDriveTable
win32CDROMDriveTable.description: The Win32_CDROMDrive WMI class represents a CD-ROM drive on a Windows computer system. Note that the name of the drive does not correspond to the logical drive letter assigned to the device.

hwcdIndex.name: hwcdIndex
hwcdIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwcdAvailability.name: hwcdAvailability
hwcdAvailability.description: Availability and status of the device. Power Save - Unknown indicates that the device is known to be in a power save mode, but its exact status is unknown; Power Save - Low Power Mode indicates that the device is in a power save state but still functioning, and may exhibit degraded performance; Power Save - Standby indicates that the device is not functioning but could be brought to full power quickly; and Power Save - Warning indicates that the device is in a warning state, though also in a power save mode. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcdCapabilities.name: hwcdCapabilities
hwcdCapabilities.description: Array of capabilities of the media access device. For example, the device may support random access (3), removable media (7), and automatic cleaning (9). This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Other 2 Sequential Access 3 Random Access 4 Supports Writing 5 Encryption 6 Compression 7 Supports Removable Media 8 Manual Cleaning 9 Automatic Cleaning 10 SMART Notification 11 Supports Dual-sided Media 12 Predismount Eject Not Required

hwcdCapabilityDescriptions.name: hwcdCapabilityDescriptions
hwcdCapabilityDescriptions.description: Array of more detailed explanations for any of the access device features indicated in the Capabilities array. Each entry of this array is related to the entry in the Capabilities array that is located at the same index. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwcdCaption.name: hwcdCaption
hwcdCaption.description: Short description of the object a one-line string. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwcdCompressionMethod.name: hwcdCompressionMethod
hwcdCompressionMethod.description: Algorithm or tool used by the device to support compression. If it is not possible or not desired to describe the compression scheme (perhaps because it is not known), use the following words: 'Unknown' to represent that it is not known whether the device supports compression capabilities; 'Compressed' to represent that the device supports compression capabilities but either its compression scheme is not known or not disclosed; and 'Not Compressed' to represent that the device does not support compression capabilities. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwcdConfigManagerErrorCode.name: hwcdConfigManagerErrorCode
hwcdConfigManagerErrorCode.description: Windows Configuration Manager error code. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcdConfigManagerUserConfig.name: hwcdConfigManagerUserConfig
hwcdConfigManagerUserConfig.description: If TRUE, the device is using a user-defined configuration. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcdCreationClassName.name: hwcdCreationClassName
hwcdCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class that appears in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be identified uniquely. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcdDefaultBlockSize.name: hwcdDefaultBlockSize
hwcdDefaultBlockSize.description: Default block size, in bytes, for this device. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwcdDescription.name: hwcdDescription
hwcdDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwcdDeviceID.name: hwcdDeviceID
hwcdDeviceID.description: Unique identifier for a CD-ROM drive. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcdDrive.name: hwcdDrive
hwcdDrive.description: Drive letter of the CD-ROM drive. Example: 'd:\'

hwcdDriveIntegrity.name: hwcdDriveIntegrity
hwcdDriveIntegrity.description: If TRUE, files can be accurately read from the CD device. This is achieved by reading a block of data twice and comparing the data against itself.

hwcdErrorCleared.name: hwcdErrorCleared
hwcdErrorCleared.description: If TRUE, the error reported in LastErrorCode is now cleared.

hwcdErrorDescription.name: hwcdErrorDescription
hwcdErrorDescription.description: More information about the error recorded in LastErrorCode, and information about corrective actions that can be taken.

hwcdErrorMethodology.name: hwcdErrorMethodology
hwcdErrorMethodology.description: Type of error detection and correction supported by this device. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwcdFileSystemFlags.name: hwcdFileSystemFlags
hwcdFileSystemFlags.description: This property is obsolete. In place of this property, use FileSystemFlagsEx.

hwcdFileSystemFlagsEx.name: hwcdFileSystemFlagsEx
hwcdFileSystemFlagsEx.description: File system flags associated with the Windows CD-ROM drive. This parameter can be any combination of flags, but FS_FILE_COMPRESSION and FS_VOL_IS_COMPRESSED are mutually exclusive.

hwcdId.name: hwcdId
hwcdId.description: Drive letter uniquely identifying this CD-ROM drive. Example: 'd:\'

hwcdInstallDate.name: hwcdInstallDate
hwcdInstallDate.description: Date and time the object is installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwcdLastErrorCode.name: hwcdLastErrorCode
hwcdLastErrorCode.description: Last error code reported by the logical device.

hwcdManufacturer.name: hwcdManufacturer
hwcdManufacturer.description: Manufacturer of the Windows CD-ROM drive. Example: 'PLEXTOR'

hwcdMaxBlockSize.name: hwcdMaxBlockSize
hwcdMaxBlockSize.description: Maximum block size, in bytes, for media accessed by this device. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwcdMaximumComponentLength.name: hwcdMaximumComponentLength
hwcdMaximumComponentLength.description: Maximum length of a filename component supported by the Windows CD-ROM drive. A file name component the portion of a file name between backslashes. The value can be used to indicate that long names are supported by the specified file system. For example, for a FAT file system supporting long names, the function stores the value 255, rather than the previous 8.3 indicator. Long names can also be supported on systems that use the NTFS file system. Example: 255

hwcdMaxMediaSize.name: hwcdMaxMediaSize
hwcdMaxMediaSize.description: Maximum size, in kilobytes, of media supported by this device. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwcdMediaLoaded.name: hwcdMediaLoaded
hwcdMediaLoaded.description: If TRUE, a CD-ROM is in the drive.

hwcdMediaType.name: hwcdMediaType
hwcdMediaType.description: Type of media used or accessed by this device. In this class, the value is always 'CD-ROM'.

hwcdMfrAssignedRevisionLevel.name: hwcdMfrAssignedRevisionLevel
hwcdMfrAssignedRevisionLevel.description: Windows XP and Windows Server 2003: Manufacturer assigned firmware revision level of the CD-ROM drive.

hwcdMinBlockSize.name: hwcdMinBlockSize
hwcdMinBlockSize.description: Minimum block size, in bytes, for media accessed by this device. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwcdName.name: hwcdName
hwcdName.description: Label for the object. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwcdNeedsCleaning.name: hwcdNeedsCleaning
hwcdNeedsCleaning.description: If TRUE, the media access device needs cleaning. Whether manual or automatic cleaning is possible is indicated in the Capabilities property. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwcdNumberOfMediaSupported.name: hwcdNumberOfMediaSupported
hwcdNumberOfMediaSupported.description: Maximum number of media that can be supported or inserted, when the media access device supports multiple individual media. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwcdPNPDeviceID.name: hwcdPNPDeviceID
hwcdPNPDeviceID.description: Windows Plug and Play device identifier of the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: '*PNP030b'

hwcdPowerManagementCapabilities.name: hwcdPowerManagementCapabilities
hwcdPowerManagementCapabilities.description: Array of the specific power-related capabilities of a logical device. The Enabled value indicates that the power management features are currently enabled but the exact feature set is unknown or the information is unavailable. Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically indicates that a device can change its power state based on usage or other criteria. Power State Settable indicates that the SetPowerState method is supported. Power Cycling Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle). Timed Power On Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle) and Time set to a specific date and time, or interval, for power-on. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Not Supported 2 Disabled 3 Enabled 4 Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically 5 Power State Settable 6 Power Cycling Supported 7 Timed Power On Supported

hwcdPowerManagementSupported.name: hwcdPowerManagementSupported
hwcdPowerManagementSupported.description: If TRUE, the device can be power-managed, which means that it can be put into suspend mode, and so on. The property does not indicate that power management features are currently enabled, only that the logical device is capable of power management. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcdRevisionLevel.name: hwcdRevisionLevel
hwcdRevisionLevel.description: Firmware revision level of the Windows CD-ROM drive.

hwcdSCSIBus.name: hwcdSCSIBus
hwcdSCSIBus.description: SCSI bus number for the disk drive. Example: 0

hwcdSCSILogicalUnit.name: hwcdSCSILogicalUnit
hwcdSCSILogicalUnit.description: SCSI logical unit number (LUN) of the disk drive. The LUN is used to designate which SCSI controller is being accessed in a system with more than one controller being used. The SCSI device identifier is similar, but is the designation for multiple devices on one controller. Example: 0

hwcdSCSIPort.name: hwcdSCSIPort
hwcdSCSIPort.description: SCSI port number of the disk drive. Example: 1

hwcdSCSITargetId.name: hwcdSCSITargetId
hwcdSCSITargetId.description: SCSI identifier number of the Windows CD-ROM drive. Example: 0

hwcdStatus.name: hwcdStatus
hwcdStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwcdStatusInfo.name: hwcdStatusInfo
hwcdStatusInfo.description: State of the logical device. If this property does not apply to the logical device, the value 5 (Not Applicable) should be used.

hwcdSystemCreationClassName.name: hwcdSystemCreationClassName
hwcdSystemCreationClassName.description: Value of the scoping computer's CreationClassName property.

hwcdTransferRate.name: hwcdTransferRate
hwcdTransferRate.description: Transfer rate of the CD-ROM drive. A value of -1 indicates that the rate cannot be determined. This might happen if the CD is not in the drive.

hwcdVolumeName.name: hwcdVolumeName
hwcdVolumeName.description: Volume name of the Windows CD-ROM drive.

hwcdVolumeSerialNumber.name: hwcdVolumeSerialNumber
hwcdVolumeSerialNumber.description: Volume serial number of the media in the CD-ROM drive. Example: A8C3-D032

win32DiskDriveTable.name: win32DiskDriveTable
win32DiskDriveTable.description: The Win32_DiskDrive WMI class represents a physical disk drive as seen by a computer running the Windows operating system. Any interface to a Windows physical disk drive is a descendent (or member) of this class. The features of the disk drive seen through this object correspond to the logical and management characteristics of the drive. In some cases, this may not reflect the actual physical characteristics of the device. Any object based on another logical device would not be a member of this class.

hwddIndex.name: hwddIndex
hwddIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwddAvailability.name: hwddAvailability
hwddAvailability.description: Availability and status of the device. Power Save - Unknown indicates that the device is known to be in a power save mode, but its exact status is unknown; Power Save - Low Power Mode indicates that the device is in a power save state but still functioning, and may exhibit degraded performance; Power Save - Standby indicates that the device is not functioning but could be brought to full power quickly; and Power Save - Warning indicates that the device is in a warning state, though also in a power save mode. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwddBytesPerSector.name: hwddBytesPerSector
hwddBytesPerSector.description: Number of bytes in each sector for the physical disk drive. Example: 512

hwddCapabilities.name: hwddCapabilities
hwddCapabilities.description: Array of capabilities of the media access device. For example, the device may support random access (3), removable media (7) and automatic cleaning (9). This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Other 2 Sequential Access 3 Random Access 4 Supports Writing 5 Encryption 6 Compression 7 Supports Removable Media 8 Manual Cleaning 9 Automatic Cleaning 10 SMART Notification 11 Supports Dual Sided Media 12 Ejection Prior to Drive Dismount Not Required

hwddCapabilityDescriptions.name: hwddCapabilityDescriptions
hwddCapabilityDescriptions.description: List of more detailed explanations for any of the access device features indicated in the Capabilities array. Note, each entry of this array is related to the entry in the Capabilities array that is located at the same index. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwddCaption.name: hwddCaption
hwddCaption.description: Short description (one-line string) of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwddCompressionMethod.name: hwddCompressionMethod
hwddCompressionMethod.description: Algorithm or tool used by the device to support compression. If it is not possible or not desired to describe the compression scheme (perhaps because it is not known), use the following words: 'Unknown' to represent that it is not known whether the device supports compression capabilities or not; 'Compressed' to represent that the device supports compression capabilities but either its compression scheme is not known or not disclosed; and 'Not Compressed' to represent that the device does not support compression capabilities. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwddConfigManagerErrorCode.name: hwddConfigManagerErrorCode
hwddConfigManagerErrorCode.description: Windows Configuration Manager error code. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwddConfigManagerUserConfig.name: hwddConfigManagerUserConfig
hwddConfigManagerUserConfig.description: If TRUE, the device is using a user-defined configuration. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwddCreationClassName.name: hwddCreationClassName
hwddCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class to appear in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be uniquely identified. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwddDefaultBlockSize.name: hwddDefaultBlockSize
hwddDefaultBlockSize.description: Default block size, in bytes, for this device. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwddDescription.name: hwddDescription
hwddDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwddDeviceID.name: hwddDeviceID
hwddDeviceID.description: Unique identifier of the disk drive with other devices on the system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwddErrorCleared.name: hwddErrorCleared
hwddErrorCleared.description: If TRUE, the error reported in LastErrorCode is now cleared. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwddErrorDescription.name: hwddErrorDescription
hwddErrorDescription.description: More information about the error recorded in LastErrorCode, and information on any corrective actions that may be taken. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwddErrorMethodology.name: hwddErrorMethodology
hwddErrorMethodology.description: Type of error detection and correction supported by this device. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwddPhysicalIndex.name: hwddPhysicalIndex
hwddPhysicalIndex.description: Physical drive number of the given drive. This property is filled by the GetDriveMapInfo method. A value of 0xFF indicates that the given drive does not map to a physical drive. Example: 1

hwddInstallDate.name: hwddInstallDate
hwddInstallDate.description: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwddInterfaceType.name: hwddInterfaceType
hwddInterfaceType.description: Interface type of physical disk drive. Example: 'SCSI'

hwddLastErrorCode.name: hwddLastErrorCode
hwddLastErrorCode.description: Last error code reported by the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwddManufacturer.name: hwddManufacturer
hwddManufacturer.description: Name of the disk drive manufacturer. Example: 'Seagate'

hwddMaxBlockSize.name: hwddMaxBlockSize
hwddMaxBlockSize.description: Maximum block size, in bytes, for media accessed by this device. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwddMaxMediaSize.name: hwddMaxMediaSize
hwddMaxMediaSize.description: Maximum media size, in kilobytes, of media supported by this device. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwddMediaLoaded.name: hwddMediaLoaded
hwddMediaLoaded.description: If TRUE, the media for a disk drive is loaded. For fixed disk drives, this property will always be TRUE

hwddMediaType.name: hwddMediaType
hwddMediaType.description: Type of media used or accessed by this device.

hwddMinBlockSize.name: hwddMinBlockSize
hwddMinBlockSize.description: Minimum block size, in bytes, for media accessed by this device. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwddModel.name: hwddModel
hwddModel.description: Manufacturer's model number of the disk drive. Example: 'ST32171W'

hwddName.name: hwddName
hwddName.description: Label by which the object is known. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwddNeedsCleaning.name: hwddNeedsCleaning
hwddNeedsCleaning.description: If TRUE, the media access device needs cleaning. Whether manual or automatic cleaning is possible is indicated in the Capabilities property. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwddNumberOfMediaSupported.name: hwddNumberOfMediaSupported
hwddNumberOfMediaSupported.description: Maximum number of media which can be supported or inserted (when the media access device supports multiple individual media). This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwddPartitions.name: hwddPartitions
hwddPartitions.description: Number of partitions on this physical disk drive that are recognized by the operating system. Example: 2

hwddPNPDeviceID.name: hwddPNPDeviceID
hwddPNPDeviceID.description: Windows Plug and Play device identifier of the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: '*PNP030b'

hwddPowerManagementCapabilities.name: hwddPowerManagementCapabilities
hwddPowerManagementCapabilities.description: Array of the specific power-related capabilities of a logical device. The Enabled value indicates that the power management features are currently enabled but the exact feature set is unknown or the information is unavailable. Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically indicates that a device can change its power state based on usage or other criteria. Power State Settable indicates that the SetPowerState method is supported. Power Cycling Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle). Timed Power On Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle) and Time set to a specific date and time, or interval, for power-on. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Not Supported 2 Disabled 3 Enabled 4 Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically 5 Power State Settable 6 Power Cycling Supported 7 Timed Power On Supported

hwddPowerManagementSupported.name: hwddPowerManagementSupported
hwddPowerManagementSupported.description: If TRUE, the device can be power-managed (can be put into suspend mode, and so on). The property does not indicate that power management features are currently enabled, only that the logical device is capable of power management. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwddSCSIBus.name: hwddSCSIBus
hwddSCSIBus.description: SCSI bus number of the disk drive. Example: 0

hwddSCSILogicalUnit.name: hwddSCSILogicalUnit
hwddSCSILogicalUnit.description: SCSI logical unit number (LUN) of the disk drive. Example: 0

hwddSCSIPort.name: hwddSCSIPort
hwddSCSIPort.description: SCSI port number of the disk drive. Example: 0

hwddSCSITargetId.name: hwddSCSITargetId
hwddSCSITargetId.description: SCSI identifier number of the disk drive. Example: 0

hwddSectorsPerTrack.name: hwddSectorsPerTrack
hwddSectorsPerTrack.description: Number of sectors in each track for this physical disk drive. Example: 63

hwddSignature.name: hwddSignature
hwddSignature.description: Disk identification. This property can be used to identify a shared resource. This property has been added for Windows XP.

hwddSize.name: hwddSize
hwddSize.description: Size of the disk drive. It is calculated by multiplying the total number of cylinders, tracks in each cylinder, sectors in each track, and bytes in each sector.

hwddStatus.name: hwddStatus
hwddStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwddStatusInfo.name: hwddStatusInfo
hwddStatusInfo.description: State of the logical device. If this property does not apply to the logical device, the value 5 (Not Applicable) should be used. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwddSystemCreationClassName.name: hwddSystemCreationClassName
hwddSystemCreationClassName.description: Value of the scoping computer's CreationClassName property. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwddSystemName.name: hwddSystemName
hwddSystemName.description: Name of the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwddTotalCylinders.name: hwddTotalCylinders
hwddTotalCylinders.description: Total number of cylinders on the physical disk drive. Note: the value for this property is obtained through extended functions of BIOS interrupt 13h. The value may be inaccurate if the drive uses a translation scheme to support high capacity disk sizes. Consult the manufacturer for accurate drive specifications. Example: 657

hwddTotalHeads.name: hwddTotalHeads
hwddTotalHeads.description: Total number of heads on the disk drive. Note: the value for this property is obtained through extended functions of BIOS interrupt 13h. The value may be inaccurate if the drive uses a translation scheme to support high capacity disk sizes. Consult the manufacturer for accurate drive specifications.

hwddTotalSectors.name: hwddTotalSectors
hwddTotalSectors.description: Total number of sectors on the physical disk drive. Note: the value for this property is obtained through extended functions of BIOS interrupt 13h. The value may be inaccurate if the drive uses a translation scheme to support high capacity disk sizes. Consult the manufacturer for accurate drive specifications. Example: 2649024

hwddTotalTracks.name: hwddTotalTracks
hwddTotalTracks.description: Total number of tracks on the physical disk drive. Note: the value for this property is obtained through extended functions of BIOS interrupt 13h. The value may be inaccurate if the drive uses a translation scheme to support high capacity disk sizes. Consult the manufacturer for accurate drive specifications. Example: 42048

hwddTracksPerCylinder.name: hwddTracksPerCylinder
hwddTracksPerCylinder.description: Number of tracks in each cylinder on the physical disk drive. Note: the value for this property is obtained through extended functions of BIOS interrupt 13h. The value may be inaccurate if the drive uses a translation scheme to support high capacity disk sizes. Consult the manufacturer for accurate drive specifications. Example: 64

win32FloppyDriveTable.name: win32FloppyDriveTable
win32FloppyDriveTable.description: The Win32_FloppyDrive WMI class manages the capabilities of a floppy disk drive.

hwfdIndex.name: hwfdIndex
hwfdIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwfdAvailability.name: hwfdAvailability
hwfdAvailability.description: Availability and status of the device. Power Save - Unknown indicates that the device is known to be in a power save mode, but its exact status is unknown; Power Save - Low Power Mode indicates that the device is in a power save state but still functioning, and may exhibit degraded performance; Power Save - Standby indicates that the device is not functioning but could be brought to full power quickly; and Power Save - Warning indicates that the device is in a warning state, though also in a power save mode. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfdCapabilities.name: hwfdCapabilities
hwfdCapabilities.description: Array of capabilities of the media access device. For example, the device may support Random Access, removable media and Automatic Cleaning. In this case, the values 3, 7 and 9 would be written to the array. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Other 2 Sequential Access 3 Random Access 4 Supports Writing 5 Encryption 6 Compression 7 Supports Removable Media 8 Manual Cleaning 9 Automatic Cleaning 10 SMART Notification 11 Supports Dual Sided Media 12 Predismount Eject Not Required

hwfdCapabilityDescriptions.name: hwfdCapabilityDescriptions
hwfdCapabilityDescriptions.description: Array of free-form strings providing more detailed explanations for any of the serial controller features indicated in the Capabilities array. Note, each entry of this array is related to the entry in the Capabilities array that is located at the same index. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwfdCaption.name: hwfdCaption
hwfdCaption.description: Short description (one-line string) of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwfdCompressionMethod.name: hwfdCompressionMethod
hwfdCompressionMethod.description: Free form string indicating the algorithm or tool used by the device to support compression. If it is not possible or not desired to describe the compression scheme (perhaps because it is not known), we recommend using the following words: 'Unknown' to represent that it is not known whether the device supports compression capabilities or not; 'Compressed' to represent that the device supports compression capabilities but either its compression scheme is not known or not disclosed; and 'Not Compressed' to represent that the device does not support compression capabilities. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwfdConfigManagerErrorCode.name: hwfdConfigManagerErrorCode
hwfdConfigManagerErrorCode.description: Windows Configuration Manager error code. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfdConfigManagerUserConfig.name: hwfdConfigManagerUserConfig
hwfdConfigManagerUserConfig.description: If TRUE, the device is using a user-defined configuration. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfdCreationClassName.name: hwfdCreationClassName
hwfdCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class to appear in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be uniquely identified. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfdDefaultBlockSize.name: hwfdDefaultBlockSize
hwfdDefaultBlockSize.description: Default block size, in bytes, for this device. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwfdDescription.name: hwfdDescription
hwfdDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwfdDeviceID.name: hwfdDeviceID
hwfdDeviceID.description: Unique identifier of the floppy disk drive with other devices on the system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfdErrorCleared.name: hwfdErrorCleared
hwfdErrorCleared.description: If TRUE, the error reported in LastErrorCode is now cleared. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfdErrorDescription.name: hwfdErrorDescription
hwfdErrorDescription.description: Free-form string supplying more information about the error recorded in LastErrorCode, and information on any corrective actions that may be taken. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfdErrorMethodology.name: hwfdErrorMethodology
hwfdErrorMethodology.description: Free-form string describing the type of error detection and correction supported by this device. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwfdInstallDate.name: hwfdInstallDate
hwfdInstallDate.description: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwfdLastErrorCode.name: hwfdLastErrorCode
hwfdLastErrorCode.description: Last error code reported by the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfdManufacturer.name: hwfdManufacturer
hwfdManufacturer.description: Name of the manufacturer of the floppy disk drive. Example: 'Acme'

hwfdMaxBlockSize.name: hwfdMaxBlockSize
hwfdMaxBlockSize.description: Maximum block size, in bytes, for media accessed by this device. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwfdMaxMediaSize.name: hwfdMaxMediaSize
hwfdMaxMediaSize.description: Maximum size, in kilobytes, of media supported by this device. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwfdMinBlockSize.name: hwfdMinBlockSize
hwfdMinBlockSize.description: Minimum block size, in bytes, for media accessed by this device. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwfdName.name: hwfdName
hwfdName.description: Label by which the object is known. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwfdNeedsCleaning.name: hwfdNeedsCleaning
hwfdNeedsCleaning.description: If TRUE, the media access device needs cleaning. Whether manual or automatic cleaning is possible is indicated in the Capabilities property. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwfdNumberOfMediaSupported.name: hwfdNumberOfMediaSupported
hwfdNumberOfMediaSupported.description: Maximum number of individual media which can be supported or inserted in the media access device (when supported). This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwfdPNPDeviceID.name: hwfdPNPDeviceID
hwfdPNPDeviceID.description: Windows Plug and Play device identifier of the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: '*PNP030b'

hwfdPowerManagementCapabilities.name: hwfdPowerManagementCapabilities
hwfdPowerManagementCapabilities.description: Array of the specific power-related capabilities of a logical device. The Enabled value indicates that the power management features are currently enabled but the exact feature set is unknown or the information is unavailable. Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically indicates that a device can change its power state based on usage or other criteria. Power State Settable indicates that the SetPowerState method is supported. Power Cycling Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle). Timed Power On Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle) and Time set to a specific date and time, or interval, for power-on. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Not Supported 2 Disabled 3 Enabled 4 Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically 5 Power State Settable 6 Power Cycling Supported 7 Timed Power On Supported

hwfdPowerManagementSupported.name: hwfdPowerManagementSupported
hwfdPowerManagementSupported.description: If TRUE, the device can be power-managed (can be put into suspend mode, and so on). The property does not indicate that power management features are currently enabled, only that the logical device is capable of power management. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfdStatus.name: hwfdStatus
hwfdStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwfdStatusInfo.name: hwfdStatusInfo
hwfdStatusInfo.description: State of the logical device. If this property does not apply to the logical device, the value 5 (Not Applicable) should be used. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfdSystemCreationClassName.name: hwfdSystemCreationClassName
hwfdSystemCreationClassName.description: Value of the scoping computer's CreationClassName property. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfdSystemName.name: hwfdSystemName
hwfdSystemName.description: Name of the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

win32PhysicalMediaTable.name: win32PhysicalMediaTable
win32PhysicalMediaTable.description: The Win32_PhysicalMedia class represents any type of documentation or storage medium, such as tapes, CD ROMs and so on. To obtain the characteristics of the media in a CD drive, such as whether it is writeable, use Win32_CDROMDrive and the Capabilities property

hwpmdIndex.name: hwpmdIndex
hwpmdIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwpmdCapacity.name: hwpmdCapacity
hwpmdCapacity.description: Number of bytes that can be read from or written to this physical media component. This property does not apply to 'Hard Copy' or cleaner media. Data compression should not be assumed as it would increase the value of this property. For tapes, it should be assumed that no filemarks or blank space areas are recorded on the media.

hwpmdCaption.name: hwpmdCaption
hwpmdCaption.description: Short, one line textual description of the object.

hwpmdCleanerMedia.name: hwpmdCleanerMedia
hwpmdCleanerMedia.description: If true the physical media is used for cleaning purposes and not data storage.

hwpmdCreationClassName.name: hwpmdCreationClassName
hwpmdCreationClassName.description: Name of the class or subclass used in the creation of an instance. When used with other key properties of this class, CreationClassName allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be uniquely identified.

hwpmdHotSwappable.name: hwpmdHotSwappable
hwpmdHotSwappable.description: If true this physical media component can be replaced with a physically different but equivalent one while the containing package has the power applied. For example, a fan component may be designed to be hot swapped. All components that can be hot swapped are inherently removable and replaceable.

hwpmdInstallDate.name: hwpmdInstallDate
hwpmdInstallDate.description: When the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed.

hwpmdManufacturer.name: hwpmdManufacturer
hwpmdManufacturer.description: Name of the organization responsible for producing the physical element. This may be the entity from whom the element is purchased, but this is not necessarily the case as this information is contained in the Vendor property.

hwpmdMediaDescription.name: hwpmdMediaDescription
hwpmdMediaDescription.description: Additional detail related to the MediaType property. For example, if MediaType has the value 3 (QIC Cartridge) the MediaDescription property could indicate whether the tape is wide or quarter inch.

hwpmdMediaType.name: hwpmdMediaType
hwpmdMediaType.description: The type of the media, as an enumerated integer. The MediaDescription property provides a more explicit definition of the media type.

hwpmdModel.name: hwpmdModel
hwpmdModel.description: Name by which the physical element is generally known.

hwpmdName.name: hwpmdName
hwpmdName.description: Label by which the object is known. When subclassed, the Name property can be overridden to be a Key property.

hwpmdOtherIdentifyingInfo.name: hwpmdOtherIdentifyingInfo
hwpmdOtherIdentifyingInfo.description: Additional data, beyond asset tag information, that could be used to identify a physical element. One example is bar code data associated with an element that also has an asset tag. Note that if only bar code data is available and is unique and it can be used as an element key, this property is NULL and the bar code data used is the class key in the Tag property.

hwpmdPartNumber.name: hwpmdPartNumber
hwpmdPartNumber.description: Part number assigned by the manufacturer of the physical element.

hwpmdPoweredOn.name: hwpmdPoweredOn
hwpmdPoweredOn.description: If true the physical element is powered on.

hwpmdRemovable.name: hwpmdRemovable
hwpmdRemovable.description: If true the physical component is designed to be taken in and out of the physical container in which it is normally found, without impairing the function of the overall packaging. A component can still be removable if the power must be 'off' in order to perform the removal. If power can be 'on' and the component removed, the element is removable and can be hot swapped.

hwpmdReplaceable.name: hwpmdReplaceable
hwpmdReplaceable.description: If true this physical media component can be replaced with a physically different one. For example, some computer systems allow the main processor chip to be upgraded to one of a higher clock rating. In this case, the processor is said to be replaceable. All removable components are inherently replaceable.

hwpmdSerialNumber.name: hwpmdSerialNumber
hwpmdSerialNumber.description: Manufacturer-allocated number used to identify the physical media. Example: WD-WM3493798728

hwpmdSKU.name: hwpmdSKU
hwpmdSKU.description: Stock keeping unit number for this physical element.

hwpmdStatus.name: hwpmdStatus
hwpmdStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses are 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail'. 'Pred Fail' indicates that an element may function properly at the present, but predicts a failure in the near future. For example, a SMART-enabled hard drive. Non-operational statuses can also be specified. These are, 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping' and 'Service'. The 'Service' status applies to administrative work, such as mirror-resilvering of a disk or reload of a user permissions list. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states.

hwpmdTag.name: hwpmdTag
hwpmdTag.description: Uniquely identifies the physical media in the system. Example: PHYSICALDRIVE0

hwpmdWriteProtectOn.name: hwpmdWriteProtectOn
hwpmdWriteProtectOn.description: If true the media is currently write protected by some kind of physical mechanism, such as a protect tab on a floppy diskette.

win32TapeDriveTable.name: win32TapeDriveTable
win32TapeDriveTable.description: The Win32_TapeDrive WMI class represents a tape drive on a Windows computer. Tape drives are primarily distinguished by the fact that they can be accessed only sequentially.

hwtdIndex.name: hwtdIndex
hwtdIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwtdAvailability.name: hwtdAvailability
hwtdAvailability.description: Availability and status of the device. Power Save - Unknown indicates that the device is known to be in a power save mode, but its exact status is unknown; Power Save - Low Power Mode indicates that the device is in a power save state but still functioning, and may exhibit degraded performance; Power Save - Standby indicates that the device is not functioning but could be brought to full power quickly; and Power Save - Warning indicates that the device is in a warning state, though also in a power save mode. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwtdCapabilities.name: hwtdCapabilities
hwtdCapabilities.description: Array of capabilities of the media access device. For example, the device may support Random Access, removable media and Automatic Cleaning. In this case, the values 3, 7, and 9 would be written to the array. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Other 2 Sequential Access 3 Random Access 4 Supports Writing 5 Encryption 6 Compression 7 Supports Removable Media 8 Manual Cleaning 9 Automatic Cleaning 10 SMART Notification 11 Supports Dual Sided Media 12 Predismount Eject Not Required

hwtdCapabilityDescriptions.name: hwtdCapabilityDescriptions
hwtdCapabilityDescriptions.description: Array of free-form strings providing more detailed explanations for any of the access device features indicated in the Capabilities array. Note that each entry of this array is related to the entry in the Capabilities array that is located at the same index. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwtdCaption.name: hwtdCaption
hwtdCaption.description: Short description (one-line string) of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwtdCompression.name: hwtdCompression
hwtdCompression.description: If TRUE, hardware data compression is enabled.

hwtdCompressionMethod.name: hwtdCompressionMethod
hwtdCompressionMethod.description: Free form string indicating the algorithm or tool used by the device to support compression.
