If it is not possible or not desired to describe the compression scheme (perhaps because it is not known), we recommend using the following words: 'Unknown' to represent that it is not known whether the device supports compression capabilities or not; 'Compressed' to represent that the device supports compression capabilities but either its compression scheme is not known or not disclosed; and 'Not Compressed' to represent that the device does not support compression capabilities. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwtdConfigManagerErrorCode.name: hwtdConfigManagerErrorCode
hwtdConfigManagerErrorCode.description: Windows Configuration Manager error code. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwtdConfigManagerUserConfig.name: hwtdConfigManagerUserConfig
hwtdConfigManagerUserConfig.description: If TRUE, the device is using a user-defined configuration. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwtdCreationClassName.name: hwtdCreationClassName
hwtdCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class to appear in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be uniquely identified. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwtdDefaultBlockSize.name: hwtdDefaultBlockSize
hwtdDefaultBlockSize.description: Default block size, in bytes, for this device. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwtdDescription.name: hwtdDescription
hwtdDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwtdDeviceID.name: hwtdDeviceID
hwtdDeviceID.description: Unique identifier of the tape drive with other devices on the system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwtdECC.name: hwtdECC
hwtdECC.description: If TRUE, the device supports hardware error correction.

hwtdEOTWarningZoneSize.name: hwtdEOTWarningZoneSize
hwtdEOTWarningZoneSize.description: Zone size for the End Of Tape (EOT) warning. This property is inherited from CIM_TapeDrive.

hwtdErrorCleared.name: hwtdErrorCleared
hwtdErrorCleared.description: If TRUE, the error reported in LastErrorCode is now cleared. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwtdErrorDescription.name: hwtdErrorDescription
hwtdErrorDescription.description: Free-form string supplying more information about the error recorded in LastErrorCode, and information on any corrective actions that may be taken. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwtdErrorMethodology.name: hwtdErrorMethodology
hwtdErrorMethodology.description: Free-form string describing the type of error detection and correction supported by this device. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwtdFeaturesHigh.name: hwtdFeaturesHigh
hwtdFeaturesHigh.description: High-order 32 bits of the device features flag.

hwtdFeaturesLow.name: hwtdFeaturesLow
hwtdFeaturesLow.description: Low-order 32 bits of the device features flag.

hwtdId.name: hwtdId
hwtdId.description: Manufacturer's identifying name of the Windows CD ROM drive. Example: 'PLEXTOR CD-ROM PX-12CS 1.01'

hwtdInstallDate.name: hwtdInstallDate
hwtdInstallDate.description: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwtdLastErrorCode.name: hwtdLastErrorCode
hwtdLastErrorCode.description: Last error code reported by the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwtdManufacturer.name: hwtdManufacturer
hwtdManufacturer.description: Manufacturer of the Windows CD-ROM drive. Example: 'PLEXTOR'

hwtdMaxBlockSize.name: hwtdMaxBlockSize
hwtdMaxBlockSize.description: Maximum block size, in bytes, for media accessed by this device. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwtdMaxMediaSize.name: hwtdMaxMediaSize
hwtdMaxMediaSize.description: Maximum size, in kilobytes, of media supported by this device. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwtdMaxPartitionCount.name: hwtdMaxPartitionCount
hwtdMaxPartitionCount.description: Maximum partition count for the tape drive. This property is inherited from CIM_TapeDrive.

hwtdMediaType.name: hwtdMediaType
hwtdMediaType.description: Media type used by (or accessed by) this device. In this case, it is set to 'Tape Drive'.

hwtdMinBlockSize.name: hwtdMinBlockSize
hwtdMinBlockSize.description: Minimum block size, in bytes, for media accessed by this device. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwtdName.name: hwtdName
hwtdName.description: Label by which the object is known. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwtdNeedsCleaning.name: hwtdNeedsCleaning
hwtdNeedsCleaning.description: If TRUE, the media access device needs cleaning. Whether manual or automatic cleaning is possible is indicated in the Capabilities property. This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwtdNumberOfMediaSupported.name: hwtdNumberOfMediaSupported
hwtdNumberOfMediaSupported.description: Maximum number of individual media which can be supported or inserted in the media access device (when supported). This property is inherited from CIM_MediaAccessDevice.

hwtdPadding.name: hwtdPadding
hwtdPadding.description: Number of bytes inserted between blocks on a tape media. This property is inherited from CIM_TapeDrive.

hwtdPNPDeviceID.name: hwtdPNPDeviceID
hwtdPNPDeviceID.description: Windows Plug and Play device identifier of the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: '*PNP030b'

hwtdPowerManagementCapabilities.name: hwtdPowerManagementCapabilities
hwtdPowerManagementCapabilities.description: Array of the specific power-related capabilities of a logical device. The Enabled value indicates that the power management features are currently enabled but the exact feature set is unknown or the information is unavailable. Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically indicates that a device can change its power state based on usage or other criteria. Power State Settable indicates that the SetPowerState method is supported. Power Cycling Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle). Timed Power On Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle) and Time set to a specific date and time, or interval, for power-on. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Not Supported 2 Disabled 3 Enabled 4 Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically 5 Power State Settable 6 Power Cycling Supported 7 Timed Power On Supported

hwtdPowerManagementSupported.name: hwtdPowerManagementSupported
hwtdPowerManagementSupported.description: If TRUE, the device can be power-managed (can be put into suspend mode, and so on). The property does not indicate that power management features are currently enabled, only that the logical device is capable of power management. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwtdReportSetMarks.name: hwtdReportSetMarks
hwtdReportSetMarks.description: If TRUE, setmark reporting is enabled. Setmark reporting makes use of a specialized recorded element that does not contain user data. This recorded element is used to provide a segmentation scheme that is hierarchically superior to filemarks. Setmarks provide faster positioning on high-capacity tapes.

hwtdStatus.name: hwtdStatus
hwtdStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwtdStatusInfo.name: hwtdStatusInfo
hwtdStatusInfo.description: State of the logical device. If this property does not apply to the logical device, the value 5 (Not Applicable) should be used. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwtdSystemCreationClassName.name: hwtdSystemCreationClassName
hwtdSystemCreationClassName.description: Value of the scoping computer's CreationClassName property. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwtdSystemName.name: hwtdSystemName
hwtdSystemName.description: Name of the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

wmiMotherboardControllerPort.name: wmiMotherboardControllerPort
wmiMotherboardControllerPort.description: The Motherboard, Controllers, and Ports subcategory groups classes that represent system devices. Examples include system memory, cache memory, and controllers.

win321394ControllerTable.name: win321394ControllerTable
win321394ControllerTable.description: The Win32_1394Controller WMI class represents the capabilities and management of a 1394 controller. IEEE 1394 is a specification for a high speed serial bus.

hw1394Index.name: hw1394Index
hw1394Index.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hw1394Availability.name: hw1394Availability
hw1394Availability.description: Availability and status of the device. Power Save - Unknown indicates that the device is known to be in a power save mode, but its exact status is unknown; Power Save - Low Power Mode indicates that the device is in a power save state but still functioning, and may exhibit degraded performance; Power Save - Standby indicates that the device is not functioning but could be brought to full power quickly; and Power Save - Warning indicates that the device is in a warning state, though also in a power save mode. Inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hw1394Caption.name: hw1394Caption
hw1394Caption.description: Short description (one-line string) of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hw1394ConfigManagerErrorCode.name: hw1394ConfigManagerErrorCode
hw1394ConfigManagerErrorCode.description: Windows Configuration Manager error code. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hw1394ConfigManagerUserConfig.name: hw1394ConfigManagerUserConfig
hw1394ConfigManagerUserConfig.description: If TRUE, the device is using a user-defined configuration. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hw1394CreationClassName.name: hw1394CreationClassName
hw1394CreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class to appear in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be uniquely identified. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hw1394Description.name: hw1394Description
hw1394Description.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hw1394DeviceID.name: hw1394DeviceID
hw1394DeviceID.description: Unique identifier of this controller. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hw1394ErrorCleared.name: hw1394ErrorCleared
hw1394ErrorCleared.description: If TRUE, the error reported in LastErrorCode is now cleared. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hw1394ErrorDescription.name: hw1394ErrorDescription
hw1394ErrorDescription.description: More information about the error recorded in LastErrorCode, and information on any corrective actions that may be taken. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hw1394InstallDate.name: hw1394InstallDate
hw1394InstallDate.description: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hw1394LastErrorCode.name: hw1394LastErrorCode
hw1394LastErrorCode.description: Last error code reported by the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hw1394MaxNumberControlled.name: hw1394MaxNumberControlled
hw1394MaxNumberControlled.description: Maximum number of directly addressable entities supportable by this controller. A value of 0 should be used if the number is unknown. This property is inherited from CIM_Controller.

hw1394Name.name: hw1394Name
hw1394Name.description: Label by which the object is known. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hw1394PNPDeviceID.name: hw1394PNPDeviceID
hw1394PNPDeviceID.description: Windows Plug and Play device identifier of the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: '*PNP030b'

hw1394PowerManagementCapability.name: hw1394PowerManagementCapability
hw1394PowerManagementCapability.description: Array of the specific power-related capabilities of a logical device. The Enabled value indicates that the power management features are currently enabled but the exact feature set is unknown or the information is unavailable. Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically indicates that a device can change its power state based on usage or other criteria. Power State Settable indicates that the SetPowerState method is supported. This method is found on the parent CIM_LogicalDevice class and can be implemented. For more information, see Extending Your Management Capabilities. Power Cycling Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle). Timed Power On Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle) and Time set to a specific date and time, or interval, for power-on. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Not Supported 2 Disabled 3 Enabled 4 Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically 5 Power State Settable 6 Power Cycling Supported 7 Timed Power On Supported

hw1394PowerManagementSupported.name: hw1394PowerManagementSupported
hw1394PowerManagementSupported.description: If TRUE, the device can be power-managed (can be put into suspend mode, and so on). The property does not indicate that power management features are currently enabled, only that the logical device is capable of power management. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hw1394ProtocolSupported.name: hw1394ProtocolSupported
hw1394ProtocolSupported.description: Protocol used by the controller to access 'controlled' devices. This property is inherited from CIM_Controller.

hw1394Status.name: hw1394Status
hw1394Status.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hw1394StatusInfo.name: hw1394StatusInfo
hw1394StatusInfo.description: State of the logical device. If this property does not apply to the logical device, the value 5 (Not Applicable) should be used. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hw1394SystemCreationClassName.name: hw1394SystemCreationClassName
hw1394SystemCreationClassName.description: Value for the scoping computer's CreationClassName property. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hw1394SystemName.name: hw1394SystemName
hw1394SystemName.description: Name of the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hw1394TimeOfLastReset.name: hw1394TimeOfLastReset
hw1394TimeOfLastReset.description: Date and time controller was last reset. This could mean the controller was powered down, or reinitialized. This property is inherited from CIM_Controller.

win32BaseBoardTable.name: win32BaseBoardTable
win32BaseBoardTable.description: The Win32_BaseBoard WMI class represents a baseboard, which is also known as a motherboard or system board.

hwbbIndex.name: hwbbIndex
hwbbIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwbbCaption.name: hwbbCaption
hwbbCaption.description: Short description of the object a one-line string. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwbbConfigOptions.name: hwbbConfigOptions
hwbbConfigOptions.description: Array that represents the configuration of the jumpers and switches located on the base board. Example: 'JP2: 1-2 Cache Size is 256K, 2-3 Cache Size is 512K, SW1-1: Close to Disable On Board Video'

hwbbCreationClassName.name: hwbbCreationClassName
hwbbCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class that appears in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be identified uniquely. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwbbDepth.name: hwbbDepth
hwbbDepth.description: Depth of the physical package in inches. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalPackage.

hwbbDescription.name: hwbbDescription
hwbbDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwbbHeight.name: hwbbHeight
hwbbHeight.description: Height of the physical package in inches. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalPackage.

hwbbHostingBoard.name: hwbbHostingBoard
hwbbHostingBoard.description: If TRUE, the card is a motherboard, or a baseboard in a chassis. This property is inherited from CIM_Card.

hwbbHotSwappable.name: hwbbHotSwappable
hwbbHotSwappable.description: If TRUE, the package can be hot-swapped. A physical package can be hot-swapped if it is possible to replace the element with a physically different but equivalent oelement while the containing package has power applied to it that is, while it is ON. For example, a disk drive package inserted using SCA connectors is removable and can be hot-swapped. All packages that can be hot-swapped are inherently removable and replaceable. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalPackage.

hwbbInstallDate.name: hwbbInstallDate
hwbbInstallDate.description: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwbbManufacturer.name: hwbbManufacturer
hwbbManufacturer.description: Name of the organization responsible for producing the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwbbModel.name: hwbbModel
hwbbModel.description: Name by which the physical element is known. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwbbName.name: hwbbName
hwbbName.description: Label by which the object is known. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwbbOtherIdentifyingInfo.name: hwbbOtherIdentifyingInfo
hwbbOtherIdentifyingInfo.description: Captures additional data, beyond asset tag information, that can be used to identify a physical element. One example is bar code data that is associated with an element that also has an asset tag. Note that if only bar code data is available and unique or able to be used as an element key, the property value would be NULL and the bar code data used as the class key, in the tag property. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwbbPartNumber.name: hwbbPartNumber
hwbbPartNumber.description: Part number assigned by the organization responsible for producing or manufacturing the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwbbPoweredOn.name: hwbbPoweredOn
hwbbPoweredOn.description: If TRUE, the physical element is powered ON. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwbbProduct.name: hwbbProduct
hwbbProduct.description: Baseboard part number defined by the manufacturer.

hwbbRemovable.name: hwbbRemovable
hwbbRemovable.description: If TRUE, a package is removable. A physical package is removable if it is designed to be taken in and out of the physical container in which it is normally found without impairing the function of the overall packaging. A package can still be removable if power must be OFF in order to perform the removal. If power can be ON and the package removed, then the element is removable and can be hot-swapped. For example, an extra battery in a laptop is removable, as is a disk drive package inserted using SCA connectors. However, the latter can also be hot-swapped. A laptop's display is not removable, nor is a non-redundant power supply. Removing these components would impact the function of the overall packaging, or is impossible due to the tight integration of the package. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalPackage.

hwbbReplaceable.name: hwbbReplaceable
hwbbReplaceable.description: If TRUE, a package is replaceable. A physical package is replaceable if it is possible to replace (FRU or upgrade) the element with a physically different one. For example, some computer systems allow the main processor chip to be upgraded to one of a higher clock rating. In this case, the processor is said to be replaceable. Another example is a power supply package mounted on sliding rails. All removable packages are inherently replaceable. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalPackage.

hwbbRequirementsDescription.name: hwbbRequirementsDescription
hwbbRequirementsDescription.description: Free-form string that describes the way in which this card is physically unique from other cards. The property only has meaning when the corresponding Boolean property SpecialRequirements is set to TRUE. This property is inherited from CIM_Card.

hwbbRequiresDaughterBoard.name: hwbbRequiresDaughterBoard
hwbbRequiresDaughterBoard.description: If TRUE, at least one daughterboard or auxiliary card is required to function properly. This property is inherited from CIM_Card.

hwbbSerialNumber.name: hwbbSerialNumber
hwbbSerialNumber.description: Manufacturer-allocated number used to identify the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwbbSKU.name: hwbbSKU
hwbbSKU.description: Stock-keeping unit number for the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwbbSlotLayout.name: hwbbSlotLayout
hwbbSlotLayout.description: Free-form string that describes the slot position, typical usage, restrictions, individual slot spacing or any other pertinent information for the slots on a card. This property is inherited from CIM_Card.

hwbbSpecialRequirements.name: hwbbSpecialRequirements
hwbbSpecialRequirements.description: If TRUE, this card is physically unique from other cards of the same type and therefore requires a special slot. For example, a double-wide card requires two slots. Another example is where a certain card may be used for the same general function as other cards but requires a special slot (for example, extra long), whereas the other cards can be placed in any available slot. If set to TRUE, then the corresponding property, RequirementsDescription, should specify the nature of the uniqueness or purpose of the card. This property is inherited from CIM_Card.

hwbbStatus.name: hwbbStatus
hwbbStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwbbTag.name: hwbbTag
hwbbTag.description: Unique identifier of the baseboard of the system. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement. Example: 'Base Board'

hwbbVersion.name: hwbbVersion
hwbbVersion.description: Version of the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwbbWeight.name: hwbbWeight
hwbbWeight.description: Weight of the physical package in pounds. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalPackage.

hwbbWidth.name: hwbbWidth
hwbbWidth.description: Width of the physical package in inches. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalPackage.

win32BIOSTable.name: win32BIOSTable
win32BIOSTable.description: The Win32_BIOS WMI class represents the attributes of the computer system's basic input/output services (BIOS) that are installed on a computer.

hwbiIndex.name: hwbiIndex
hwbiIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwbiBiosCharacteristics.name: hwbiBiosCharacteristics
hwbiBiosCharacteristics.description: Array of BIOS characteristics supported by the system as defined by the System Management BIOS Reference Specification. Value Meaning 0 Reserved 1 Reserved 2 Unknown 3 BIOS Characteristics Not Supported 4 ISA is supported 5 MCA is supported 6 EISA is supported 7 PCI is supported 8 PC Card (PCMCIA) is supported 9 Plug and Play is supported 10 APM is supported 11 BIOS is Upgradable (Flash) 12 BIOS shadowing is allowed 13 VL-VESA is supported 14 ESCD support is available 15 Boot from CD is supported 16 Selectable Boot is supported 17 BIOS ROM is socketed 18 Boot From PC Card (PCMCIA) is supported 19 EDD (Enhanced Disk Drive) Specification is supported 20 Int 13h - Japanese Floppy for NEC 9800 1.2mb (3.5, 1k Bytes/Sector, 360 RPM) is supported 21 Int 13h - Japanese Floppy for Toshiba 1.2mb (3.5, 360 RPM) is supported 22 Int 13h - 5.25 / 360 KB Floppy Services are supported 23 Int 13h - 5.25 /1.2MB Floppy Services are supported 24 Int 13h - 3.5 / 720 KB Floppy Services are supported 25 Int 13h - 3.5 / 2.88 MB Floppy Services are supported 26 Int 5h, Print Screen Service is supported 27 Int 9h, 8042 Keyboard services are supported 28 Int 14h, Serial Services are supported 29 Int 17h, printer services are supported 30 Int 10h, CGA/Mono Video Services are supported 31 NEC PC-98 32 ACPI supported 33 USB Legacy is supported 34 AGP is supported 35 I2O boot is supported 36 LS-120 boot is supported 37 ATAPI ZIP Drive boot is supported 38 1394 boot is supported 39 Smart Battery supported

hwbiBIOSVersion.name: hwbiBIOSVersion
hwbiBIOSVersion.description: Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: Array of the complete system BIOS information. In many computers there can be several version strings that are stored in the registry, and represent the system BIOS information.

hwbiBuildNumber.name: hwbiBuildNumber
hwbiBuildNumber.description: Internal identifier for this compilation of this software element. This property is inherited from CIM_SoftwareElement.

hwbiCaption.name: hwbiCaption
hwbiCaption.description: Short description of the object a one-line string. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwbiCodeSet.name: hwbiCodeSet
hwbiCodeSet.description: Code set used by this software element. This property is inherited from CIM_SoftwareElement.

hwbiCurrentLanguage.name: hwbiCurrentLanguage
hwbiCurrentLanguage.description: Name of the current BIOS language.

hwbiDescription.name: hwbiDescription
hwbiDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwbiIdentificationCode.name: hwbiIdentificationCode
hwbiIdentificationCode.description: Manufacturer's identifier for this software element. Often this will be a stock keeping unit (SKU) or a part number. This property is inherited from CIM_SoftwareElement.

hwbiInstallableLanguages.name: hwbiInstallableLanguages
hwbiInstallableLanguages.description: Number of languages available for installation on this system. Language may determine properties such as the need for Unicode and bi-directional text.

hwbiInstallDate.name: hwbiInstallDate
hwbiInstallDate.description: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwbiLanguageEdition.name: hwbiLanguageEdition
hwbiLanguageEdition.description: Language edition of this software element. The language codes defined in ISO 639 should be used. Where the software element represents multilingual or international version of a product, the string 'multilingual' should be used. This property is inherited from CIM_SoftwareElement.

hwbiListOfLanguages.name: hwbiListOfLanguages
hwbiListOfLanguages.description: Array of names of available BIOS-installable languages.

hwbiManufacturer.name: hwbiManufacturer
hwbiManufacturer.description: Manufacturer of this software element. This property is inherited from CIM_SoftwareElement.

hwbiName.name: hwbiName
hwbiName.description: Name used to identify this software element. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwbiOtherTargetOS.name: hwbiOtherTargetOS
hwbiOtherTargetOS.description: Records the manufacturer and operating system type for a software element when the TargetOperatingSystem property has a value of 1 (Other). When TargetOperatingSystem has a value of 1, OtherTargetOS must have a non-null value. For all other values of TargetOperatingSystem, OtherTargetOS is NULL. This property is inherited from CIM_SoftwareElement.

hwbiPrimaryBIOS.name: hwbiPrimaryBIOS
hwbiPrimaryBIOS.description: If TRUE, this is the primary BIOS of the computer system. This property is inherited from CIM_BIOSElement.

hwbiReleaseDate.name: hwbiReleaseDate
hwbiReleaseDate.description: Release date of the Windows BIOS in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) format of YYYYMMDDHHMMSS.MMMMMM(+-)OOO.

hwbiSerialNumber.name: hwbiSerialNumber
hwbiSerialNumber.description: Assigned serial number of the software element. This property is inherited from CIM_SoftwareElement.

hwbiSMBIOSBIOSVersion.name: hwbiSMBIOSBIOSVersion
hwbiSMBIOSBIOSVersion.description: BIOS version as reported by SMBIOS.

hwbiSMBIOSMajorVersion.name: hwbiSMBIOSMajorVersion
hwbiSMBIOSMajorVersion.description: Major SMBIOS version number. This property is NULL if SMBIOS is not found.

hwbiSMBIOSMinorVersion.name: hwbiSMBIOSMinorVersion
hwbiSMBIOSMinorVersion.description: Minor SMBIOS version number. This property is NULL if SMBIOS is not found.

hwbiSMBIOSPresent.name: hwbiSMBIOSPresent
hwbiSMBIOSPresent.description: If true, the SMBIOS is available on this computer system.

hwbiSoftwareElementID.name: hwbiSoftwareElementID
hwbiSoftwareElementID.description: Identifier for this software element; designed to be used in conjunction with other keys to create a unique representation of this CIM_SoftwareElement instance. This property is inherited from CIM_SoftwareElement.

hwbiSoftwareElementState.name: hwbiSoftwareElementState
hwbiSoftwareElementState.description: State of a software element. This property is inherited from CIM_SoftwareElement.

hwbiStatus.name: hwbiStatus
hwbiStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwbiTargetOperatingSystem.name: hwbiTargetOperatingSystem
hwbiTargetOperatingSystem.description: Target operating system of the owning software element. This property is inherited from CIM_SoftwareElement.

hwbiVersion.name: hwbiVersion
hwbiVersion.description: Version of the BIOS. This string is created by the BIOS manufacturer. This property is inherited from CIM_SoftwareElement.

win32BusTable.name: win32BusTable
win32BusTable.description: The Win32_Bus WMI class represents a physical bus as seen by a Windows operating system. Any instance of a Windows bus is a descendent (or member) of this class.

hwbuIndex.name: hwbuIndex
hwbuIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwbuAvailability.name: hwbuAvailability
hwbuAvailability.description: Availability and status of the device. Power Save - Unknown indicates that the device is known to be in a power save mode, but its exact status is unknown; Power Save - Low Power Mode indicates that the device is in a power save state but still functioning, and may exhibit degraded performance; Power Save - Standby indicates that the device is not functioning but could be brought to full power quickly; and Power Save - Warning indicates that the device is in a warning state, though also in a power save mode. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwbuBusNum.name: hwbuBusNum
hwbuBusNum.description: Logical number assigned to the physical bus. Example: 1

hwbuBusType.name: hwbuBusType
hwbuBusType.description: Type of the physical bus. This value will be one of the values in the INTERFACE_TYPE enumeration defined in Bus.h.

hwbuCaption.name: hwbuCaption
hwbuCaption.description: Short description of the object a one-line string. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwbuConfigManagerErrorCode.name: hwbuConfigManagerErrorCode
hwbuConfigManagerErrorCode.description: Windows Configuration Manager error code. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwbuConfigManagerUserConfig.name: hwbuConfigManagerUserConfig
hwbuConfigManagerUserConfig.description: If TRUE, the device is using a user-defined configuration. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwbuCreationClassName.name: hwbuCreationClassName
hwbuCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class that appears in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be identified uniquely. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwbuDescription.name: hwbuDescription
hwbuDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwbuDeviceID.name: hwbuDeviceID
hwbuDeviceID.description: Unique name that identifies the bus. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwbuErrorCleared.name: hwbuErrorCleared
hwbuErrorCleared.description: If TRUE, the error reported in LastErrorCode is now cleared. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwbuErrorDescription.name: hwbuErrorDescription
hwbuErrorDescription.description: More information about the error recorded in LastErrorCode, and information on any corrective actions that may be taken. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwbuInstallDate.name: hwbuInstallDate
hwbuInstallDate.description: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwbuLastErrorCode.name: hwbuLastErrorCode
hwbuLastErrorCode.description: Last error code reported by the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwbuName.name: hwbuName
hwbuName.description: Label by which the object is known. When subclassed, this property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwbuPNPDeviceID.name: hwbuPNPDeviceID
hwbuPNPDeviceID.description: Windows Plug and Play device identifier of the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: '*PNP030b'

hwbuPowerManagementCapabilities.name: hwbuPowerManagementCapabilities
hwbuPowerManagementCapabilities.description: Array of the specific power-related capabilities of a logical device. The Enabled value indicates that the power management features are currently enabled but the exact feature set is unknown or the information is unavailable. Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically indicates that a device can change its power state based on usage or other criteria. Power State Settable indicates that the SetPowerState method is supported. Power Cycling Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle). Timed Power On Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle) and Time set to a specific date and time, or interval, for power-on. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Not Supported 2 Disabled 3 Enabled 4 Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically 5 Power State Settable 6 Power Cycling Supported 7 Timed Power On Supported

hwbuPowerManagementSupported.name: hwbuPowerManagementSupported
hwbuPowerManagementSupported.description: If TRUE, the device can be power-managed (can be put into suspend mode, and so on). The property does not indicate that power management features are currently enabled, only that the logical device is capable of power management. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwbuStatus.name: hwbuStatus
hwbuStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwbuStatusInfo.name: hwbuStatusInfo
hwbuStatusInfo.description: State of the logical device. If this property does not apply to the logical device, the value 5 (Not Applicable) should be used. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwbuSystemCreationClassName.name: hwbuSystemCreationClassName
hwbuSystemCreationClassName.description: Value of the scoping computer's CreationClassName property. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwbuSystemName.name: hwbuSystemName
hwbuSystemName.description: Name of the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

win32CacheMemoryTable.name: win32CacheMemoryTable
win32CacheMemoryTable.description: The Win32_CacheMemory WMI class represents internal and external cache memory on a computer system.

hwcmIndex.name: hwcmIndex
hwcmIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwcmAccess.name: hwcmAccess
hwcmAccess.description: Type of access. This property is inherited from CIM_StorageExtent.

hwcmAdditionalErrorData.name: hwcmAdditionalErrorData
hwcmAdditionalErrorData.description: Array of octets that hold additional error information. An example is ECC Syndrome or the return of the check bits if a CRC-based error methodology is used. In the latter case, if a single bit error is recognized and the CRC algorithm is known, it is possible to determine the exact bit that failed. This type of data (ECC Syndrome, Check Bit, Parity Bit data, or other vendor supplied information) is included in this field. If the ErrorInfo property is equal to 3 (OK), then this property has no meaning. This property is inherited from CIM_Memory.

hwcmAssociativity.name: hwcmAssociativity
hwcmAssociativity.description: An integer enumeration that defines the system cache associativity. This property is inherited from CIM_CacheMemory.

hwcmAvailability.name: hwcmAvailability
hwcmAvailability.description: Availability and status of the device. Power Save - Unknown indicates that the device is known to be in a power save mode, but its exact status is unknown; Power Save - Low Power Mode indicates that the device is in a power save state but still functioning, and may exhibit degraded performance; Power Save - Standby indicates that the device is not functioning but could be brought to full power quickly; and Power Save - Warning indicates that the device is in a warning state, though also in a power save mode. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcmBlockSize.name: hwcmBlockSize
hwcmBlockSize.description: Size in bytes of the blocks that form this storage extent. If unknown or if a block concept is not valid (for example, for aggregate extents, memory or logical disks), enter a 1. This property is inherited from CIM_StorageExtent.

hwcmCacheType.name: hwcmCacheType
hwcmCacheType.description: Type of cache. This property is inherited from CIM_CacheMemory.

hwcmCaption.name: hwcmCaption
hwcmCaption.description: Short description of the object a one-line string. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwcmConfigManagerErrorCode.name: hwcmConfigManagerErrorCode
hwcmConfigManagerErrorCode.description: Windows Configuration Manager error code. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcmConfigManagerUserConfig.name: hwcmConfigManagerUserConfig
hwcmConfigManagerUserConfig.description: If TRUE, the device is using a user-defined configuration. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcmCorrectableError.name: hwcmCorrectableError
hwcmCorrectableError.description: If TRUE, the most recent error was correctable. If the ErrorInfo property is equal to 3 (OK), then this property has no meaning. This property is inherited from CIM_Memory.

hwcmCreationClassName.name: hwcmCreationClassName
hwcmCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class to appear in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be uniquely identified. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcmCurrentSRAM.name: hwcmCurrentSRAM
hwcmCurrentSRAM.description: Array of types of Static Random Access Memory (SRAM) being used for the cache memory. Value Meaning 0 Other 1 Unknown 2 Non-Burst 3 Burst 4 Pipeline Burst 5 Synchronous 6 Asynchronous

hwcmDescription.name: hwcmDescription
hwcmDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwcmDeviceID.name: hwcmDeviceID
hwcmDeviceID.description: Unique identifier of the cache represented by an instance of Win32_CacheMemory. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: 'Cache Memory 1'

hwcmEndingAddress.name: hwcmEndingAddress
hwcmEndingAddress.description: Ending address, referenced by an application or operating system and mapped by a memory controller, for this memory object. The ending address is specified in kilobytes. This property is inherited from CIM_Memory.

hwcmErrorAccess.name: hwcmErrorAccess
hwcmErrorAccess.description: Memory access operation that caused the last error. The type of error is described by the ErrorInfo property. If ErrorInfo is equal to 3 (OK), then this property has no meaning. This property is inherited from CIM_Memory.

hwcmErrorAddress.name: hwcmErrorAddress
hwcmErrorAddress.description: Address of the last memory error. The type of error is described by the ErrorInfo property. If ErrorInfo is equal to 3 (OK), then this property has no meaning. This property is inherited from CIM_Memory.

hwcmErrorCleared.name: hwcmErrorCleared
hwcmErrorCleared.description: If TRUE, the error reported in LastErrorCode is now cleared. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcmErrorCorrectType.name: hwcmErrorCorrectType
hwcmErrorCorrectType.description: Error correction method used by the cache memory.

hwcmErrorData.name: hwcmErrorData
hwcmErrorData.description: Array of data captured during the last erroneous memory access. The data occupies the first n octets of the array necessary to hold the number of bits specified by the ErrorTransferSize property. If ErrorTransferSize is 0, then this property has no meaning. This property is inherited from CIM_Memory.

hwcmErrorDataOrder.name: hwcmErrorDataOrder
hwcmErrorDataOrder.description: Ordering for data stored in the ErrorData property. If ErrorTransferSize is 0, then this property has no meaning. This property is inherited from CIM_Memory.

hwcmErrorDescription.name: hwcmErrorDescription
hwcmErrorDescription.description: More information about the error recorded in LastErrorCode, and information on any corrective actions that may be taken. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcmErrorInfo.name: hwcmErrorInfo
hwcmErrorInfo.description: Type of error that occurred most recently. The values 12-14 are undefined in the CIM schema because in DMI they mix the semantics of the type of error and whether it was correctable or not. The latter is indicated in the property CorrectableError. This property is inherited from CIM_Memory.

hwcmErrorMethodology.name: hwcmErrorMethodology
hwcmErrorMethodology.description: Details on the parity or CRC algorithms, ECC, or other mechanisms used. This property is inherited from CIM_Memory.

hwcmErrorResolution.name: hwcmErrorResolution
hwcmErrorResolution.description: Range, in bytes, to which the last error can be resolved. For example, if error addresses are resolved to bit 11 (that is, on a typical page basis), then errors can be resolved to 4K boundaries and this property is set to 4000. If the ErrorInfo property is equal to 3 (OK), then this property has no meaning. This property is inherited from CIM_Memory.

hwcmErrorTime.name: hwcmErrorTime
hwcmErrorTime.description: Time that the last memory error occurred. The type of error is described by the ErrorInfo property. If the ErrorInfo property is equal to 3 (OK), then this property has no meaning. This property is inherited from CIM_Memory.

hwcmErrorTransferSize.name: hwcmErrorTransferSize
hwcmErrorTransferSize.description: Size of the data transfer in bits that caused the last error. 0 indicates no error. If the ErrorInfo property is equal to 3 (OK), then this property should be set to 0. This property is inherited from CIM_Memory.

hwcmFlushTimer.name: hwcmFlushTimer
hwcmFlushTimer.description: Maximum amount of time, in seconds, dirty lines or buckets may remain in the cache before they are flushed. A value of 0 indicated that a cache flush is not controlled by a flushing timer. This property is inherited from CIM_CacheMemory.

hwcmInstallDate.name: hwcmInstallDate
hwcmInstallDate.description: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwcmInstalledSize.name: hwcmInstalledSize
hwcmInstalledSize.description: Current size of the installed cache memory.

hwcmLastErrorCode.name: hwcmLastErrorCode
hwcmLastErrorCode.description: Last error code reported by the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcmLevel.name: hwcmLevel
hwcmLevel.description: Level of the cache. This property is inherited from CIM_CacheMemory.

hwcmLineSize.name: hwcmLineSize
hwcmLineSize.description: Size, in bytes, of a single cache bucket or line. This property is inherited from CIM_CacheMemory.

hwcmLocation.name: hwcmLocation
hwcmLocation.description: Physical location of the cache memory.

hwcmMaxCacheSize.name: hwcmMaxCacheSize
hwcmMaxCacheSize.description: Maximum cache size installable to this particular cache memory.

hwcmName.name: hwcmName
hwcmName.description: Label by which the object is known. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwcmNumberOfBlocks.name: hwcmNumberOfBlocks
hwcmNumberOfBlocks.description: Total number of consecutive blocks, each block the size of the value contained in the BlockSize property, which form this storage extent. Total size of the storage extent can be calculated by multiplying the value of the BlockSize property by the value of this property. If the value of BlockSize is 1, this property is the total size of the storage extent. This property is inherited from CIM_StorageExtent.

hwcmOtherErrorDescription.name: hwcmOtherErrorDescription
hwcmOtherErrorDescription.description: Free-form string providing more information if the ErrorType property is set to 1, Other. Otherwise, this string has no meaning. This property is inherited from CIM_Memory.

hwcmPNPDeviceID.name: hwcmPNPDeviceID
hwcmPNPDeviceID.description: Windows Plug and Play device identifier of the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: '*PNP030b'

hwcmPowerManagementCapabilities.name: hwcmPowerManagementCapabilities
hwcmPowerManagementCapabilities.description: Array of the specific power-related capabilities of a logical device. The Enabled value indicates that the power management features are currently enabled but the exact feature set is unknown or the information is unavailable. Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically indicates that a device can change its power state based on usage or other criteria. Power State Settable indicates that the SetPowerState method is supported. Power Cycling Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle). Timed Power On Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle) and Time set to a specific date and time, or interval, for power-on. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Not Supported 2 Disabled 3 Enabled 4 Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically 5 Power State Settable 6 Power Cycling Supported 7 Timed Power On Supported

hwcmPowerManagementSupported.name: hwcmPowerManagementSupported
hwcmPowerManagementSupported.description: If TRUE, the device can be power-managed (can be put into suspend mode, and so on). The property does not indicate that power management features are currently enabled, only that the logical device is capable of power management. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcmPurpose.name: hwcmPurpose
hwcmPurpose.description: Free-form string describing the media and/or its use. This property is inherited from CIM_StorageExtent.

hwcmReadPolicy.name: hwcmReadPolicy
hwcmReadPolicy.description: Policy that shall be employed by the cache for handling read requests. This property is inherited from CIM_CacheMemory.

hwcmReplacementPolicy.name: hwcmReplacementPolicy
hwcmReplacementPolicy.description: Algorithm to determine which cache lines or buckets should be re-used. This property is inherited from CIM_CacheMemory.

hwcmStartingAddress.name: hwcmStartingAddress
hwcmStartingAddress.description: Beginning address, referenced by an application or operating system and mapped by a memory controller, for this memory object. The starting address is specified in kilobytes. This property is inherited from CIM_Memory.

hwcmStatus.name: hwcmStatus
hwcmStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwcmStatusInfo.name: hwcmStatusInfo
hwcmStatusInfo.description: State of the logical device. If this property does not apply to the logical device, the value 5 (Not Applicable) should be used. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcmSupportedSRAM.name: hwcmSupportedSRAM
hwcmSupportedSRAM.description: Array of supported types of Static Random Access Memory (SRAM) that can be used for the cache memory. Value Meaning 0 Other 1 Unknown 2 Non-Burst 3 Burst 4 Pipeline Burst 5 Synchronous 6 Asynchronous

hwcmSystemCreationClassName.name: hwcmSystemCreationClassName
hwcmSystemCreationClassName.description: Value of the scoping computer's CreationClassName property. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcmSystemLevelAddress.name: hwcmSystemLevelAddress
hwcmSystemLevelAddress.description: If TRUE, the address information in the property ErrorAddress is a system-level address. If FALSE, it is a physical address. If the ErrorInfo property is equal to 3, then this property has no meaning. This property is inherited from CIM_Memory.

hwcmSystemName.name: hwcmSystemName
hwcmSystemName.description: Name of the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcmWritePolicy.name: hwcmWritePolicy
hwcmWritePolicy.description: Write policy definition. This property is inherited from CIM_CacheMemory.

win32DeviceMemoryAddressTable.name: win32DeviceMemoryAddressTable
win32DeviceMemoryAddressTable.description: The Win32_DeviceMemoryAddress WMI class represents a device memory address on a Windows system.

hwdaIndex.name: hwdaIndex
hwdaIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwdaCaption.name: hwdaCaption
hwdaCaption.description: Short description of the object a one-line string. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwdaCreationClassName.name: hwdaCreationClassName
hwdaCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class that appears in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be identified uniquely. This property is inherited from CIM_MemoryMappedIO.

hwdaCSCreationClassName.name: hwdaCSCreationClassName
hwdaCSCreationClassName.description: Name of the scoping computer system creation class. This property is inherited from CIM_MemoryMappedIO.

hwdaCSName.name: hwdaCSName
hwdaCSName.description: Name of the scoping computer system. This property is inherited from CIM_MemoryMappedIO.

hwdaDescription.name: hwdaDescription
hwdaDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwdaEndingAddress.name: hwdaEndingAddress
hwdaEndingAddress.description: Ending address of memory-mapped I/O. This property is inherited from CIM_MemoryMappedIO.

hwdaInstallDate.name: hwdaInstallDate
hwdaInstallDate.description: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwdaMemoryType.name: hwdaMemoryType
hwdaMemoryType.description: Characteristics of the memory resource on the Windows system.

hwdaName.name: hwdaName
hwdaName.description: Label by which the object is known. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwdaStartingAddress.name: hwdaStartingAddress
hwdaStartingAddress.description: Starting address of memory-mapped I/O. The hardware resource identifier property should be set to this value to construct the mapped I/O resource key. This property is inherited from CIM_MemoryMappedIO.

hwdaStatus.name: hwdaStatus
hwdaStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

win32DMAChannelTable.name: win32DMAChannelTable
win32DMAChannelTable.description: The Win32_DMAChannel WMI class represents a direct memory access (DMA) channel on a Windows computer system. DMA is a method of moving data from a device to memory (or vice versa) without the help of the microprocessor. The system board uses a DMA controller to handle a fixed number of channels, each of which can be used by one (and only one) device at a time.

hwdmaIndex.name: hwdmaIndex
hwdmaIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwdmaAddressSize.name: hwdmaAddressSize
hwdmaAddressSize.description: DMA channel address size in bits. Permissible values are 8, 16, 32 or 64 bits. If unknown, enter 0 (zero). This property is inherited from CIM_DMA.

hwdmaAvailability.name: hwdmaAvailability
hwdmaAvailability.description: Availability of the DMA. This property is inherited from CIM_DMA.

hwdmaBurstMode.name: hwdmaBurstMode
hwdmaBurstMode.description: Indicates whether or not the DMA channel supports burst mode. This property is inherited from CIM_DMA.

hwdmaByteMode.name: hwdmaByteMode
hwdmaByteMode.description: DMA execution mode. This property is inherited from CIM_DMA.

hwdmaCaption.name: hwdmaCaption
hwdmaCaption.description: Short description of the object a one-line string. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwdmaChannelTiming.name: hwdmaChannelTiming
hwdmaChannelTiming.description: DMA channel timing. This property is inherited from CIM_DMA.

hwdmaCreationClassName.name: hwdmaCreationClassName
hwdmaCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class to appear in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be uniquely identified. This property is inherited from CIM_DMA.

hwdmaCSCreationClassName.name: hwdmaCSCreationClassName
hwdmaCSCreationClassName.description: Name of the scoping computer system creation class. This property is inherited from CIM_DMA.

hwdmaCSName.name: hwdmaCSName
hwdmaCSName.description: Name of the scoping computer system. This property is inherited from CIM_DMA.

hwdmaDescription.name: hwdmaDescription
hwdmaDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwdmaDMAChannel.name: hwdmaDMAChannel
hwdmaDMAChannel.description: DMA channel number, part of the object's key value. This property is inherited from CIM_DMA.

hwdmaInstallDate.name: hwdmaInstallDate
hwdmaInstallDate.description: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwdmaMaxTransferSize.name: hwdmaMaxTransferSize
hwdmaMaxTransferSize.description: Maximum number of bytes that can be transferred by this DMA channel. If unknown, enter 0 (zero). This property is inherited from CIM_DMA.

hwdmaName.name: hwdmaName
hwdmaName.description: Label by which the object is known. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwdmaPort.name: hwdmaPort
hwdmaPort.description: DMA port used by the host bus adapter. This is meaningful for MCA-type buses. Example: 12

hwdmaStatus.name: hwdmaStatus
hwdmaStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwdmaTransferWidths.name: hwdmaTransferWidths
hwdmaTransferWidths.description: Array of all the transfer widths (in bits) supported by this DMA channel. If unknown, enter 0 (zero). This property is inherited from CIM_DMA.

hwdmaTypeCTiming.name: hwdmaTypeCTiming
hwdmaTypeCTiming.description: Support for C type (burst) timing. This property is inherited from CIM_DMA.

hwdmaWordMode.name: hwdmaWordMode
hwdmaWordMode.description: DMA execution mode. This property is inherited from CIM_DMA.

win32FloppyControllerTable.name: win32FloppyControllerTable
win32FloppyControllerTable.description: The Win32_FloppyController WMI class represents the capabilities and management capacity of a floppy disk drive controller.

hwfcIndex.name: hwfcIndex
hwfcIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwfcAvailability.name: hwfcAvailability
hwfcAvailability.description: Availability and status of the device. Power Save - Unknown indicates that the device is known to be in a power save mode, but its exact status is unknown; Power Save - Low Power Mode indicates that the device is in a power save state but still functioning, and may exhibit degraded performance; Power Save - Standby indicates that the device is not functioning but could be brought to full power quickly; and Power Save - Warning indicates that the device is in a warning state, though also in a power save mode. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfcCaption.name: hwfcCaption
hwfcCaption.description: Short description of the object a one-line string. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwfcConfigManagerErrorCode.name: hwfcConfigManagerErrorCode
hwfcConfigManagerErrorCode.description: Windows Configuration Manager error code. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfcConfigManagerUserConfig.name: hwfcConfigManagerUserConfig
hwfcConfigManagerUserConfig.description: If TRUE, the device is using a user-defined configuration. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfcCreationClassName.name: hwfcCreationClassName
hwfcCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class that appears in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be identified uniquely. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfcDescription.name: hwfcDescription
hwfcDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwfcDeviceID.name: hwfcDeviceID
hwfcDeviceID.description: Unique identifier of the floppy controller. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfcErrorCleared.name: hwfcErrorCleared
hwfcErrorCleared.description: If TRUE, the error reported in LastErrorCode is now cleared. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfcErrorDescription.name: hwfcErrorDescription
hwfcErrorDescription.description: More information about the error recorded in LastErrorCode, and information about any corrective actions that may be taken. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfcInstallDate.name: hwfcInstallDate
hwfcInstallDate.description: Date and time the object is installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwfcLastErrorCode.name: hwfcLastErrorCode
hwfcLastErrorCode.description: Last error code reported by the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfcManufacturer.name: hwfcManufacturer
hwfcManufacturer.description: Name of the floppy controller manufacturer. Example: 'Microsoft'

hwfcMaxNumberControlled.name: hwfcMaxNumberControlled
hwfcMaxNumberControlled.description: Maximum number of directly addressable entities that this controller supports. A value of 0 (zero) should be used if the number is unknown. This property is inherited from CIM_Controller.

hwfcName.name: hwfcName
hwfcName.description: Label for the object. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwfcPNPDeviceID.name: hwfcPNPDeviceID
hwfcPNPDeviceID.description: Windows Plug and Play device identifier for the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: '*PNP030b'

hwfcPowerManagementCapabilities.name: hwfcPowerManagementCapabilities
hwfcPowerManagementCapabilities.description: Array of the specific power-related capabilities of a logical device. The Enabled value indicates that the power management features are currently enabled, but the exact feature set is unknown or the information is unavailable. Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically indicates that a device can change its power state based on usage or other criteria. Power State Settable indicates that the SetPowerState method is supported. Power Cycling Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle). Timed Power On Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle) and Time set to a specific date and time, or interval, for power-on. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Not Supported 2 Disabled 3 Enabled 4 Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically 5 Power State Settable 6 Power Cycling Supported 7 Timed Power On Supported

hwfcPowerManagementSupported.name: hwfcPowerManagementSupported
hwfcPowerManagementSupported.description: If TRUE, the device can be power-managed, which means that it can be put into suspend mode, and so on. The property does not indicate that power management features are currently enabled, only that the logical device is capable of power management. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfcProtocolSupported.name: hwfcProtocolSupported
hwfcProtocolSupported.description: Protocol that the controller uses to access controlled devices. This property is inherited from CIM_Controller.

hwfcStatus.name: hwfcStatus
hwfcStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. hwfcStatusInfo.name: hwfcStatusInfo

hwfcSystemCreationClassName.name: hwfcSystemCreationClassName
hwfcSystemCreationClassName.description: Value of the scoping computer's CreationClassName property. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfcSystemName.name: hwfcSystemName
hwfcSystemName.description: Name of the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwfcTimeOfLastReset.name: hwfcTimeOfLastReset
hwfcTimeOfLastReset.description: Date and time the controller was last reset. This could mean the controller was powered down or reinitialized. This property is inherited from CIM_Controller.

win32IDEControllerTable.name: win32IDEControllerTable
win32IDEControllerTable.description: The Win32_IDEController WMI class manages the capabilities of an integrated device electronics (IDE) controller device.

hwideIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwideDeviceID.name: hwideDeviceID
hwideDeviceID.description: Unique identifier of the IDE controller with other devices on the system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwideErrorCleared.name: hwideErrorCleared
hwideErrorCleared.description: If TRUE, the error reported in LastErrorCode is now cleared. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwideErrorDescription.name: hwideErrorDescription
hwideErrorDescription.description: More information about the error recorded in LastErrorCode property, and information about any corrective actions that may be taken. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwideInstallDate.name: hwideInstallDate
hwideInstallDate.description: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwideLastErrorCode.name: hwideLastErrorCode
hwideLastErrorCode.description: Last error code reported by the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwideManufacturer.name: hwideManufacturer
hwideManufacturer.description: Manufacturer of the IDE controller device.

hwideMaxNumberControlled.name: hwideMaxNumberControlled
hwideMaxNumberControlled.description: Maximum number of directly addressable entities supportable by this controller. A value of 0 (zero) should be used if the number is unknown. This property is inherited from CIM_Controller.

hwideName.name: hwideName
hwideName.description: Label by which the object is known. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwidePNPDeviceID.name: hwidePNPDeviceID
hwidePNPDeviceID.description: Windows plug and play device ID of the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: *PNP030b

hwidePowerManagementCapabilities.name: hwidePowerManagementCapabilities
hwidePowerManagementCapabilities.description: Array of the specific power-related capabilities of a logical device. The Enabled value indicates that the power management features are currently enabled, but the exact feature set is unknown or the information is unavailable. Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically indicates that a device can change its power state based on usage or other criteria. Power State Settable indicates that the SetPowerState method is supported. Power Cycling Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle). Timed Power On Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle), and Time set to a specific date and time or interval for power-on. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Not Supported 2 Disabled 3 Enabled 4 Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically 5 Power State Settable 6 Power Cycling Supported 7 Timed Power On Supported

hwidePowerManagementSupported.name: hwidePowerManagementSupported
hwidePowerManagementSupported.description: If TRUE, the device can be power-managed put into suspend mode, and so on. The property does not indicate that power management features are currently enabled, only that the logical device is capable of power management. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwideProtocolSupported.name: hwideProtocolSupported
hwideProtocolSupported.description: Protocol used by the controller to access controlled devices. This property is inherited from CIM_Controller.

hwideStatus.name: hwideStatus
hwideStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwideStatusInfo.name: hwideStatusInfo
hwideStatusInfo.description: State of the logical device. If this property does not apply to the logical device, the value 5 (Not Applicable) should be used. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwideSystemCreationClassName.name: hwideSystemCreationClassName
hwideSystemCreationClassName.description: Value for the scoping computer's CreationClassName property. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwideSystemName.name: hwideSystemName
hwideSystemName.description: Name of the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwideTimeOfLastReset.name: hwideTimeOfLastReset
hwideTimeOfLastReset.description: Date and time this controller was last reset. This could mean the controller was powered down or reinitialized. This property is inherited from CIM_Controller.

win32InfraredDeviceTable.name: win32InfraredDeviceTable
win32InfraredDeviceTable.description: The Win32_InfraredDevice WMI class represents the capabilities and management of an infrared device.

hwidIndex.name: hwidIndex
hwidIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwidAvailability.name: hwidAvailability
hwidAvailability.description: Availability and status of the device. Power Save - Unknown indicates that the device is known to be in a power save mode, but its exact status is unknown; Power Save - Low Power Mode indicates that the device is in a power save state but still functioning, and may exhibit degraded performance; Power Save - Standby indicates that the device is not functioning but could be brought to full power quickly; and Power Save - Warning indicates that the device is in a warning state, though also in a power save mode. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwidCaption.name: hwidCaption

win32IRQResourceTable.name: win32IRQResourceTable
win32IRQResourceTable.description: The Win32_IRQResource WMI class represents an interrupt request line (IRQ) number on a Windows computer system. An interrupt request is a signal sent to the CPU by a device or program for time critical events. IRQ can be hardware or software-based.

hwirqIndex.name: hwirqIndex
hwirqIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwirqAvailability.name: hwirqAvailability
hwirqAvailability.description: Availability of the IRQ. This property is inherited from CIM_IRQ.

hwirqCaption.name: hwirqCaption
hwirqCaption.description: Short description of the object a one-line string. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwirqCreationClassName.name: hwirqCreationClassName
hwirqCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class to appear in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be uniquely identified. This property is inherited from CIM_IRQ.

hwirqCSCreationClassName.name: hwirqCSCreationClassName
hwirqCSCreationClassName.description: Name of the scoping computer system creation class. This property is inherited from CIM_IRQ.

hwirqCSName.name: hwirqCSName
