hwirqDescription.name: hwirqDescription
hwirqDescription.description: Textual description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwirqHardware.name: hwirqHardware
hwirqHardware.description: If TRUE, the interrupt is hardware or software based. A hardware IRQ is a physical wire from the peripheral to the programmable interrupt controller (PIC) chip through which the CPU can be notified of time-critical events. Some IRQ lines are reserved for standard devices such as the keyboard, floppy disk drives, and the system clock. A software interrupt allows applications to get the attention of the processor.

hwirqInstallDate.name: hwirqInstallDate
hwirqInstallDate.description: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwirqIRQNumber.name: hwirqIRQNumber
hwirqIRQNumber.description: Part of the object's key value. This property is inherited from CIM_IRQ.

hwirqName.name: hwirqName
hwirqName.description: Label by which the object is known. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwirqShareable.name: hwirqShareable
hwirqShareable.description: If TRUE, the IRQ can be shared. This property is inherited from CIM_IRQ.

hwirqStatus.name: hwirqStatus
hwirqStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwirqTriggerLevel.name: hwirqTriggerLevel
hwirqTriggerLevel.description: IRQ trigger level indicating whether the interrupt is triggered by the hardware signal going high (4) or low (3). This property is inherited from CIM_IRQ.

hwirqTriggerType.name: hwirqTriggerType
hwirqTriggerType.description: IRQ trigger type indicating whether edge- (4) or level-triggered (3) interrupts occur. This property is inherited from CIM_IRQ.

hwirqVector.name: hwirqVector
hwirqVector.description: Vector of the Windows IRQ resource. A vector contains the memory address to the function that will execute once the interrupt request is acknowledged by the CPU.

win32MemoryArrayTable.name: win32MemoryArrayTable
win32MemoryArrayTable.description: The Win32_MemoryArray WMI class represents the properties of the computer system memory array and mapped addresses.

hwmaIndex.name: hwmaIndex
hwmaIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwmaAccess.name: hwmaAccess
hwmaAccess.description: Type of media access available. This property is inherited from CIM_StorageExtent.

hwmaAdditionalErrorData.name: hwmaAdditionalErrorData
hwmaAdditionalErrorData.description: Array of additional error information. An example is Error Checking and Correcting (ECC) Syndrome, or the return of the check bits if a cyclical redundancy check (CRC) based ErrorMethodology value is used. In the latter case, if a single bit error is recognized and the CRC algorithm is known, it is possible to determine the exact bit that failed. This type of data (ECC Syndrome, Check Bit, Parity Bit data, or other vendor-supplied information) is included in this field. This property is used only when the ErrorInfo property is not equal to 3. This property is inherited from Win32_SMBIOSMemory.

hwmaAvailability.name: hwmaAvailability
hwmaAvailability.description: Availability and status of the device. Power Save - Unknown indicates that the device is known to be in a power save mode, but its exact status is unknown; Power Save - Low Power Mode indicates that the device is in a power save state but still functioning, and may exhibit degraded performance; Power Save - Standby indicates that the device is not functioning but could be brought to full power quickly; and Power Save - Warning indicates that the device is in a warning state, though also in a power save mode. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwmaBlockSize.name: hwmaBlockSize
hwmaBlockSize.description: Size in bytes of the blocks that form this storage extent. If unknown or if a block concept is not valid (for example, for aggregate extents, memory or logical disks), enter a 1. This property is inherited from CIM_StorageExtent.

hwmaCaption.name: hwmaCaption
hwmaCaption.description: Short description of the object a one-line string. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwmaConfigManagerErrorCode.name: hwmaConfigManagerErrorCode
hwmaConfigManagerErrorCode.description: Windows Configuration Manager error code. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwmaConfigManagerUserConfig.name: hwmaConfigManagerUserConfig
hwmaConfigManagerUserConfig.description: If TRUE, the device is using a user-defined configuration. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwmaCorrectableError.name: hwmaCorrectableError
hwmaCorrectableError.description: If TRUE, the most recent error was correctable. This property is not used if ErrorInfo is set to 3. This property is inherited from Win32_SMBIOSMemory.

hwmaCreationClassName.name: hwmaCreationClassName
hwmaCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class that appears in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be identified uniquely. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwmaDescription.name: hwmaDescription
hwmaDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwmaDeviceID.name: hwmaDeviceID
hwmaDeviceID.description: Unique identifier of the memory array. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: 'Memory Array 1'

hwmaEndingAddress.name: hwmaEndingAddress
hwmaEndingAddress.description: Ending address referenced by an application or operating system. This memory address is mapped by a memory controller for this memory object. This property is inherited from Win32_SMBIOSMemory.

hwmaErrorAccess.name: hwmaErrorAccess
hwmaErrorAccess.description: Type of memory access operation that caused the last error. This property is valid only when ErrorInfo is not set to 3. This property is inherited from Win32_SMBIOSMemory.

hwmaErrorAddress.name: hwmaErrorAddress
hwmaErrorAddress.description: Address of the last memory error. This property is used only when ErrorInfo is not set to 3. This property is inherited from Win32_SMBIOSMemory.

hwmaErrorCleared.name: hwmaErrorCleared
hwmaErrorCleared.description: If TRUE, the error reported in LastErrorCode is now cleared. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwmaErrorData.name: hwmaErrorData
hwmaErrorData.description: Array of data captured from the last memory access with an error. The data occupies the first n octets of the array necessary to hold the number of bits specified by the ErrorTransferSize property. If ErrorTransferSize is 0 (zero), then this property is not used. This property is inherited from Win32_SMBIOSMemory.

hwmaErrorDataOrder.name: hwmaErrorDataOrder
hwmaErrorDataOrder.description: Ordering for data stored in the ErrorData property. This property is used only when ErrorTransferSize is 0 (zero). This property is inherited from Win32_SMBIOSMemory.

hwmaErrorDescription.name: hwmaErrorDescription
hwmaErrorDescription.description: More information about the error recorded in LastErrorCode, and information about any corrective actions that may be taken. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwmaErrorGranularity.name: hwmaErrorGranularity
hwmaErrorGranularity.description: Level where the error can be resolved.

hwmaErrorInfo.name: hwmaErrorInfo
hwmaErrorInfo.description: Type of error that occurred most recently. The values 12-14, which indicate whether an error is correctable, are not used with this property but this information is found in the CorrectableError property. This property is inherited from Win32_SMBIOSMemory.

hwmaErrorMethodology.name: hwmaErrorMethodology
hwmaErrorMethodology.description: Types of error checking used by the memory hardware. This property is inherited from CIM_StorageExtent.

hwmaErrorResolution.name: hwmaErrorResolution
hwmaErrorResolution.description: Amount of data actually determined to cause the error. This property is unused when the ErrorInfo property is set to 3. This property is inherited from Win32_SMBIOSMemory.

hwmaErrorTime.name: hwmaErrorTime
hwmaErrorTime.description: Time that the last memory error occurred. This property is valid only when ErrorInfo is not set to 3. This property is inherited from Win32_SMBIOSMemory.

hwmaErrorTransferSize.name: hwmaErrorTransferSize
hwmaErrorTransferSize.description: Size of the data (containing the last error) being transferred. This property is set to 0 (zero) if there is no error. This property is inherited from Win32_SMBIOSMemory.

hwmaInstallDate.name: hwmaInstallDate
hwmaInstallDate.description: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwmaLastErrorCode.name: hwmaLastErrorCode
hwmaLastErrorCode.description: Last error code reported by the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwmaName.name: hwmaName
hwmaName.description: Label by which the object is known. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwmaNumberOfBlocks.name: hwmaNumberOfBlocks
hwmaNumberOfBlocks.description: Total number of consecutive blocks, each block the size of the value contained in the BlockSize property, which form this storage extent. Total size of the storage extent can be calculated by multiplying the value of the BlockSize property by the value of this property. If the value of BlockSize is 1, this property is the total size of the storage extent. This property is inherited from CIM_StorageExtent.

hwmaOtherErrorDescription.name: hwmaOtherErrorDescription
hwmaOtherErrorDescription.description: More information when the ErrorInfo property is set to 1. This property is inherited from Win32_SMBIOSMemory.

hwmmErrorDescription.description: More information about the error recorded in LastErrorCode, and information about any corrective actions that may be taken. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwmmErrorGranularity.name: hwmmErrorGranularity
hwmmErrorGranularity.description: Level where the error can be resolved.

hwmmErrorInfo.name: hwmmErrorInfo
hwmmErrorInfo.description: Type of error that occurred most recently. The values 12-14, indicating whether an error is correctable, are not used with this property but this information is found in the CorrectableError property. This property is inherited from Win32_SMBIOSMemory.

hwmmErrorMethodology.name: hwmmErrorMethodology
hwmmErrorMethodology.description: Types of error checking used by the memory hardware. This property is inherited from CIM_StorageExtent.

hwmmErrorResolution.name: hwmmErrorResolution
hwmmErrorResolution.description: Amount of data actually determined to cause the error. This property is unused when the ErrorInfo property is set to 3. This property is inherited from Win32_SMBIOSMemory.

hwmmErrorTime.name: hwmmErrorTime
hwmmErrorTime.description: Time that the last memory error occurred. This property is valid only when ErrorInfo is not set to 3. This property is inherited from Win32_SMBIOSMemory.

hwmmErrorTransferSize.name: hwmmErrorTransferSize
hwmmErrorTransferSize.description: Size of the data (containing the last error) being transferred. This property is set to 0 (zero) if there is no error. This property is inherited from Win32_SMBIOSMemory.

hwmmInstallDate.name: hwmmInstallDate
hwmmInstallDate.description: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwmmLastErrorCode.name: hwmmLastErrorCode
hwmmLastErrorCode.description: Last error code reported by the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwmmName.name: hwmmName
hwmmName.description: Label by which the object is known. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwmmNumberOfBlocks.name: hwmmNumberOfBlocks
hwmmNumberOfBlocks.description: Total number of consecutive blocks, each block the size of the value contained in the BlockSize property, which form this storage extent. Total size of the storage extent can be calculated by multiplying the value of the BlockSize property by the value of this property. If the value of BlockSize is 1, this property is the total size of the storage extent. This property is inherited from CIM_StorageExtent.

hwmmOtherErrorDescription.name: hwmmOtherErrorDescription
hwmmOtherErrorDescription.description: More information when the ErrorInfo property is set to 1. This property is inherited from Win32_SMBIOSMemory.

hwmmPNPDeviceID.name: hwmmPNPDeviceID
hwmmPNPDeviceID.description: Windows Plug and Play device identifier of the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: '*PNP030b'

hwmmPowerManagementCapabilities.name: hwmmPowerManagementCapabilities
hwmmPowerManagementCapabilities.description: Array of the specific power-related capabilities of a logical device. The Enabled value indicates that the power management features are currently enabled but the exact feature set is unknown or the information is unavailable. Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically indicates that a device can change its power state based on usage or other criteria. Power State Settable indicates that the SetPowerState method is supported. Power Cycling Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle). Timed Power On Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle) and Time set to a specific date and time, or interval, for power-on. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Not Supported 2 Disabled 3 Enabled 4 Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically 5 Power State Settable 6 Power Cycling Supported 7 Timed Power On Supported

hwmmPowerManagementSupported.name: hwmmPowerManagementSupported
hwmmPowerManagementSupported.description: If TRUE, the device can be power-managed (can be put into suspend mode, and so on). The property does not indicate that power management features are currently enabled, only that the logical device is capable of power management. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwmmPurpose.name: hwmmPurpose
hwmmPurpose.description: Free-form string describing the media and/or its use. This property is inherited from CIM_StorageExtent.

hwmmStartingAddress.name: hwmmStartingAddress
hwmmStartingAddress.description: Beginning address referenced by an application or the operating system. This memory address is mapped by a memory controller for this memory object. This property is inherited from Win32_SMBIOSMemory.

hwmmStatus.name: hwmmStatus
hwmmStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwmmStatusInfo.name: hwmmStatusInfo
hwmmStatusInfo.description: State of the logical device. If this property does not apply to the logical device, the value 5 (Not Applicable) should be used. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwmmSystemCreationClassName.name: hwmmSystemCreationClassName
hwmmSystemCreationClassName.description: Value of the scoping computer's CreationClassName property. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwmmSystemLevelAddress.name: hwmmSystemLevelAddress
hwmmSystemLevelAddress.description: If TRUE, the address information in the ErrorAddress property is a system-level address. If FALSE, it is a physical address. This property is used only when ErrorInfo is not set to 3. This property is inherited from Win32_SMBIOSMemory.

hwmmSystemName.name: hwmmSystemName
hwmmSystemName.description: Name of the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwobIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwobCaption.name: hwobCaption
hwobCaption.description: Short description (one-line string) of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwobCreationClassName.name: hwobCreationClassName
hwobCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class to appear in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be uniquely identified. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwobDescription.name: hwobDescription
hwobDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwobEnabled.name: hwobEnabled
hwobEnabled.description: If TRUE, the on-board device is available for use.

hwobHotSwappable.name: hwobHotSwappable
hwobHotSwappable.description: If TRUE, a physical package can be hot-swapped (if it is possible to replace the element with a physically different but equivalent one while the containing package has power applied to it). For example, a disk drive package inserted using SCA connectors is removable and can be hot-swapped. All packages that can be hot-swapped are inherently removable and replaceable. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalComponent.

hwobInstallDate.name: hwobInstallDate
hwobInstallDate.description: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwobManufacturer.name: hwobManufacturer
hwobManufacturer.description: Name of the organization responsible for producing the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwobModel.name: hwobModel
hwobModel.description: Name by which the physical element is generally known. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwobName.name: hwobName
hwobName.description: Label by which the object is known. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwobOtherIdentifyingInfo.name: hwobOtherIdentifyingInfo
hwobOtherIdentifyingInfo.description: Additional data, beyond asset tag information, that could be used to identify a physical element. One example is bar code data associated with an element that also has an asset tag. Note that if only bar code data is available and is unique/able to be used as an element key, this property would be NULL and the bar code data used as the class key, in the tag property. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwobPartNumber.name: hwobPartNumber
hwobPartNumber.description: Part number assigned by the organization responsible for producing or manufacturing the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwobPoweredOn.name: hwobPoweredOn
hwobPoweredOn.description: If TRUE, the physical element is powered on. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwobRemovable.name: hwobRemovable
hwobRemovable.description: If TRUE, a physical package is removable (if it is designed to be taken in and out of the physical container in which it is normally found, without impairing the function of the overall packaging). A package can still be removable if power must be 'off' to perform the removal. If power can be 'on' and the package removed, then the element is removable and can be hot-swapped. For example, an extra battery in a laptop is removable, as is a disk drive package inserted using SCA connectors. However, the latter can be hot-swapped. A laptop's display is not removable, nor is a non-redundant power supply. Removing these components would affect the function of the overall packaging or is impossible due to the tight integration of the package. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalComponent.

hwobReplaceable.name: hwobReplaceable
hwobReplaceable.description: If TRUE, a physical package is replaceable (if it is possible to replace, FRU or upgrade, the element with a physically different one). For example, some computer systems allow the main processor chip to be upgraded to one of a higher clock rating. In this case, the processor is said to be replaceable. Another example is a power supply package mounted on sliding rails. All removable packages are inherently replaceable. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalComponent.

hwobSerialNumber.name: hwobSerialNumber
hwobSerialNumber.description: Manufacturer-allocated number used to identify the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwobSKU.name: hwobSKU
hwobSKU.description: Stock-keeping unit number for the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwobStatus.name: hwobStatus
hwobStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwobTag.name: hwobTag
hwobTag.description: Unique identifier of the on-board device connected to the system. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement. Example: 'On Board Device 1'

hwobVersion.name: hwobVersion
hwobVersion.description: Version of the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Not Supported 2 Disabled 3 Enabled 4 Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically 5 Power State Settable 6 Power Cycling Supported 7 Timed Power On Supported

hwpcmPowerManagementSupported.name: hwpcmPowerManagementSupported
hwpcmPowerManagementSupported.description: If TRUE, the device can be power-managed (can be put into suspend mode, and so on). The property does not indicate that power management features are currently enabled, only that the logical device is capable of power management. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpcmProtocolSupported.name: hwpcmProtocolSupported
hwpcmProtocolSupported.description: Protocol used by the controller to access 'controlled' devices. This property is inherited from CIM_Controller.

hwpcmStatus.name: hwpcmStatus
hwpcmStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpcmStatusInfo.name: hwpcmStatusInfo
hwpcmStatusInfo.description: State of the logical device. If this property does not apply to the logical device, the value 5 (Not Applicable) should be used. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpcmSystemCreationClassName.name: hwpcmSystemCreationClassName
hwpcmSystemCreationClassName.description: Value of the scoping computer's CreationClassName property. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpcmSystemName.name: hwpcmSystemName
hwpcmSystemName.description: Name of the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpcmTimeOfLastReset.name: hwpcmTimeOfLastReset
hwpcmTimeOfLastReset.description: Date and time the controller was last reset. This could mean the controller was powered down, or reinitialized. This property is inherited from CIM_Controller.

win32PhysicalMemoryTable.name: win32PhysicalMemoryTable
win32PhysicalMemoryTable.description: The Win32_PhysicalMemory WMI class represents a physical memory device located on a computer system and available to the operating system.

hwpmmIndex.name: hwpmmIndex
hwpmmIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwpmmBankLabel.name: hwpmmBankLabel
hwpmmBankLabel.description: Physically-labeled bank where the memory is located. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalMemory. Examples: 'Bank 0', 'Bank A'

hwpmmCapacity.name: hwpmmCapacity
hwpmmCapacity.description: Total capacity of the physical memory in bytes. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalMemory.

hwpmmCaption.name: hwpmmCaption
hwpmmCaption.description: Short description of the object a one-line string. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpmmCreationClassName.name: hwpmmCreationClassName
hwpmmCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class that appears in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be identified uniquely. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwpmmDataWidth.name: hwpmmDataWidth
hwpmmDataWidth.description: Data width of the physical memory in bits. A data width of 0 (zero) and a total width of 8 indicates that the memory is used solely to provide error correction bits. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalMemory.

hwpmmDescription.name: hwpmmDescription
hwpmmDescription.description: Description of an object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpmmDeviceLocator.name: hwpmmDeviceLocator
hwpmmDeviceLocator.description: Label of the socket or circuit board that holds the memory. Example: 'SIMM 3'

hwpmmFormFactor.name: hwpmmFormFactor
hwpmmFormFactor.description: Implementation form factor for the chip. This property is inherited from CIM_Chip.

hwpmmHotSwappable.name: hwpmmHotSwappable
hwpmmHotSwappable.description: If TRUE, a physical component can be hot-swapped if it is possible to replace the element with a physically different but equivalent one while the containing package has power applied to it, is 'on'. For example, a fan component may be designed to be hot-swapped. All components that can be hot-swapped are inherently removable and replaceable. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalComponent.

hwpmmInstallDate.name: hwpmmInstallDate
hwpmmInstallDate.description: Date and time the object is installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpmmInterleaveDataDepth.name: hwpmmInterleaveDataDepth
hwpmmInterleaveDataDepth.description: Unsigned 16-bit integer maximum number of consecutive rows of data that are accessed in a single interleaved transfer from the memory device. If the value is 0 (zero), the memory is not interleaved.

hwpmmInterleavePosition.name: hwpmmInterleavePosition
hwpmmInterleavePosition.description: Position of the physical memory in an interleave. For example, in a 2:1 interleave, a value of '1' indicates that the memory is in the 'even' position. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalMemory.

hwpmmManufacturer.name: hwpmmManufacturer
hwpmmManufacturer.description: Name of the organization responsible for producing the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwpmmMemoryType.name: hwpmmMemoryType
hwpmmMemoryType.description: Type of physical memory. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalMemory.

hwpmmModel.name: hwpmmModel
hwpmmModel.description: Name for the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwpmmName.name: hwpmmName
hwpmmName.description: Label for the object. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpmmOtherIdentifyingInfo.name: hwpmmOtherIdentifyingInfo
hwpmmOtherIdentifyingInfo.description: Additional data, beyond asset tag information, that can be used to identify a physical element. One example is bar code data associated with an element that also has an asset tag. If only bar code data is available and unique or able to be used as an element key, this property is be NULL and the bar code data is used as the class key in the tag property. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwpmmPartNumber.name: hwpmmPartNumber
hwpmmPartNumber.description: Part number assigned by the organization responsible for producing or manufacturing the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwpmmPositionInRow.name: hwpmmPositionInRow
hwpmmPositionInRow.description: Position of the physical memory in a row. For example, if it takes two 8-bit memory devices to form a 16-bit row, then a value of 2 means that this memory is the second device 0 (zero) is an invalid value for this property. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalMemory.

hwpmmPoweredOn.name: hwpmmPoweredOn
hwpmmPoweredOn.description: If TRUE, the physical element is powered on. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwpmmRemovable.name: hwpmmRemovable
hwpmmRemovable.description: If TRUE, a physical component is removable (if it is designed to be taken in and out of the physical container in which it is normally found, without impairing the function of the overall packaging). A component can still be removable if power must be 'off' in order to perform the removal. If power can be 'on' and the component removed, then the element is removable and can be hot-swapped. For example, an upgradable processor chip is removable. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalComponent.

hwpmmReplaceable.name: hwpmmReplaceable
hwpmmReplaceable.description: If TRUE, a physical component is replaceable (if it is possible to replace, FRU or upgrade, the element with a physically different one). For example, some computer systems allow the main processor chip to be upgraded to one of a higher clock rating. In this case, the processor is said to be replaceable. All removable components are inherently replaceable. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalComponent.

hwpmmSerialNumber.name: hwpmmSerialNumber
hwpmmSerialNumber.description: Manufacturer-allocated number to identify the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwpmmSKU.name: hwpmmSKU
hwpmmSKU.description: Stock-keeping unit number for the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwpmmSpeed.name: hwpmmSpeed
hwpmmSpeed.description: Speed of the physical memory in nanoseconds. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalMemory.

hwpmmStatus.name: hwpmmStatus
hwpmmStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpmmTag.name: hwpmmTag
hwpmmTag.description: Unique identifier for the physical memory device that is represented by an instance of Win32_PhysicalMemory. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement. Example: 'Physical Memory 1'

hwpmmTotalWidth.name: hwpmmTotalWidth
hwpmmTotalWidth.description: Total width, in bits, of the physical memory, including check or error correction bits. If there are no error correction bits, the value in this property should match what is specified for the DataWidth property. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalMemory.

hwpmmVersion.name: hwpmmVersion
hwpmmVersion.description: Version of the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

win32PhysicalMemoryArrayTable.name: win32PhysicalMemoryArrayTable
win32PhysicalMemoryArrayTable.description: The Win32_PhysicalMemoryArray WMI class represents details about the computer system physical memory. This includes the number of memory devices, memory capacity available, and memory type for example, system or video memory.

hwpmaIndex.name: hwpmaIndex
hwpmaIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwpmaCaption.name: hwpmaCaption
hwpmaCaption.description: Short description of the object a one-line string. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpmaCreationClassName.name: hwpmaCreationClassName
hwpmaCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class that appears in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be identified uniquely. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwpmaDepth.name: hwpmaDepth
hwpmaDepth.description: Depth of the physical package in inches. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalPackage.

hwpmaDescription.name: hwpmaDescription
hwpmaDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpmaHeight.name: hwpmaHeight
hwpmaHeight.description: Height of the physical package in inches. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalPackage.

hwpmaHotSwappable.name: hwpmaHotSwappable
hwpmaHotSwappable.description: If TRUE, a physical package can be hot-swapped (if it is possible to replace the element with a physically different but equivalent one while the containing package has power applied to it, is 'on'). For example, a disk drive package inserted using SCA connectors is removable and can be hot-swapped. All packages that can be hot-swapped are inherently removable and replaceable. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalPackage.

hwpmaInstallDate.name: hwpmaInstallDate
hwpmaInstallDate.description: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpmaLocation.name: hwpmaLocation
hwpmaLocation.description: Physical location of the memory array.

hwpmaManufacturer.name: hwpmaManufacturer
hwpmaManufacturer.description: Name of the organization responsible for producing the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwpmaMaxCapacity.name: hwpmaMaxCapacity
hwpmaMaxCapacity.description: Maximum memory size (in bytes) installable for this particular memory array. If the size is unknown, the property is given a value of 0 (zero).

hwpmaMemoryDevices.name: hwpmaMemoryDevices
hwpmaMemoryDevices.description: Number of physical slots or sockets available in this memory array.

hwpmaMemoryErrorCorrection.name: hwpmaMemoryErrorCorrection
hwpmaMemoryErrorCorrection.description: Type of error correction used by the memory array.

hwpmaModel.name: hwpmaModel
hwpmaModel.description: Name by which the physical element is generally known. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwpmaName.name: hwpmaName
hwpmaName.description: Label by which the object is known. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpmaOtherIdentifyingInfo.name: hwpmaOtherIdentifyingInfo
hwpmaOtherIdentifyingInfo.description: Additional data, beyond asset tag information, that could be used to identify a physical element. One example is bar code data associated with an element that also has an asset tag. Note that if only bar code data is available and is unique/able to be used as an element key, this property would be NULL and the bar code data used as the class key, in the tag property. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwpmaPartNumber.name: hwpmaPartNumber
hwpmaPartNumber.description: Part number assigned by the organization responsible for producing or manufacturing the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwpmaPoweredOn.name: hwpmaPoweredOn
hwpmaPoweredOn.description: If TRUE, the physical element is powered on. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwpmaRemovable.name: hwpmaRemovable
hwpmaRemovable.description: If TRUE, a physical package is removable (if it is designed to be taken in and out of the physical container in which it is normally found, without impairing the function of the overall packaging). A package can still be removable if power must be 'off' in order to perform the removal. If power can be 'on' and the package removed, then the element is removable and can be hot-swapped. For example, an extra battery in a laptop is removable, as is a disk drive package inserted using SCA connectors. However, the latter can be hot-swapped. A laptop's display is not removable, nor is a non-redundant power supply. Removing these components would affect the function of the overall packaging or is impossible due to the tight integration of the package. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalPackage.

hwpmaReplaceable.name: hwpmaReplaceable
hwpmaReplaceable.description: If TRUE, a physical package is replaceable (if it is possible to replace, FRU or upgrade, the element with a physically different one). For example, some computer systems allow the main processor chip to be upgraded to one of a higher clock rating. In this case, the processor is said to be replaceable. Another example is a power supply package mounted on sliding rails. All removable packages are inherently replaceable. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalPackage.

hwpmaSerialNumber.name: hwpmaSerialNumber
hwpmaSerialNumber.description: Manufacturer-allocated number used to identify the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwpmaSKU.name: hwpmaSKU
hwpmaSKU.description: Stockkeeping unit number for the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwpmaStatus.name: hwpmaStatus
hwpmaStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement

hwpmaTag.name: hwpmaTag
hwpmaTag.description: Unique identifier of the physical memory array. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement. Example: 'Physical Memory Array 1'

hwpmaUse.name: hwpmaUse
hwpmaUse.description: How memory is used in the computer system.

hwpmaVersion.name: hwpmaVersion
hwpmaVersion.description: Version of the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwpmaWeight.name: hwpmaWeight
hwpmaWeight.description: Weight of the physical package in pounds. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalPackage.

hwpmaWidth.name: hwpmaWidth
hwpmaWidth.description: Width of the physical package in inches. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalPackage.

win32PnPEntityTable.name: win32PnPEntityTable
win32PnPEntityTable.description: The Win32_PnPEntity WMI class represents the properties of a Plug and Play device. Plug and Play entities are shown as entries in the Device Manager located in Control Panel.

hwpnpIndex.name: hwpnpIndex
hwpnpIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwpnpAvailability.name: hwpnpAvailability
hwpnpAvailability.description: Availability and status of the device. Power Save - Unknown indicates that the device is known to be in a power save mode, but its exact status is unknown; Power Save - Low Power Mode indicates that the device is in a power save state but still functioning, and may exhibit degraded performance; Power Save - Standby indicates that the device is not functioning but could be brought to full power quickly; and Power Save - Warning indicates that the device is in a warning state, though also in a power save mode. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpnpCaption.name: hwpnpCaption
hwpnpCaption.description: Short description (one-line string) of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpnpClassGuid.name: hwpnpClassGuid
hwpnpClassGuid.description: Globally unique identifier (GUID) of this Plug and Play device.

hwpnpConfigManagerErrorCode.name: hwpnpConfigManagerErrorCode
hwpnpConfigManagerErrorCode.description: Windows Configuration Manager error code. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpnpConfigManagerUserConfig.name: hwpnpConfigManagerUserConfig
hwpnpConfigManagerUserConfig.description: If TRUE, the device is using a user-defined configuration. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpnpCreationClassName.name: hwpnpCreationClassName
hwpnpCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class to appear in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be uniquely identified. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpnpDescription.name: hwpnpDescription
hwpnpDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpnpDeviceID.name: hwpnpDeviceID
hwpnpDeviceID.description: Identifier of the Plug and Play device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpnpErrorCleared.name: hwpnpErrorCleared
hwpnpErrorCleared.description: If TRUE, the error reported in LastErrorCode is now cleared. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpnpErrorDescription.name: hwpnpErrorDescription
hwpnpErrorDescription.description: More information about the error recorded in LastErrorCode, and information on any corrective actions that may be taken. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpnpInstallDate.name: hwpnpInstallDate
hwpnpInstallDate.description: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpnpLastErrorCode.name: hwpnpLastErrorCode
hwpnpLastErrorCode.description: Last error code reported by the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpnpManufacturer.name: hwpnpManufacturer
hwpnpManufacturer.description: Name of the manufacturer of the Plug and Play device. Example: 'Acme'

hwpnpName.name: hwpnpName
hwpnpName.description: Label by which the object is known. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpnpPNPDeviceID.name: hwpnpPNPDeviceID
hwpnpPNPDeviceID.description: Windows Plug and Play device identifier of the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: '*PNP030b'

hwpnpPowerManagementCapabilities.name: hwpnpPowerManagementCapabilities
hwpnpPowerManagementCapabilities.description: Array of the specific power-related capabilities of a logical device. The Enabled value indicates that the power management features are currently enabled but the exact feature set is unknown or the information is unavailable. Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically indicates that a device can change its power state based on usage or other criteria. Power State Settable indicates that the SetPowerState method is supported. Power Cycling Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle). Timed Power On Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle) and Time set to a specific date and time, or interval, for power-on. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Not Supported 2 Disabled 3 Enabled 4 Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically 5 Power State Settable 6 Power Cycling Supported 7 Timed Power On Supported

hwpnpPowerManagementSupported.name: hwpnpPowerManagementSupported
hwpnpPowerManagementSupported.description: If TRUE, the device can be power-managed (can be put into suspend mode, and so on). The property does not indicate that power management features are currently enabled, only that the logical device is capable of power management. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpnpService.name: hwpnpService
hwpnpService.description: Name of the service that supports this Plug and Play device. For more information, see Win32_SystemDriverPnPEntity. Example: 'atapi'

hwpnpStatus.name: hwpnpStatus
hwpnpStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpnpStatusInfo.name: hwpnpStatusInfo
hwpnpStatusInfo.description: State of the logical device. If this property does not apply to the logical device, the value 5 (Not Applicable) should be used. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpnpSystemCreationClassName.name: hwpnpSystemCreationClassName
hwpnpSystemCreationClassName.description: Value of the scoping computer's CreationClassName property. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpnpSystemName.name: hwpnpSystemName
hwpnpSystemName.description: Name of the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

win32PnPSignedDriverTable.name: win32PnPSignedDriverTable
win32PnPSignedDriverTable.description: The Win32_PnPSignedDriver WMI class provides digital signature information about drivers.

hwpsdIndex.name: hwpsdIndex
hwpsdIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwpsdClassGuid.name: hwpsdClassGuid
hwpsdClassGuid.description: GUID of the device class. Example: '{71A27CDD-11D0-BEC7-08002BE2092F}'

hwpsdCompatID.name: hwpsdCompatID
hwpsdCompatID.description: Compatibility identifier for the driver. Example: 'DETECTEDInternal\ftdisk'

hwpsdDeviceClass.name: hwpsdDeviceClass
hwpsdDeviceClass.description: Device class of the driver. Example: 'SYSTEM'

hwpsdDeviceID.name: hwpsdDeviceID
hwpsdDeviceID.description: Device identifier of the device. Example: 'ROOT\FTDISK\0000'

hwpsdDriverDate.name: hwpsdDriverDate
hwpsdDriverDate.description: Build date of the driver (from the manufacturer). Example: '1-25-2001'

hwpsdFriendlyName.name: hwpsdFriendlyName
hwpsdFriendlyName.description: Friendly name of the driver. Example: 'Communications Port (COM2)'

hwpsdHardWareID.name: hwpsdHardWareID
hwpsdHardWareID.description: Hardware identifier for the driver. Example: 'ROOT\FTDISK'

hwpsdInfName.name: hwpsdInfName
hwpsdInfName.description: Name of the .inf file which installed the device. Example: 'machine.inf'

hwpsdInstallDate.name: hwpsdInstallDate
hwpsdInstallDate.description: Date the driver was installed. Lack of value does not indicate that the driver is not installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpsdIsSigned.name: hwpsdIsSigned
hwpsdIsSigned.description: If TRUE, the driver is signed.

hwpsdName.name: hwpsdName
hwpsdName.description: Name of the driver. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpsdPDO.name: hwpsdPDO
hwpsdPDO.description: Physical device object (PDO). PDOs represent individual devices on a bus. Other drivers for the device attach on top of the PDO. It is always at the bottom of the device stack. Example: '\Device\00000002'

hwpsdSigner.name: hwpsdSigner
hwpsdSigner.description: Signer of driver, if it is signed. Example: 'ntbuild'

hwpsdStarted.name: hwpsdStarted
hwpsdStarted.description: If TRUE, the driver is started. This property is inherited from CIM_Service.

hwpsdStartMode.name: hwpsdStartMode
hwpsdStartMode.description: Start mode of the driver. This property is inherited from CIM_Service.

hwpsdStatus.name: hwpsdStatus
hwpsdStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpsdSystemCreationClassName.name: hwpsdSystemCreationClassName
hwpsdSystemCreationClassName.description: Value of the scoping computer's CreationClassName property. This property is inherited from CIM_Service.

hwpsdSystemName.name: hwpsdSystemName
hwpsdSystemName.description: System name. This property is inherited from CIM_Service.

win32PortConnectorTable.name: win32PortConnectorTable
win32PortConnectorTable.description: The Win32_PortConnector WMI class represents physical connection ports, such as DB-25 pin male, Centronics, or PS/2.

hwpcIndex.name: hwpcIndex
hwpcIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwpcCaption.name: hwpcCaption
hwpcCaption.description: Short description of the object a one-line string. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpcConnectorPinout.name: hwpcConnectorPinout
hwpcConnectorPinout.description: Pin configuration and signal usage of a physical connector. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalConnector.

hwpcConnectorType.name: hwpcConnectorType
hwpcConnectorType.description: Array of physical attributes of the connector used by this port. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalConnector. Values are the following: Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Other 2 Male 3 Female 4 Shielded 5 Unshielded 6 SCSI (A) High-Density (50 pins) 7 SCSI (A) Low-Density (50 pins) 8 SCSI (P) High-Density (68 pins) 9 SCSI SCA-I (80 pins) 10 SCSI SCA-II (80 pins) 11 SCSI Fibre Channel (DB-9, Copper) 12 SCSI Fibre Channel (Fibre) 13 SCSI Fibre Channel SCA-II (40 pins) 14 SCSI Fibre Channel SCA-II (20 pins) 15 SCSI Fibre Channel BNC 16 ATA 3-1/2 Inch (40 pins) 17 ATA 2-1/2 Inch (44 pins) 18 ATA-2 19 ATA-3 20 ATA/66 21 DB-9 22 DB-15 23 DB-25 24 DB-36 25 RS-232C 26 RS-422 27 RS-423 28 RS-485 29 RS-449 30 V.35 31 X.21 32 IEEE-488 33 AUI 34 UTP Category 3 35 UTP Category 4 36 UTP Category 5 37 BNC 38 RJ11 39 RJ45 40 Fiber MIC 41 Apple AUI 42 Apple GeoPort 43 PCI 44 ISA 45 EISA 46 VESA 47 PCMCIA 48 PCMCIA Type I 49 PCMCIA Type II 50 PCMCIA Type III 51 ZV Port 52 CardBus 53 USB 54 IEEE 1394 55 HIPPI 56 HSSDC (6 pins) 57 GBIC 58 DIN 59 Mini-DIN 60 Micro-DIN 61 PS/2 62 Infrared 63 HP-HIL 64 Access.bus 65 NuBus 66 Centronics 67 Mini-Centronics 68 Mini-Centronics Type-14 69 Mini-Centronics Type-20 70 Mini-Centronics Type-26 71 Bus Mouse 72 ADB 73 AGP 74 VME Bus 75 VME64 76 Proprietary 77 Proprietary Processor Card Slot 78 Proprietary Memory Card Slot 79 Proprietary I/O Riser Slot 80 PCI-66MHZ 81 AGP2X 82 AGP4X 83 PC-98 84 PC-98-Hireso 85 PC-H98 86 PC-98Note 87 PC-98Full 88 SSA SCSI 89 Circular 90 On Board IDE Connector 91 On Board Floppy Connector 92 9 Pin Dual Inline 93 25 Pin Dual Inline 94 50 Pin Dual Inline 95 68 Pin Dual Inline 96 On Board Sound Connector 97 Mini-jack 98 PCI-X 99 Sbus IEEE 1396-1993 32 bit 100 Sbus IEEE 1396-1993 64 bit 101 MCA 102 GIO 103 XIO 104 HIO 105 NGIO 106 PMC 107 MTRJ 108 VF-45 109 Future I/O 110 SC 111 SG 112 Electrical 113 Optical 114 Ribbon 115 GLM 116 1x9 117 Mini SG 118 LC 119 HSSC 120 VHDCI Shielded (68 pins) 121 InfiniBand

hwpcCreationClassName.name: hwpcCreationClassName
hwpcCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class that appears in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be identified uniquely. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwpcDescription.name: hwpcDescription
hwpcDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpcExternalReferenceDesignator.name: hwpcExternalReferenceDesignator
hwpcExternalReferenceDesignator.description: External reference designator of the port. External reference designators are identifiers that determine the type and use of the port. Example: 'COM1'

hwpcInstallDate.name: hwpcInstallDate
hwpcInstallDate.description: Date and time the object is installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpcInternalReferenceDesignator.name: hwpcInternalReferenceDesignator
hwpcInternalReferenceDesignator.description: Internal reference designator of the port. Internal reference designators are specific to the manufacturer, and identify the circuit board location or use of the port. Example: 'J101'

hwpcManufacturer.name: hwpcManufacturer
hwpcManufacturer.description: Name of the organization responsible for producing the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwpcModel.name: hwpcModel
hwpcModel.description: Name for the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwpcName.name: hwpcName
hwpcName.description: Label for the object. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpcOtherIdentifyingInfo.name: hwpcOtherIdentifyingInfo
hwpcOtherIdentifyingInfo.description: Additional data, beyond asset tag information, that can be used to identify a physical element. One example is bar code data associated with an element that also has an asset tag. If only bar code data is available and unique or able to be used as an element key, this property is NULL and the bar code data is used as the class key in the tag property. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwpcPartNumber.name: hwpcPartNumber
hwpcPartNumber.description: Part number assigned by the organization responsible for producing or manufacturing the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwpcPoweredOn.name: hwpcPoweredOn
hwpcPoweredOn.description: If TRUE, the physical element is powered on. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwpcSerialNumber.name: hwpcSerialNumber
hwpcSerialNumber.description: Manufacturer-allocated number used to identify a physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwpcSKU.name: hwpcSKU
hwpcSKU.description: Stock-keeping unit number for a physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwpcStatus.name: hwpcStatus
hwpcStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpcTag.name: hwpcTag
hwpcTag.description: Unique identifier of a port connection on the computer system. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement. Example: 'Port Connector 1'

hwpcVersion.name: hwpcVersion
hwpcVersion.description: Version of the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

win32PortResourceTable.name: win32PortResourceTable
win32PortResourceTable.description: The Win32_PortResource WMI class represents an I/O port on a Windows computer system.

hwpreIndex.name: hwpreIndex
hwpreIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwpreAlias.name: hwpreAlias
hwpreAlias.description: If TRUE, this instance represents one of the ranges with an alias. If FALSE, the instance represents a base port address. A base port address is a predetermined port address dedicated to a specific service or device. A port alias address is one that a device responds to as if it were the actual address of an I/O port.

hwpreCaption.name: hwpreCaption
hwpreCaption.description: Short description (one-line string) of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpreCreationClassName.name: hwpreCreationClassName
hwpreCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class to appear in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be uniquely identified. This property is inherited from CIM_MemoryMappedIO.

hwpreCSCreationClassName.name: hwpreCSCreationClassName
hwpreCSCreationClassName.description: Creation class name of the scoping computer system. This property is inherited from CIM_MemoryMappedIO.

hwpreCSName.name: hwpreCSName
hwpreCSName.description: Name of the scoping computer system. This property is inherited from CIM_MemoryMappedIO.

hwpreDescription.name: hwpreDescription
hwpreDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpreEndingAddress.name: hwpreEndingAddress
hwpreEndingAddress.description: Ending address of memory mapped I/O. This property is inherited from CIM_MemoryMappedIO.

hwpreInstallDate.name: hwpreInstallDate
hwpreInstallDate.description: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpreName.name: hwpreName
hwpreName.description: Label by which the object is known. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpreStartingAddress.name: hwpreStartingAddress
hwpreStartingAddress.description: Starting address of memory mapped I/O. The hardware resource identifier property should be set to this value to construct the mapped I/O resource key. This property is inherited from CIM_MemoryMappedIO.

hwpreStatus.name: hwpreStatus
hwpreStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

win32ProcessorTable.name: win32ProcessorTable
win32ProcessorTable.description: The Win32_Processor WMI class represents a device that can interpret a sequence of machine instructions on a computer running a Windows operating system. On a multiprocessor machine, one instance of the Win32_Processor class exists for each processor.

hwcpuIndex.name: hwcpuIndex
hwcpuIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwcpuAddressWidth.name: hwcpuAddressWidth
hwcpuAddressWidth.description: Processor address width in bits. This property is inherited from CIM_Processor.

hwcpuArchitecture.name: hwcpuArchitecture
hwcpuArchitecture.description: Processor architecture that the platform uses.

hwcpuAvailability.name: hwcpuAvailability
hwcpuAvailability.description: Availability and status of a device. Power Save - Unknown indicates that a device is in a power save mode, but the status is unknown; Power Save - Low Power Mode indicates that a device is in a power save mode, but still functioning in a degraded performance state; Power Save - Standby indicates that a device is not functioning, but can be brought to full power quickly; and Power Save - Warning indicates that a device is in a warning and power save mode. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcpuCaption.name: hwcpuCaption
hwcpuCaption.description: Qualifier: MaxLen(64) Short description of an object a one-line string. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwcpuConfigManagerErrorCode.name: hwcpuConfigManagerErrorCode
hwcpuConfigManagerErrorCode.description: Error code for the Windows Configuration Manager. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcpuConfigManagerUserConfig.name: hwcpuConfigManagerUserConfig
hwcpuConfigManagerUserConfig.description: If TRUE, the device is using a configuration that the user defines. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcpuCpuStatus.name: hwcpuCpuStatus
hwcpuCpuStatus.description: Current status of the processor. Status changes indicate processor usage, not the physical condition of the processor.

hwcpuCreationClassName.name: hwcpuCreationClassName
hwcpuCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class that appears in the inheritance chain used to create an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be identified uniquely. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcpuCurrentClockSpeed.name: hwcpuCurrentClockSpeed
hwcpuCurrentClockSpeed.description: Current speed of the processor in MHz. This property is inherited from CIM_Processor.

hwcpuCurrentVoltage.name: hwcpuCurrentVoltage
hwcpuCurrentVoltage.description: Voltage of the processor. Bits 0-6 of the field contain the current voltage of the processor times 10. This value is only set when SMBIOS designates a voltage value. For specific values, see VoltageCaps. Example: field value for a processor voltage of 1.8 volts is 92h = 80h + (1.8 x 10) = 80h + 18 = 80h + 12h

hwcpuDataWidth.name: hwcpuDataWidth
hwcpuDataWidth.description: Processor data width in bits. This property is inherited from CIM_Processor.

hwcpuDescription.name: hwcpuDescription
hwcpuDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwcpuDeviceID.name: hwcpuDeviceID
hwcpuDeviceID.description: Unique identifier of a processor on the system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcpuErrorCleared.name: hwcpuErrorCleared
hwcpuErrorCleared.description: If TRUE, the error reported in LastErrorCode is clear. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcpuErrorDescription.name: hwcpuErrorDescription
hwcpuErrorDescription.description: More information about the error recorded in LastErrorCode, and information about corrective actions that can be taken. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcpuExtClock.name: hwcpuExtClock
hwcpuExtClock.description: External clock frequency in MHz. If the frequency is unknown, this property is set to NULL.

hwcpuFamily.name: hwcpuFamily
hwcpuFamily.description: Processor family type. This property is inherited from CIM_Processor.

hwcpuInstallDate.name: hwcpuInstallDate
hwcpuInstallDate.description: Date and time the object is installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwcpuL2CacheSize.name: hwcpuL2CacheSize
hwcpuL2CacheSize.description: Size of the Level 2 processor cache. A Level 2 cache is an external memory area that has a faster access time than the main RAM memory.

hwcpuL2CacheSpeed.name: hwcpuL2CacheSpeed
hwcpuL2CacheSpeed.description: Clock speed of the Level 2 processor cache. A Level 2 cache is an external memory area that has a faster access time than the main RAM memory.

hwcpuLastErrorCode.name: hwcpuLastErrorCode
hwcpuLastErrorCode.description: Last error code reported by the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcpuLevel.name: hwcpuLevel
hwcpuLevel.description: Definition of the processor type. The value depends on the architecture of the processor.

hwcpuLoadPercentage.name: hwcpuLoadPercentage
hwcpuLoadPercentage.description: Load capacity of each processor, averaged to the last second. Processor loading refers to the total computing burden for each processor at one time. This property is inherited from CIM_Processor.

hwcpuManufacturer.name: hwcpuManufacturer
hwcpuManufacturer.description: Name of the processor manufacturer. Example: A. Datum Corporation

hwcpuMaxClockSpeed.name: hwcpuMaxClockSpeed
hwcpuMaxClockSpeed.description: Maximum speed of the processor in MHz. This property is inherited from CIM_Processor.

hwcpuName.name: hwcpuName
hwcpuName.description: Label by which the object is known. When this property is a subclass, it can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwcpuOtherFamilyDescription.name: hwcpuOtherFamilyDescription
hwcpuOtherFamilyDescription.description: Processor family type. Used when the Family property is set to 1, which means Other. This string should be set to NULL when the Family property is a value that is not 1. This property is inherited from CIM_Processor.

hwcpuPNPDeviceID.name: hwcpuPNPDeviceID
hwcpuPNPDeviceID.description: Windows Plug and Play device identifier of the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: *PNP030b

hwcpuPowerManagementCapabilities.name: hwcpuPowerManagementCapabilities
hwcpuPowerManagementCapabilities.description: Specific power capabilities of a logical device. The Enabled value indicates that the power management features are currently enabled, but the exact setting is unknown or the information is unavailable. Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically indicates that a device can change its power state based on usage or other criteria. Power State Settable indicates that the SetPowerState method is supported. Power Cycling Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5. Timed Power On Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 and Time set to a specific date and time, or interval to power ON. This property is inherited from CIM_UnitaryComputerSystem. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Not Supported 2 Disabled 3 Enabled 4 Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically 5 Power State Settable 6 Power Cycling Supported 7 Timed Power On Supported

hwcpuPowerManagementSupported.name: hwcpuPowerManagementSupported
hwcpuPowerManagementSupported.description: If TRUE, the power of the device can be managed, which means that it can be put into suspend mode, and so on. The property does not indicate that power management features are enabled, but it does indicate that the logical device power can be managed. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcpuProcessorId.name: hwcpuProcessorId
hwcpuProcessorId.description: Processor information that describes the processor features. For an x86 class CPU, the field format depends on the processor support of the CPUID instruction. If the instruction is supported, the property contains 2 (two) DWORD formatted values. The first is an offset of 08h-0Bh, which is the EAX value that a CPUID instruction returns with input EAX set to 1. The second is an offset of 0Ch-0Fh, which is the EDX value that the instruction returns. Only the first two bytes of the property are significant and contain the contents of the DX register at CPU reset all others are set to 0 (zero), and the contents are in DWORD format.

hwcpuRevision.name: hwcpuRevision
hwcpuRevision.description: System revision level that depends on the architecture. The system revision level contains the same values as the Version property, but in a numerical format.

hwcpuRole.name: hwcpuRole
hwcpuRole.description: Role of the processor. This property is inherited from CIM_Processor. Examples: Central Processor or Math Processor

hwcpuSocketDesignation.name: hwcpuSocketDesignation
hwcpuSocketDesignation.description: Type of chip socket used on the circuit. Example: J202

hwcpuStatus.name: hwcpuStatus
hwcpuStatus.description: Current status of an object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: OK, Degraded, and Pred Fail, which is an element such as a SMART-enabled hard drive that may be functioning properly, but predicts a failure in the near future. Non-operational statuses include: Error, Starting, Stopping, and Service, which can apply during mirror resilvering of a disk, reloading a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all status work is online, but the managed element is not OK or in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwcpuStatusInfo.name: hwcpuStatusInfo
hwcpuStatusInfo.description: State of the logical device. If this property does not apply to the logical device, use the value 5, which means Not Applicable. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcpuStepping.name: hwcpuStepping
hwcpuStepping.description: Revision level of the processor in the processor family. This property is inherited from CIM_Processor.

hwcpuSystemCreationClassName.name: hwcpuSystemCreationClassName
hwcpuSystemCreationClassName.description: Value of the CreationClassName property for the scoping computer. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcpuSystemName.name: hwcpuSystemName
hwcpuSystemName.description: Name of the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcpuUniqueId.name: hwcpuUniqueId
hwcpuUniqueId.description: Globally unique identifier for the processor. This identifier may only be unique within a processor family. This property is inherited from CIM_Processor.

hwcpuUpgradeMethod.name: hwcpuUpgradeMethod
hwcpuUpgradeMethod.description: Method by which this processor can be upgraded, if upgrades are supported. This property is an integer enumeration. This property is inherited from CIM_Processor.

hwcpuVersion.name: hwcpuVersion
hwcpuVersion.description: Processor revision number that depends on the architecture. This property is not used in Windows 95. Example: Model 2, Stepping 12

hwcpuVoltageCaps.name: hwcpuVoltageCaps
hwcpuVoltageCaps.description: Voltage capabilities of the processor. Bits 0-3 of the field represent specific voltages that the processor socket can accept. All other bits should be set to 0 (zero). The socket is configurable if multiple bits are set. For a range of voltages, see CurrentVoltage. If the property is NULL, then the voltage capabilities are unknown.

hwcpuL3CacheSize.name: hwcpuL3CacheSize
hwcpuL3CacheSize.description: Size of the Level 3 processor cache. A Level 3 cache is an external memory area that has a faster access time than the main RAM memory.

hwcpuL3CacheSpeed.name: hwcpuL3CacheSpeed
hwcpuL3CacheSpeed.description: Clockspeed of the Level 3 property cache. A Level 3 cache is an external memory area that has a faster access time than the main RAM memory.

hwcpuNumberOfCores.name: hwcpuNumberOfCores
hwcpuNumberOfCores.description: Number of cores for the current instance of the processor. A core is a physical processor on the integrated circuit. For example, in a dual-core processor this property has a value of 2. To determine if hyperthreading is enabled for the processor, compare NumberOfLogicalProcessors and NumberOfCores. If hyperthreading is enabled in the BIOS for the processor, then NumberOfCores is less than NumberOfLogicalProcessors. For example, a dual processor system that contains two processors enabled for hyperthreading can run four threads or programs or simultaneously. In this case, NumberOfCores is 2 and NumberOfLogicalProcessors is 4.

hwcpuNumberOfLogicalProcessors.name: hwcpuNumberOfLogicalProcessors
hwcpuNumberOfLogicalProcessors.description: Number of logical processors for the current instance of the processor. For processors capable of hyperthreading, this value includes only the processors which have hyperthreading enabled. To determine if hyperthreading is enabled for the processor, compare NumberOfLogicalProcessors and NumberOfCores. If hyperthreading is enabled in the BIOS for the processor, then NumberOfCores is less than NumberOfLogicalProcessors. For example, a dual processor system that contains two processors enabled for hyperthreading can run four threads or programs or simultaneously. In this case, NumberOfCores is 2 and NumberOfLogicalProcessors is 4.

win32SCSIControllerTable.name: win32SCSIControllerTable
win32SCSIControllerTable.description: The Win32_SCSIController WMI class represents a SCSI controller on a Windows system.

hwscsiIndex.name: hwscsiIndex
hwscsiIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwscsiAvailability.name: hwscsiAvailability
hwscsiAvailability.description: Availability and status of the device. Power Save - Unknown indicates that the device is known to be in a power save mode, but its exact status is unknown; Power Save - Low Power Mode indicates that the device is in a power save state but still functioning, and may exhibit degraded performance; Power Save - Standby indicates that the device is not functioning but could be brought to full power quickly; and Power Save - Warning indicates that the device is in a warning state, though also in a power save mode. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwscsiCaption.name: hwscsiCaption
hwscsiCaption.description: Short description (one-line string) of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwscsiConfigManagerErrorCode.name: hwscsiConfigManagerErrorCode
hwscsiConfigManagerErrorCode.description: Windows Configuration Manager error code. . This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwscsiConfigManagerUserConfig.name: hwscsiConfigManagerUserConfig
hwscsiConfigManagerUserConfig.description: If TRUE, the device is using a user-defined configuration. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwscsiControllerTimeouts.name: hwscsiControllerTimeouts
hwscsiControllerTimeouts.description: Number of timeouts that have occurred after the TimeOfLastReset value. This property is inherited from CIM_SCSIController.

hwscsiCreationClassName.name: hwscsiCreationClassName
hwscsiCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class to appear in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be uniquely identified. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwscsiDescription.name: hwscsiDescription
hwscsiDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwscsiDeviceID.name: hwscsiDeviceID
hwscsiDeviceID.description: Unique identifier of the SCSI controller with other devices on the system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwscsiDeviceMap.name: hwscsiDeviceMap
hwscsiDeviceMap.description: Order in which devices are listed with this SCSI controller.

hwscsiDriverName.name: hwscsiDriverName
hwscsiDriverName.description: Driver file name of the SCSI controller. Example: 'Adaptec'

hwscsiErrorCleared.name: hwscsiErrorCleared
hwscsiErrorCleared.description: If TRUE, the error reported in LastErrorCode is now cleared. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwscsiErrorDescription.name: hwscsiErrorDescription
hwscsiErrorDescription.description: Free-form string supplying more information about the error recorded in LastErrorCode, and information on any corrective actions that may be taken. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwscsiHardwareVersion.name: hwscsiHardwareVersion
hwscsiHardwareVersion.description: Hardware version number of the SCSI controller. Example: '1.25'

hwscsiRegistryIndex.name: hwscsiRegistryIndex
hwscsiRegistryIndex.description: Index number of the SCSI controller in the system registry. Example: 0

hwscsiInstallDate.name: hwscsiInstallDate
hwscsiInstallDate.description: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwscsiLastErrorCode.name: hwscsiLastErrorCode
hwscsiLastErrorCode.description: Last error code reported by the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.
