hwscsiManufacturer.name: hwscsiManufacturer
hwscsiManufacturer.description: Name of the SCSI controller manufacturer. Example: 'Adaptec'

hwscsiMaxDataWidth.name: hwscsiMaxDataWidth
hwscsiMaxDataWidth.description: Maximum data width (in bits) supported by the SCSI controller. This property is inherited from CIM_SCSIController.

hwscsiMaxNumberControlled.name: hwscsiMaxNumberControlled
hwscsiMaxNumberControlled.description: Maximum number of directly addressable entities supportable by this controller. A value of 0 should be used if the number is unknown. This property is inherited from CIM_Controller.

hwscsiMaxTransferRate.name: hwscsiMaxTransferRate
hwscsiMaxTransferRate.description: Maximum transfer rate (in bits per second) supported by the SCSI controller. This property is inherited from CIM_SCSIController.

hwscsiName.name: hwscsiName
hwscsiName.description: Label by which the object is known. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwscsiPNPDeviceID.name: hwscsiPNPDeviceID
hwscsiPNPDeviceID.description: Windows Plug and Play device identifier of the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: '*PNP030b'

hwscsiPowerManagementCapability.name: hwscsiPowerManagementCapability
hwscsiPowerManagementCapability.description: Array of the specific power-related capabilities of a logical device. The Enabled value indicates that the power management features are currently enabled but the exact feature set is unknown or the information is unavailable. Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically indicates that a device can change its power state based on usage or other criteria. Power State Settable indicates that the SetPowerState method is supported. Power Cycling Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle). Timed Power On Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle) and Time set to a specific date and time, or interval, for power-on. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Not Supported 2 Disabled 3 Enabled 4 Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically 5 Power State Settable 6 Power Cycling Supported 7 Timed Power On Supported

hwscsiPowerManagementSupported.name: hwscsiPowerManagementSupported
hwscsiPowerManagementSupported.description: If TRUE, the device can be power-managed (can be put into suspend mode, and so on). The property does not indicate that power management features are currently enabled, only that the logical device is capable of power management. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwscsiProtectionManagement.name: hwscsiProtectionManagement
hwscsiProtectionManagement.description: Support of the SCSI controller for redundancy or protection against device failures. This property is inherited from CIM_SCSIController.

hwscsiProtocolSupported.name: hwscsiProtocolSupported
hwscsiProtocolSupported.description: Protocol used by the controller to access 'controlled' devices. This property is inherited from CIM_Controller.

hwscsiStatus.name: hwscsiStatus
hwscsiStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwscsiStatusInfo.name: hwscsiStatusInfo
hwscsiStatusInfo.description: State of the logical device. If this property does not apply to the logical device, the value 5 (Not Applicable) should be used. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwscsiSystemCreationClassName.name: hwscsiSystemCreationClassName
hwscsiSystemCreationClassName.description: Value of the scoping computer's CreationClassName property. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwscsiSystemName.name: hwscsiSystemName
hwscsiSystemName.description: Name of the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwscsiTimeOfLastReset.name: hwscsiTimeOfLastReset
hwscsiTimeOfLastReset.description: Date and time this controller was last reset. This could mean the controller was powered down, or reinitialized. This property is inherited from CIM_Controller.

win32SerialPortTable.name: win32SerialPortTable
win32SerialPortTable.description: The Win32_SerialPort WMI class represents a serial port on a Windows system.

hwspIndex.name: hwspIndex
hwspIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwspAvailability.name: hwspAvailability
hwspAvailability.description: Availability and status of the device. Power Save - Unknown indicates that the device is known to be in a power save mode, but its exact status is unknown; Power Save - Low Power Mode indicates that the device is in a power save state but still functioning, and may exhibit degraded performance; Power Save - Standby indicates that the device is not functioning but could be brought to full power quickly; and Power Save - Warning indicates that the device is in a warning state, though also in a power save mode. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwspBinary.name: hwspBinary
hwspBinary.description: If TRUE, the serial port is configured for binary data transfer. Because the Windows API does not support non-binary mode transfers, this property must be TRUE.

hwspCapabilities.name: hwspCapabilities
hwspCapabilities.description: Array of chip-level compatibility for the serial controller. This property describes the buffering and other capabilities of the serial controller that may be inherent in the chip hardware. The property is an enumerated integer. This property is inherited from CIM_SerialController. Value Meaning 1 Other 2 Unknown 3 XT/AT Compatible 4 16450 Compatible 5 16550 Compatible 6 16550A Compatible 160 8251 Compatible 161 8251FIFO Compatible

hwspCapabilityDescriptions.name: hwspCapabilityDescriptions
hwspCapabilityDescriptions.description: Array of free-form strings providing more detailed explanations for any of the serial controller features indicated in the Capabilities array. Note, each entry of this array is related to the entry in the Capabilities array that is located at the same index. This property is inherited from CIM_SerialController.

hwspCaption.name: hwspCaption
hwspCaption.description: Short description (one-line string) of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwspConfigManagerErrorCode.name: hwspConfigManagerErrorCode
hwspConfigManagerErrorCode.description: Windows Configuration Manager error code. . This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwspConfigManagerUserConfig.name: hwspConfigManagerUserConfig
hwspConfigManagerUserConfig.description: If TRUE, the device is using a user-defined configuration. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwspCreationClassName.name: hwspCreationClassName
hwspCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class to appear in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be uniquely identified. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwspDescription.name: hwspDescription
hwspDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwspDeviceID.name: hwspDeviceID
hwspDeviceID.description: Unique identifier of the serial port with other devices on the system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwspErrorCleared.name: hwspErrorCleared
hwspErrorCleared.description: If TRUE, the error reported in LastErrorCode is now cleared. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwspErrorDescription.name: hwspErrorDescription
hwspErrorDescription.description: Free-form string supplying more information about the error recorded in LastErrorCode, and information on any corrective actions that may be taken. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwspInstallDate.name: hwspInstallDate
hwspInstallDate.description: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwspLastErrorCode.name: hwspLastErrorCode
hwspLastErrorCode.description: Last error code reported by the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwspMaxBaudRate.name: hwspMaxBaudRate
hwspMaxBaudRate.description: Maximum baud rate (in bits per second) supported by the serial controller. This property is inherited from CIM_SerialController.

hwspMaximumInputBufferSize.name: hwspMaximumInputBufferSize
hwspMaximumInputBufferSize.description: Maximum size of the serial port driver's internal input buffer. A value of 0 indicates that no maximum value is imposed by the serial provider.

hwspMaximumOutputBufferSize.name: hwspMaximumOutputBufferSize
hwspMaximumOutputBufferSize.description: Maximum size of the serial port driver's internal output buffer. A value of 0 indicates that no maximum value is imposed by the serial provider.

hwspMaxNumberControlled.name: hwspMaxNumberControlled
hwspMaxNumberControlled.description: Maximum number of directly addressable entities supportable by this controller. A value of 0 should be used if the number is unknown. This property is inherited from CIM_Controller.

hwspName.name: hwspName
hwspName.description: Label by which the object is known. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwspOSAutoDiscovered.name: hwspOSAutoDiscovered
hwspOSAutoDiscovered.description: If TRUE, the instances of this class were automatically discovered by the operating system. If, for example, hardware was added through the Control Panel, the operating system finds instances of this class by querying hardware from the instances of this class.

hwspPNPDeviceID.name: hwspPNPDeviceID
hwspPNPDeviceID.description: Windows Plug and Play device identifier of the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: '*PNP030b'

hwspPowerManagementCapabilities.name: hwspPowerManagementCapabilities
hwspPowerManagementCapabilities.description: Array of the specific power-related capabilities of a logical device. The Enabled value indicates that the power management features are currently enabled but the exact feature set is unknown or the information is unavailable. Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically indicates that a device can change its power state based on usage or other criteria. Power State Settable indicates that the SetPowerState method is supported. Power Cycling Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle). Timed Power On Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle) and Time set to a specific date and time, or interval, for power-on. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Not Supported 2 Disabled 3 Enabled 4 Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically 5 Power State Settable 6 Power Cycling Supported 7 Timed Power On Supported

hwspPowerManagementSupported.name: hwspPowerManagementSupported
hwspPowerManagementSupported.description: If TRUE, the device can be power-managed (can be put into suspend mode, and so on). The property does not indicate that power management features are currently enabled, only that the logical device is capable of power management.

hwspProtocolSupported.name: hwspProtocolSupported
hwspProtocolSupported.description: Protocol used by the controller to access 'controlled' devices. This property is inherited from CIM_Controller.

hwspProviderType.name: hwspProviderType
hwspProviderType.description: Communications provider type. Values are: 'FAX Device' 'LAT Protocol' 'Modem Device' 'Network Bridge' 'Parallel Port' 'RS232 Serial Port' 'RS422 Port' 'RS423 Port' 'RS449 Port' 'Scanner Device' 'TCP/IP TelNet' 'X.25' 'Unspecified'

hwspSettableBaudRate.name: hwspSettableBaudRate
hwspSettableBaudRate.description: If TRUE, the baud rate can be changed for this serial port.

hwspSettableDataBits.name: hwspSettableDataBits
hwspSettableDataBits.description: If TRUE, data bits can be set for this serial port.

hwspSettableFlowControl.name: hwspSettableFlowControl
hwspSettableFlowControl.description: If TRUE, flow control can be set for this serial port.

hwspSettableParity.name: hwspSettableParity
hwspSettableParity.description: If TRUE, parity can be set for this serial port.

hwspSettableParityCheck.name: hwspSettableParityCheck
hwspSettableParityCheck.description: If TRUE, parity checking can be set for this serial port (if parity checking is supported).

hwspSettableRLSD.name: hwspSettableRLSD
hwspSettableRLSD.description: If TRUE, Received Line Signal Detect (RLSD) can be set for this serial port (if RLSD is supported).

hwspSettableStopBits.name: hwspSettableStopBits
hwspSettableStopBits.description: If TRUE, stop bits can be set for this serial port.

hwspStatus.name: hwspStatus
hwspStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwspStatusInfo.name: hwspStatusInfo
hwspStatusInfo.description: State of the logical device. If this property does not apply to the logical device, the value 5 (Not Applicable) should be used. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwspSupports16BitMode.name: hwspSupports16BitMode
hwspSupports16BitMode.description: If TRUE, 16-bit mode is supported on this serial port.

hwspSupportsDTRDSR.name: hwspSupportsDTRDSR
hwspSupportsDTRDSR.description: If TRUE, Data Terminal Ready (DTR) and Data Set Ready (DSR) signals are supported on this serial port.

hwspSupportsElapsedTimeouts.name: hwspSupportsElapsedTimeouts
hwspSupportsElapsedTimeouts.description: If TRUE, elapsed timeouts are supported on this serial port. Elapsed timeouts track the total amount of time between data transmissions.

hwspSupportsIntTimeouts.name: hwspSupportsIntTimeouts
hwspSupportsIntTimeouts.description: If TRUE, interval timeouts are supported. An interval timeout is the amount of time allowed to elapse between the arrival of each piece of data.

hwspSupportsParityCheck.name: hwspSupportsParityCheck
hwspSupportsParityCheck.description: If TRUE, parity checking is supported on this serial port.

hwspSupportsRLSD.name: hwspSupportsRLSD
hwspSupportsRLSD.description: If TRUE, Received Line Signal Detect (RLSD) is supported on this serial port.

hwspSupportsRTSCTS.name: hwspSupportsRTSCTS
hwspSupportsRTSCTS.description: If TRUE, Ready To Send (RTS) and Clear To Send (CTS) signals are supported on this serial port.

hwspSupportsSpecialCharacters.name: hwspSupportsSpecialCharacters
hwspSupportsSpecialCharacters.description: If TRUE, serial port control characters are supported. These characters signal events rather than data. These characters are not displayable and are set by the driver. They include EofChar, ErrorChar, BreakChar, EventChar, XonChar, and XoffChar.

hwspSupportsXOnXOff.name: hwspSupportsXOnXOff
hwspSupportsXOnXOff.description: If TRUE, XON/XOFF flow control is supported on this serial port.

hwspSupportsXOnXOffSet.name: hwspSupportsXOnXOffSet
hwspSupportsXOnXOffSet.description: If TRUE, the communications provider supports configuration of the XON/XOFF flow control setting.

hwspSystemCreationClassName.name: hwspSystemCreationClassName
hwspSystemCreationClassName.description: Value of the scoping computer's CreationClassName property. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwspSystemName.name: hwspSystemName
hwspSystemName.description: Name of the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwspTimeOfLastReset.name: hwspTimeOfLastReset
hwspTimeOfLastReset.description: Date and time this controller was last reset. This could mean the controller was powered down, or reinitialized. This property is inherited from CIM_Controller.

win32SerialPortConfigTable.name: win32SerialPortConfigTable
win32SerialPortConfigTable.description: The Win32_SerialPortConfiguration WMI class represents the settings for data transmission on a Windows serial port. This includes configurations for establishing a connection and error checking.

hwspcIndex.name: hwspcIndex
hwspcIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwspcAbortReadWriteOnError.name: hwspcAbortReadWriteOnError
hwspcAbortReadWriteOnError.description: If TRUE, read and write operations are terminated if an error occurs. If TRUE, the driver terminates all read and write operations with an error status if an error occurs. The driver will not accept any further communications operations until the application acknowledges the error.

hwspcBaudRate.name: hwspcBaudRate
hwspcBaudRate.description: Baud (bits per second) rate at which the communications device operates. Example: 9600

hwspcBinaryModeEnabled.name: hwspcBinaryModeEnabled
hwspcBinaryModeEnabled.description: If TRUE, binary-mode data transfers are enabled for the serial port. Windows systems only allow binary transfers through serial ports, so this value is always TRUE.

hwspcBitsPerByte.name: hwspcBitsPerByte
hwspcBitsPerByte.description: Number of bits transmitted and received for each byte of data for the Windows serial port. The number may vary with control and error correction bits, such as parity bits. Example: 8

hwspcCaption.name: hwspcCaption
hwspcCaption.description: Short description (one-line string) of the CIM_Setting object. This property is inherited from CIM_Setting.

hwspcContinueXMitOnXOff.name: hwspcContinueXMitOnXOff
hwspcContinueXMitOnXOff.description: If TRUE, data transmissions continue when the input buffer has come within XOffXMitThreshold bytes of being full and the driver has transmitted the XOffChararcter value to stop receiving bytes. If FALSE, transmission does not continue until the input buffer is within XOnXMitThreshold bytes of being empty and the driver has transmitted the XOnCharacter value to resume reception.

hwspcCTSOutflowControl.name: hwspcCTSOutflowControl
hwspcCTSOutflowControl.description: If TRUE, the Clear To Send (CTS) signal is checked before transmitting data. CTS signals that both devices on the serial connection are ready to transfer data. Data transmission is suspended until the CTS signal is given.

hwspcDescription.name: hwspcDescription
hwspcDescription.description: Description of the CIM_Setting object. This property is inherited from CIM_Setting.

hwspcDiscardNULLBytes.name: hwspcDiscardNULLBytes
hwspcDiscardNULLBytes.description: If TRUE, NULL bytes (characters) are discarded when they are received.

hwspcDSROutflowControl.name: hwspcDSROutflowControl
hwspcDSROutflowControl.description: If TRUE, data outflow control is enabled when there is a Data Set Ready (DSR) condition. DSR signals that the connection has been established by the devices on the serial connection. DSR data transmission is suspended until DSR signal is given.

hwspcDSRSensitivity.name: hwspcDSRSensitivity
hwspcDSRSensitivity.description: If TRUE, the communications driver is sensitive to the state of the DSR signal. The driver ignores any bytes received, unless the DSR modem input line is high.

hwspcDTRFlowControlType.name: hwspcDTRFlowControlType
hwspcDTRFlowControlType.description: Use of the data-terminal-ready (DTR) flow control after a connection has been established.

hwspcEOFCharacter.name: hwspcEOFCharacter
hwspcEOFCharacter.description: Value of the character used to signal the end of data. Example: ^Z

hwspcErrorReplaceCharacter.name: hwspcErrorReplaceCharacter
hwspcErrorReplaceCharacter.description: Value of the character used to replace bytes received with a parity error. Example: ^C

hwspcErrorReplacementEnabled.name: hwspcErrorReplacementEnabled
hwspcErrorReplacementEnabled.description: If TRUE, bytes received with parity errors are replaced with the ErrorReplaceCharacter value. Characters with parity errors are only replaced if this property is TRUE and the parity is enabled.

hwspcEventCharacter.name: hwspcEventCharacter
hwspcEventCharacter.description: Value of the control character that is used to signal an event, such as end of file. Example: ^e

hwspcIsBusy.name: hwspcIsBusy
hwspcIsBusy.description: If TRUE, the serial port is busy.

hwspcName.name: hwspcName
hwspcName.description: Name of the Windows serial port. Example: 'COM1'

hwspcParity.name: hwspcParity
hwspcParity.description: Method of parity checking to be used. Parity is used as an error checking technique where an extra parity bit is included with every unit of data. The receiver can then verify the validity of the data by counting the bits that are set. Value Meaning 'None' Parity checking not used 'Odd' Sets the parity bit so that the count of bits set is an odd number 'Even' Sets the parity bit so that the count of bits set is an even number 'Mark' Leaves the parity bit set to 1 'Space' Leaves the parity bit set to 0

hwspcParityCheckEnabled.name: hwspcParityCheckEnabled
hwspcParityCheckEnabled.description: If TRUE, parity checking is enabled.

hwspcRTSFlowControlType.name: hwspcRTSFlowControlType
hwspcRTSFlowControlType.description: Request-to-send (RTS) flow control. RTS is used to signal that data is available for transmission. Value Meaning 'Enable' RTS is left on for the data transfer session 'Disable' RTS is ignored after the first RTS signal is received 'Handshake' RTS is turned off if the transmission buffer is more than three-quarters full, and RTS is turned on when the buffer is less than one-half full 'Toggle' RTS is turned on if there is any data buffered for transmission

hwspcSettingID.name: hwspcSettingID
hwspcSettingID.description: Identifier by which the CIM_Setting instance is known. This property is inherited from CIM_Setting.

hwspcStopBits.name: hwspcStopBits
hwspcStopBits.description: Number of stop bits to be used. Stop bits separate each unit of data on an asynchronous serial connection. They are also sent continuously when no data is available for transmission. Values are: '1' '1.5' '2'

hwspcXOffCharacter.name: hwspcXOffCharacter
hwspcXOffCharacter.description: Value of the XOFF character for both transmission and reception. XOFF is a software control to stop the transmission of data (whereas RTS and CTS are hardware controls). XON resumes the transmission.

hwspcXOffXMitThreshold.name: hwspcXOffXMitThreshold
hwspcXOffXMitThreshold.description: Maximum number of bytes allowed in the input buffer before the XOFF character is sent.

hwspcXOnCharacter.name: hwspcXOnCharacter
hwspcXOnCharacter.description: Value of the XON character for both transmission and reception. XON is a software control to resume the transmission of data (whereas RTS and CTS are hardware controls). XOFF stops the transmission.

hwspcXOnXMitThreshold.name: hwspcXOnXMitThreshold
hwspcXOnXMitThreshold.description: Minimum number of bytes allowed in the input buffer before the XON character is sent. This property works in conjunction with XOffXMitThreshold to regulate the rate at which data is transferred.

hwspcXOnXOffInFlowControl.name: hwspcXOnXOffInFlowControl
hwspcXOnXOffInFlowControl.description: If TRUE, XON/XOFF flow control is used during reception. If TRUE, the XOffCharacter value is sent when the input buffer comes within XOffXMitThreshold bytes of being full, and the XOnCharacter value is sent when the input buffer comes within XOnXMitThreshold bytes of being empty.

hwspcXOnXOffOutFlowControl.name: hwspcXOnXOffOutFlowControl
hwspcXOnXOffOutFlowControl.description: The XOnXOffOutFlowControl specifies whether XON/XOFF flow control is used during transmission. If TRUE, transmission stops when the XOffCharacter value is received and starts again when the XOnCharacter value is received.

win32SMBIOSMemoryTable.name: win32SMBIOSMemoryTable
win32SMBIOSMemoryTable.description: The Win32_SMBIOSMemory abstract WMI class represents the properties of a computer system memory as seen through the System Management BIOS (SMBIOS) interface. The SMBIOS interface does not distinguish between non-volatile, volatile, and flash memories. The CIM_Memory class is the parent class of all types of memory.

hwsbmIndex.name: hwsbmIndex
hwsbmIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwsbmAccess.name: hwsbmAccess
hwsbmAccess.description: Type of access. This property is inherited from CIM_StorageExtent.

hwsbmAdditionalErrorData.name: hwsbmAdditionalErrorData
hwsbmAdditionalErrorData.description: Array of octets that hold additional error information. An example is Error Checking and Correcting (ECC) Syndrome, or the return of the check bits if a CRC-based error methodology is used. In the latter case, if a single bit error is recognized and the cyclical redundancy check (CRC) algorithm is known, it is possible to determine the exact bit that failed. This type of data (ECC Syndrome, Check Bit or Parity Bit data, or other vendor supplied information) is included in this field. If the ErrorInfo property is equal to 3 (OK), then this property has no meaning.

hwsbmAvailability.name: hwsbmAvailability
hwsbmAvailability.description: Availability and status of the device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwsbmBlockSize.name: hwsbmBlockSize
hwsbmBlockSize.description: Size in bytes of the blocks that form this storage extent. If unknown or if a block concept is not valid (for example, for aggregate extents, memory or logical disks), enter a 1. This property is inherited from CIM_StorageExtent.

hwsbmCaption.name: hwsbmCaption
hwsbmCaption.description: Short description of the object a one-line string. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwsbmConfigManagerErrorCode.name: hwsbmConfigManagerErrorCode
hwsbmConfigManagerErrorCode.description: Windows Configuration Manager error code. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwsbmConfigManagerUserConfig.name: hwsbmConfigManagerUserConfig
hwsbmConfigManagerUserConfig.description: If TRUE, the device is using a user-defined configuration. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwsbmCorrectableError.name: hwsbmCorrectableError
hwsbmCorrectableError.description: If TRUE, the most recent error was correctable. If the ErrorInfo property is equal to 3 (OK), then this property has no meaning.

hwsbmCreationClassName.name: hwsbmCreationClassName
hwsbmCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class that appears in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be identified uniquely. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwsbmDescription.name: hwsbmDescription
hwsbmDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwsbmDeviceID.name: hwsbmDeviceID
hwsbmDeviceID.description: Unique identifier of the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwsbmEndingAddress.name: hwsbmEndingAddress
hwsbmEndingAddress.description: Ending address, referenced by an application or operating system and mapped by a memory controller for this memory object. The ending address is specified in kilobytes.

hwsbmErrorAccess.name: hwsbmErrorAccess
hwsbmErrorAccess.description: Memory access operation that caused the last error. The type of error is described by the ErrorInfo property. If ErrorInfo is equal to 3 (OK), then this property has no meaning.

hwsbmErrorAddress.name: hwsbmErrorAddress
hwsbmErrorAddress.description: Address of the last memory error. The type of error is described by the ErrorInfo property. If ErrorInfo is equal to 3 (OK), then this property has no meaning.

hwsbmErrorCleared.name: hwsbmErrorCleared
hwsbmErrorCleared.description: If TRUE, the error reported in LastErrorCode is now cleared. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwsbmErrorData.name: hwsbmErrorData
hwsbmErrorData.description: Array of data captured during the last erroneous memory access. The data occupies the first n octets of the array necessary to hold the number of bits specified by the ErrorTransferSize property. If ErrorTransferSize is 0 (zero), then this property has no meaning.

hwsbmErrorDataOrder.name: hwsbmErrorDataOrder
hwsbmErrorDataOrder.description: Ordering for data stored in the ErrorData property. If ErrorTransferSize is 0 (zero), then this property has no meaning.

hwsbmErrorDescription.name: hwsbmErrorDescription
hwsbmErrorDescription.description: More information about the error recorded in LastErrorCode, and information about any corrective actions that may be taken. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwsbmErrorInfo.name: hwsbmErrorInfo
hwsbmErrorInfo.description: Type of error that occurred most recently. The values 12 through 14 are unused. The ability to be corrected is indicated in the property CorrectableError.

hwsbmErrorMethodology.name: hwsbmErrorMethodology
hwsbmErrorMethodology.description: Details on the parity or CRC algorithms, ECC or other mechanisms used. This property is inherited from CIM_StorageExtent.

hwsbmErrorResolution.name: hwsbmErrorResolution
hwsbmErrorResolution.description: Range, in bytes, to which the last error can be resolved. For example, if error addresses are resolved to bit 11 (that is, on a typical page basis), then errors can be resolved to 4 KB boundaries and this property is set to 4000. If the ErrorInfo property is equal to 3 (OK), then this property has no meaning.

hwsbmErrorTime.name: hwsbmErrorTime
hwsbmErrorTime.description: Time that the last memory error occurred. The type of error is described by the ErrorInfo property. If the ErrorInfo property is equal to 3 (OK), then this property has no meaning.

hwsbmErrorTransferSize.name: hwsbmErrorTransferSize
hwsbmErrorTransferSize.description: Size of the data transfer in bits that caused the last error 0 (zero) indicates no error. If the ErrorInfo property is equal to 3 (OK), then this property should be set to 0 (zero).

hwsbmInstallDate.name: hwsbmInstallDate
hwsbmInstallDate.description: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwsbmLastErrorCode.name: hwsbmLastErrorCode
hwsbmLastErrorCode.description: Last error code reported by the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwsbmName.name: hwsbmName
hwsbmName.description: Label by which the object is known. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwsbmNumberOfBlocks.name: hwsbmNumberOfBlocks
hwsbmNumberOfBlocks.description: Total number of consecutive blocks, each block the size of the value contained in the BlockSize property, which form this storage extent. Total size of the storage extent can be calculated by multiplying the value of the BlockSize property by the value of this property. If the value of BlockSize is 1, this property is the total size of the storage extent. This property is inherited from CIM_StorageExtent.

hwsbmOtherErrorDescription.name: hwsbmOtherErrorDescription
hwsbmOtherErrorDescription.description: Free-form string that provides more information if the ErrorType property is set to 1; otherwise, this string has no meaning.

hwsbmPNPDeviceID.name: hwsbmPNPDeviceID
hwsbmPNPDeviceID.description: Windows Plug and Play device identifier of the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: '*PNP030b'

hwsbmPowerManagementCapabilities.name: hwsbmPowerManagementCapabilities
hwsbmPowerManagementCapabilities.description: Array of the specific power-related capabilities of a logical device. The Enabled value indicates that the power management features are currently enabled but the exact feature set is unknown or the information is unavailable. Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically indicates that a device can change its power state based on usage or other criteria. Power State Settable indicates that the SetPowerState method is supported. Power Cycling Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle). Timed Power On Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle) and Time set to a specific date and time, or interval, for power-on. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Not Supported 2 Disabled 3 Enabled 4 Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically 5 Power State Settable 6 Power Cycling Supported 7 Timed Power On Supported

hwsbmPowerManagementSupported.name: hwsbmPowerManagementSupported
hwsbmPowerManagementSupported.description: If TRUE, the device can be power-managed (can be put into suspend mode, and so on). The property does not indicate that power management features are currently enabled, only that the logical device is capable of power management. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwsbmPurpose.name: hwsbmPurpose
hwsbmPurpose.description: Free-form string describing the media and/or its use. This property is inherited from CIM_StorageExtent.

hwsbmStartingAddress.name: hwsbmStartingAddress
hwsbmStartingAddress.description: Beginning address that is referenced by an application or operating system, and mapped by a memory controller for this memory object. The starting address is specified in kilobytes.

hwsbmStatus.name: hwsbmStatus
hwsbmStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwsbmStatusInfo.name: hwsbmStatusInfo
hwsbmStatusInfo.description: State of the logical device. If this property does not apply to the logical device, the value 5 (Not Applicable) should be used. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwsbmSystemCreationClassName.name: hwsbmSystemCreationClassName
hwsbmSystemCreationClassName.description: Value of the scoping computer's CreationClassName property. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwsbmSystemLevelAddress.name: hwsbmSystemLevelAddress
hwsbmSystemLevelAddress.description: If TRUE, the address information in the ErrorAddress property is a system-level address. If FALSE, it is a physical address. If the ErrorInfo property is equal to 3 (OK), then this property has no meaning.

hwsbmSystemName.name: hwsbmSystemName
hwsbmSystemName.description: Name of the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

win32SoundDeviceTable.name: win32SoundDeviceTable
win32SoundDeviceTable.description: The Win32_SoundDevice WMI class represents the properties of a sound device on a Windows computer system.

hwsndIndex.name: hwsndIndex
hwsndIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwsndAvailability.name: hwsndAvailability
hwsndAvailability.description: Availability and status of the device. Power Save - Unknown indicates that the device is known to be in a power save mode, but its exact status is unknown; Power Save - Low Power Mode indicates that the device is in a power save state but still functioning, and may exhibit degraded performance; Power Save - Standby indicates that the device is not functioning but could be brought to full power quickly; and Power Save - Warning indicates that the device is in a warning state, though also in a power save mode. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwsndCaption.name: hwsndCaption
hwsndCaption.description: Short description (one-line string) of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwsndConfigManagerErrorCode.name: hwsndConfigManagerErrorCode
hwsndConfigManagerErrorCode.description: Windows Configuration Manager error code. . This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwsndConfigManagerUserConfig.name: hwsndConfigManagerUserConfig
hwsndConfigManagerUserConfig.description: If TRUE, the device is using a user-defined configuration. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwsndCreationClassName.name: hwsndCreationClassName
hwsndCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class to appear in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be uniquely identified. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwsndDescription.name: hwsndDescription
hwsndDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwsndDeviceID.name: hwsndDeviceID
hwsndDeviceID.description: Unique identifier of the sound device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwsndDMABufferSize.name: hwsndDMABufferSize
hwsndDMABufferSize.description: Size of the Direct Memory Access buffer. Example: 4

hwsndErrorCleared.name: hwsndErrorCleared
hwsndErrorCleared.description: If TRUE, the error reported in LastErrorCode is now cleared. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwsndErrorDescription.name: hwsndErrorDescription
hwsndErrorDescription.description: Free-form string supplying more information about the error recorded in LastErrorCode, and information on any corrective actions that may be taken. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwsndInstallDate.name: hwsndInstallDate
hwsndInstallDate.description: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwsndLastErrorCode.name: hwsndLastErrorCode
hwsndLastErrorCode.description: Last error code reported by the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwsndManufacturer.name: hwsndManufacturer
hwsndManufacturer.description: Manufacturer of the sound device. Example: 'Creative Labs'

hwsndMPU401Address.name: hwsndMPU401Address
hwsndMPU401Address.description: Starting I/O address assigned to the MPU-401 port of the sound device. Example: 300

hwsndName.name: hwsndName
hwsndName.description: Label by which the object is known. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwsndPNPDeviceID.name: hwsndPNPDeviceID
hwsndPNPDeviceID.description: Windows Plug and Play device identifier of the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: '*PNP030b'

hwsndPowerManagementCapabilities.name: hwsndPowerManagementCapabilities
hwsndPowerManagementCapabilities.description: Array of the specific power-related capabilities of a logical device. The Enabled value indicates that the power management features are currently enabled but the exact feature set is unknown or the information is unavailable. Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically indicates that a device can change its power state based on usage or other criteria. Power State Settable indicates that the SetPowerState method is supported. Power Cycling Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle). Timed Power On Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle) and Time set to a specific date and time, or interval, for power-on. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Not Supported 2 Disabled 3 Enabled 4 Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically 5 Power State Settable 6 Power Cycling Supported 7 Timed Power On Supported

hwsndPowerManagementSupported.name: hwsndPowerManagementSupported
hwsndPowerManagementSupported.description: If TRUE, the device can be power-managed (can be put into suspend mode, and so on). The property does not indicate that power management features are currently enabled, only that the logical device is capable of power management. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwsndProductName.name: hwsndProductName
hwsndProductName.description: Product name of the sound device. Example: 'Creative Labs SoundBlaster AWE64PNP'

hwsndStatus.name: hwsndStatus
hwsndStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwsndStatusInfo.name: hwsndStatusInfo
hwsndStatusInfo.description: State of the logical device. If this property does not apply to the logical device, the value 5 (Not Applicable) should be used. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwsndSystemCreationClassName.name: hwsndSystemCreationClassName
hwsndSystemCreationClassName.description: Value of the scoping computer's CreationClassName property. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwsndSystemName.name: hwsndSystemName
hwsndSystemName.description: Name of the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

win32SystemEnclosureTable.name: win32SystemEnclosureTable
win32SystemEnclosureTable.description: The Win32_SystemEnclosure WMI class represents the properties associated with a physical system enclosure.

hwseIndex.name: hwseIndex
hwseIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwseAudibleAlarm.name: hwseAudibleAlarm
hwseAudibleAlarm.description: If TRUE, the frame is equipped with an audible alarm. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalFrame.

hwseBreachDescription.name: hwseBreachDescription
hwseBreachDescription.description: Free-form string that provides more information if the SecurityBreach property indicates that a breach or some other security-related event occurred. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalFrame.

hwseCableManagementStrategy.name: hwseCableManagementStrategy
hwseCableManagementStrategy.description: Free-form string that contains information about how the various cables are connected and bundled for the frame. With many networking, storage-related, and power cables, cable management can be a complex and challenging endeavor. The property contains information to aid in assembly and service of the frame. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalFrame.

hwseCaption.name: hwseCaption
hwseCaption.description: Short description of the object a one-line string. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwseChassisTypes.name: hwseChassisTypes
hwseChassisTypes.description: Array of chassis types. This property is inherited from CIM_Chassis. Value Meaning 1 Other 2 Unknown 3 Desktop 4 Low Profile Desktop 5 Pizza Box 6 Mini Tower 7 Tower 8 Portable 9 Laptop 10 Notebook 11 Hand Held 12 Docking Station 13 All in One 14 Sub Notebook 15 Space-Saving 16 Lunch Box 17 Main System Chassis 18 Expansion Chassis 19 SubChassis 20 Bus Expansion Chassis 21 Peripheral Chassis 22 Storage Chassis 23 Rack Mount Chassis 24 Sealed-Case PC

hwseCreationClassName.name: hwseCreationClassName
hwseCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class that appears in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be identified uniquely. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwseCurrentRequiredOrProduced.name: hwseCurrentRequiredOrProduced
hwseCurrentRequiredOrProduced.description: Current required by the chassis at 120V. If power is provided by the chassis as in the case of an uninterruptible power supply (UPS) this property may indicate the amperage produced (as a negative number). This property is inherited from CIM_Chassis.

hwseDepth.name: hwseDepth
hwseDepth.description: Depth of the physical package in inches. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalPackage.

hwseDescription.name: hwseDescription
hwseDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwseHeatGeneration.name: hwseHeatGeneration
hwseHeatGeneration.description: Amount of heat generated by the chassis in BTU/hour. This property is inherited from CIM_Chassis.

hwseHeight.name: hwseHeight
hwseHeight.description: Height of the physical package in inches. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalPackage.

hwseHotSwappable.name: hwseHotSwappable
hwseHotSwappable.description: If TRUE, a physical package can be hot-swapped (if it is possible to replace the element with a physically different but equivalent one while the containing package has power applied to it). For example, a disk drive package inserted using SCA connectors is removable and can be hot-swapped. All packages that can be hot-swapped are inherently removable and replaceable. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalPackage.

hwseInstallDate.name: hwseInstallDate
hwseInstallDate.description: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwseLockPresent.name: hwseLockPresent
hwseLockPresent.description: If TRUE, the frame is protected with a lock. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalFrame.

hwseManufacturer.name: hwseManufacturer
hwseManufacturer.description: Name of the organization responsible for producing the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwseModel.name: hwseModel
hwseModel.description: Name by which the physical element is generally known. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwseName.name: hwseName
hwseName.description: Label by which the object is known. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwseNumberOfPowerCords.name: hwseNumberOfPowerCords
hwseNumberOfPowerCords.description: Number of power cords that must be connected to the chassis for all the components to operate. This property is inherited from CIM_Chassis.

hwseOtherIdentifyingInfo.name: hwseOtherIdentifyingInfo
hwseOtherIdentifyingInfo.description: Additional data, beyond asset tag information, that can be used to identify a physical element. One example is bar code data associated with an element that also has an asset tag. Note that if only bar code data is available and is unique/able to be used as an element key, this property would be NULL and the bar code data used as the class key, in the tag property. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwsePartNumber.name: hwsePartNumber
hwsePartNumber.description: Part number assigned by the organization responsible for producing or manufacturing the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwsePoweredOn.name: hwsePoweredOn
hwsePoweredOn.description: If TRUE, the physical element is powered ON. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwseRemovable.name: hwseRemovable
hwseRemovable.description: If TRUE, a physical package is removable (if it is designed to be taken in and out of the physical container in which it is normally found, without impairing the function of the overall packaging). A package can still be removable if power must be 'off' in order to perform the removal. If power can be ON and the package removed, then the element is removable and can be hot-swapped. For example, an extra battery in a laptop is removable, as is a disk drive package inserted using SCA connectors. However, the latter can be hot swapped. A laptop's display is not removable, nor is a non-redundant power supply. Removing these components would affect the function of the overall packaging or is impossible due to the tight integration of the package. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalPackage.

hwseReplaceable.name: hwseReplaceable
hwseReplaceable.description: If TRUE, a physical package is replaceable (if it is possible to replace field replaceable unit (FRU) or upgrade the element with a physically different one). For example, some computer systems allow the main processor chip to be upgraded to one of a higher clock rating. In this case, the processor is replaceable. Another example is a power supply package mounted on sliding rails. All removable packages are inherently replaceable. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalPackage.

hwseSecurityBreach.name: hwseSecurityBreach
hwseSecurityBreach.description: Status of a physical breach of the frame. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalFrame.

hwseSecurityStatus.name: hwseSecurityStatus
hwseSecurityStatus.description: Security setting for external input for example, a keyboard to this computer.

hwseSerialNumber.name: hwseSerialNumber
hwseSerialNumber.description: Manufacturer-allocated number used to identify the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwseServiceDescriptions.name: hwseServiceDescriptions
hwseServiceDescriptions.description: Array of more detailed explanations for any of the entries in the ServicePhilosophy array. Note that each entry of this array is related to the entry in ServicePhilosophy that is located at the same index. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalFrame.

hwseServicePhilosophy.name: hwseServicePhilosophy
hwseServicePhilosophy.description: Array that includes whether the frame is serviced from the top, front, back, or side; whether the frame has sliding trays or removable sides; and whether the frame is moveable for example, having rollers. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalFrame. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Other 2 Service From Top 3 Service From Front 4 Service From Back 5 Service From Side 6 Sliding Trays 7 Removable Sides 8 Moveable

hwseSKU.name: hwseSKU
hwseSKU.description: Stock keeping unit number for the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwseSMBIOSAssetTag.name: hwseSMBIOSAssetTag
hwseSMBIOSAssetTag.description: Asset tag number of the system enclosure.

hwseStatus.name: hwseStatus
hwseStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwseTag.name: hwseTag
hwseTag.description: Unique identifier of the system enclosure. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement. Example: 'System Enclosure 1'

hwseTypeDescriptions.name: hwseTypeDescriptions
hwseTypeDescriptions.description: Array of more information about the ChassisTypes array entries. Note that each entry of this array is related to the entry in ChassisTypes that is located at the same index. This property is inherited from CIM_Chassis.

hwseVersion.name: hwseVersion
hwseVersion.description: Version of the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwseVisibleAlarm.name: hwseVisibleAlarm
hwseVisibleAlarm.description: If TRUE, the equipment includes a visible alarm. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalFrame.

hwseWeight.name: hwseWeight
hwseWeight.description: Weight of the physical package in pounds. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalPackage.

hwseWidth.name: hwseWidth
hwseWidth.description: Width of the physical package in inches. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalPackage.

win32SystemMemoryResourceTable.description: The Win32_SystemMemoryResource abstract WMI class represents a system memory resource on a Windows operating system.

hwsmrIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwsmrCaption.description: Short description of an object a one-line string. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwsmrDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwsmrName.name: hwsmrName
hwsmrName.description: Label for the object. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwsmrStartingAddress.description: Starting address of memory mapped I/O. The hardware resource identifier property should be set to this value to construct the mapped I/O resource key. This property is inherited from CIM_MemoryMappedIO.

hwsmrStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwssCaption.description: Short description of an object a one-line string. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwssConnectorPinout.description: Free-form string that describes the pin configuration and signal usage of a physical connector. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalConnector.

hwssConnectorType.description: Array of physical attributes of the connector that this slot uses. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalConnector. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Other 2 Male 3 Female 4 Shielded 5 Unshielded 6 SCSI (A) High-Density (50 pins) 7 SCSI (A) Low-Density (50 pins) 8 SCSI (P) High-Density (68 pins) 9 SCSI SCA-I (80 pins) 10 SCSI SCA-II (80 pins) 11 SCSI Fibre Channel (DB-9, Copper) 12 SCSI Fibre Channel (Fibre) 13 SCSI Fibre Channel SCA-II (40 pins) 14 SCSI Fibre Channel SCA-II (20 pins) 15 SCSI Fibre Channel BNC 16 ATA 3-1/2 Inch (40 pins) 17 ATA 2-1/2 Inch (44 pins) 18 ATA-2 19 ATA-3 20 ATA/66 21 DB-9 22 DB-15 23 DB-25 24 DB-36 25 RS-232C 26 RS-422 27 RS-423 28 RS-485 29 RS-449 30 V.35 31 X.21 32 IEEE-488 33 AUI 34 UTP Category 3 35 UTP Category 4 36 UTP Category 5 37 BNC 38 RJ11 39 RJ45 40 Fiber MIC 41 Apple AUI 42 Apple GeoPort 43 PCI 44 ISA 45 EISA 46 VESA 47 PCMCIA 48 PCMCIA Type I 49 PCMCIA Type II 50 PCMCIA Type III 51 ZV Port 52 CardBus 53 USB 54 IEEE 1394 55 HIPPI 56 HSSDC (6 pins) 57 GBIC 58 DIN 59 Mini-DIN 60 Micro-DIN 61 PS/2 62 Infrared 63 HP-HIL 64 Access.bus 65 NuBus 66 Centronics 67 Mini-Centronics 68 Mini-Centronics Type-14 69 Mini-Centronics Type-20 70 Mini-Centronics Type-26 71 Bus Mouse 72 ADB 73 AGP 74 VME Bus 75 VME64 76 Proprietary 77 Proprietary Processor Card Slot 78 Proprietary Memory Card Slot 79 Proprietary I/O Riser Slot 80 PCI-66MHZ 81 AGP2X 82 AGP4X 83 PC-98 84 PC-98-Hireso 85 PC-H98 86 PC-98Note 87 PC-98Full 88 SSA SCSI 89 Circular 90 On Board IDE Connector 91 On Board Floppy Connector 92 9 Pin Dual Inline 93 25 Pin Dual Inline 94 50 Pin Dual Inline 95 68 Pin Dual Inline 96 On Board Sound Connector 97 Mini-jack 98 PCI-X 99 Sbus IEEE 1396-1993 32 bit 100 Sbus IEEE 1396-1993 64 bit 101 MCA 102 GIO 103 XIO 104 HIO 105 NGIO 106 PMC 107 MTRJ 108 VF-45 109 Future I/O 110 SC 111 SG 112 Electrical 113 Optical 114 Ribbon 115 GLM 116 1x9 117 Mini SG 118 LC 119 HSSC 120 VHDCI Shielded (68 pins) 121 InfiniBand

hwssDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwssHeightAllowed.name: hwssHeightAllowed
hwssHeightAllowed.description: Maximum height of an adapter card that can be inserted into the slot in inches. This property is inherited from CIM_Slot.

hwssInstallDate.name: hwssInstallDate
hwssInstallDate.description: Date and time the object is installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwssLengthAllowed.description: Maximum length of an adapter card that can be inserted into the slot in inches. This property is inherited from CIM_Slot.

hwssManufacturer.description: Name of the organization that produces the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwssMaxDataWidth.name: hwssMaxDataWidth
hwssMaxDataWidth.description: Maximum bus width of adapter cards that can be inserted into this slot in bits. This property is inherited from CIM_Slot. Value Maximun data widith (bits) 0 8 1 16 2 32 3 64 4 128

hwssModel.name: hwssModel
hwssModel.description: Name for the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwssName.name: hwssName
hwssName.description: Label for the object. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwssNumber.name: hwssNumber
hwssNumber.description: Physical slot number that can be used as an index into a system slot table, whether or not that slot is physically occupied. This property is inherited from CIM_Slot.

hwssOtherIdentifyingInfo.name: hwssOtherIdentifyingInfo
hwssOtherIdentifyingInfo.description: Additional data (that is, more than asset tag information), that can be used to identify a physical element. One example is bar code data associated with an element that also has an asset tag. Note that if only bar code data is available, and it is unique or can be used as an element key, this property is NULL, and the bar code data is used as the class key in the Tag property. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwssPartNumber.name: hwssPartNumber
hwssPartNumber.description: Part number that the producer or manufacturer assigns to the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwssPMESignal.name: hwssPMESignal
hwssPMESignal.description: If TRUE, the PCI bus Power Management Enabled (PME) signal is supported by this slot.

hwssPoweredOn.name: hwssPoweredOn
hwssPoweredOn.description: If TRUE, the physical element is powered on. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwssPurposeDescription.name: hwssPurposeDescription
hwssPurposeDescription.description: Free-form string that describes how this slot is physically unique and may hold special types of hardware. This property only has meaning when the corresponding property SpecialPurpose is TRUE. This property is inherited from CIM_Slot.

hwssSerialNumber.name: hwssSerialNumber
hwssSerialNumber.description: Manufacturer-allocated number used to identify the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwssShared.name: hwssShared
hwssShared.description: If TRUE, two or more slots share a location on the baseboard, such as a PCI/EISA shared slot.

hwssSKU.name: hwssSKU
hwssSKU.description: Stockkeeping unit number for the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwssSlotDesignation.name: hwssSlotDesignation
hwssSlotDesignation.description: SMBIOS string that identifies the system slot designation of the slot on the motherboard. Example: 'PCI-1'

hwssSpecialPurpose.name: hwssSpecialPurpose
hwssSpecialPurpose.description: If TRUE, this slot is physically unique and may hold special types of hardware, such as a graphics processor slot. If TRUE, then PurposeDescription should specify the nature of the uniqueness or purpose of the slot. This property is inherited from CIM_Slot.

hwssStatus.name: hwssStatus
hwssStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwssSupportsHotPlug.name: hwssSupportsHotPlug
hwssSupportsHotPlug.description: If TRUE, the slot supports hot-plugging of adapter cards. This property is inherited from CIM_Slot.

hwssTag.name: hwssTag
hwssTag.description: System slot represented by an instance of this class. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement. Example: 'System Slot 1'

hwssThermalRating.name: hwssThermalRating
hwssThermalRating.description: Maximum thermal dissipation of the slot in milliwatts. This property is inherited from CIM_Slot.

hwssVccMixedVoltageSupport.name: hwssVccMixedVoltageSupport
hwssVccMixedVoltageSupport.description: Array of enumerated integers indicating the Vcc voltage supported by this slot. This property is inherited from CIM_Slot. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Other 2 3.3V 3 5V

hwssVersion.name: hwssVersion
hwssVersion.description: Version of the physical element. This property is inherited from CIM_PhysicalElement.

hwssVppMixedVoltageSupport.description: Array of enumerated integers indicating the Vpp voltage supported by this slot. This property is inherited from CIM_Slot. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Other 2 3.3V 3 5V 4 12V

hwucDeviceID.description: Unique identifier of the USB controller. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwucErrorCleared.name: hwucErrorCleared
hwucErrorCleared.description: If TRUE, the error reported in LastErrorCode is now cleared. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwucErrorDescription.name: hwucErrorDescription
hwucErrorDescription.description: More information about the error recorded in LastErrorCode, and information on any corrective actions that may be taken. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwucInstallDate.name: hwucInstallDate
hwucInstallDate.description: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwucLastErrorCode.name: hwucLastErrorCode
hwucLastErrorCode.description: Last error code reported by the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwucManufacturer.name: hwucManufacturer
hwucManufacturer.description: Manufacturer of the controller. This property is inherited from CIM_USBController.

hwucMaxNumberControlled.name: hwucMaxNumberControlled
hwucMaxNumberControlled.description: Maximum number of directly addressable entities supportable by this controller. A value of 0 should be used if the number is unknown. This property is inherited from CIM_Controller.

hwucName.name: hwucName
hwucName.description: Label by which the object is known. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwucPNPDeviceID.name: hwucPNPDeviceID
hwucPNPDeviceID.description: Windows Plug and Play device identifier of the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: '*PNP030b'

hwucPowerManagementCapabilities.name: hwucPowerManagementCapabilities
hwucPowerManagementCapabilities.description: Array of the specific power-related capabilities of a logical device. The Enabled value indicates that the power management features are currently enabled but the exact feature set is unknown or the information is unavailable. Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically indicates that a device can change its power state based on usage or other criteria. Power State Settable indicates that the SetPowerState method is supported. Power Cycling Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle). Timed Power On Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle) and Time set to a specific date and time, or interval, for power-on. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Not Supported 2 Disabled 3 Enabled 4 Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically 5 Power State Settable 6 Power Cycling Supported 7 Timed Power On Supported

hwucPowerManagementSupported.name: hwucPowerManagementSupported
hwucPowerManagementSupported.description: If TRUE, the device can be power-managed (can be put into suspend mode, and so on). The property does not indicate that power management features are currently enabled, only that the logical device is capable of power management. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwucProtocolSupported.name: hwucProtocolSupported
hwucProtocolSupported.description: Protocol used by the controller to access 'controlled' devices. This property is inherited from CIM_Controller.

hwucStatus.name: hwucStatus
hwucStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwucStatusInfo.name: hwucStatusInfo
hwucStatusInfo.description: State of the logical device. If this property does not apply to the logical device, the value 5 (Not Applicable) should be used. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwucSystemCreationClassName.name: hwucSystemCreationClassName
hwucSystemCreationClassName.description: Value for the scoping computer's CreationClassName property. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwucSystemName.name: hwucSystemName
hwucSystemName.description: Name of the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwucTimeOfLastReset.name: hwucTimeOfLastReset
hwucTimeOfLastReset.description: Date and time the controller was last reset. This could mean the controller was powered down, or reinitialized. This property is inherited from CIM_Controller.

win32USBHubTable.name: win32USBHubTable
win32USBHubTable.description: The Win32_USBHub WMI class represents the management characteristics of a USB hub.

hwuhIndex.name: hwuhIndex
hwuhIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwuhAvailability.name: hwuhAvailability
hwuhAvailability.description: Availability and status of the device. Power Save - Unknown indicates that the device is known to be in a power save mode, but its exact status is unknown; Power Save - Low Power Mode indicates that the device is in a power save state but still functioning, and may exhibit degraded performance; Power Save - Standby indicates that the device is not functioning but could be brought to full power quickly; and Power Save - Warning indicates that the device is in a warning state, though also in a power save mode. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwuhCaption.name: hwuhCaption
hwuhCaption.description: Short description (one-line string) of the CIM_Setting object. This property is inherited from CIM_Setting.

hwuhClassCode.name: hwuhClassCode
hwuhClassCode.description: USB class code. This property is inherited from CIM_USBHub.

hwuhConfigManagerErrorCode.name: hwuhConfigManagerErrorCode
hwuhConfigManagerErrorCode.description: Windows Configuration Manager error code. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwuhConfigManagerUserCode.name: hwuhConfigManagerUserCode
hwuhConfigManagerUserCode.description: If TRUE, the device is using a user-defined configuration. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwuhCreationClassName.name: hwuhCreationClassName
hwuhCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class to appear in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be uniquely identified. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwuhCurrentAlternativeSettings.name: hwuhCurrentAlternativeSettings
hwuhCurrentAlternativeSettings.description: Array of USB alternate settings for each interface in the currently selected configuration (indicated by the CurrentConfigValue property). This array has one entry for each interface in the configuration. If the property, CurrentConfigValue is 0 (indicating that the device is not configured), the array is undefined. To understand how to parse this octet string, refer to the USB specification. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwuhCurrentConfigValue.name: hwuhCurrentConfigValue
hwuhCurrentConfigValue.description: Configuration currently configured for this device. If this value is 0, the device is not configured. This property is inherited from CIM_USBDevice.

hwuhDescription.name: hwuhDescription
hwuhDescription.description: Textual description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwuhDeviceID.name: hwuhDeviceID
hwuhDeviceID.description: Address or other identifying information to name the logical device uniquely. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwuhErrorCleared.name: hwuhErrorCleared
hwuhErrorCleared.description: Indicates that the error reported in the LastErrorCode property is now cleared. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwuhErrorDescription.name: hwuhErrorDescription
hwuhErrorDescription.description: Free-form string supplying more information about the error recorded in LastErrorCode property, and information on any corrective actions that may be taken. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwuhGangSwitched.name: hwuhGangSwitched
hwuhGangSwitched.description: If TRUE, power is switched to all ports on the HUB at one time. If FALSE, power is switched individually for each port. This property is inherited from CIM_USBHub.

hwuhInstallDate.name: hwuhInstallDate
hwuhInstallDate.description: Date the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwuhLastErrorCode.name: hwuhLastErrorCode
hwuhLastErrorCode.description: Last error code reported by the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwuhName.name: hwuhName
hwuhName.description: Name of the USB hub. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwuhNumberOfConfigs.name: hwuhNumberOfConfigs
hwuhNumberOfConfigs.description: Number of defined device configurations. This property is inherited from CIM_USBDevice.

hwuhNumberOfPorts.name: hwuhNumberOfPorts
hwuhNumberOfPorts.description: Number of downstream ports on the hub, including those embedded in the hub's silicon. This property is inherited from CIM_USBHub.

hwuhPNPDeviceID.name: hwuhPNPDeviceID
hwuhPNPDeviceID.description: Windows Plug and Play device identifier of the logical device. Example: *PNP030b. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwuhPowerManagementCapabilities.name: hwuhPowerManagementCapabilities
hwuhPowerManagementCapabilities.description: Specific power-related capabilities of the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_USBHub. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Not Supported 2 Disabled 3 Enabled 4 Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically 5 Power State Settable 6 Power Cycling Supported 7 Timed Power On Supported

hwuhPowerManagementSupported.name: hwuhPowerManagementSupported
hwuhPowerManagementSupported.description: If TRUE, the device can be power managed; that is, put into a power save state. This Boolean value does not indicate that power management features are currently enabled, or if enabled, what features are supported. For more information, see the PowerManagementCapabilities array for this information. If FALSE, the integer value 1, for the string 'Not Supported', should be the only entry in the PowerManagementCapabilities array. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwuhProtocolCode.name: hwuhProtocolCode
hwuhProtocolCode.description: USB protocol code. This property is inherited from CIM_USBDevice.

hwuhStatus.name: hwuhStatus
hwuhStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwuhStatusInfo.name: hwuhStatusInfo
hwuhStatusInfo.description: State of the logical device. If this property does not apply to the logical device, the value 5 (Not Applicable) should be used. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwuhSubclassCode.name: hwuhSubclassCode
hwuhSubclassCode.description: USB subclass code. This property is inherited from CIM_USBDevice.

hwuhSystemCreationClassName.name: hwuhSystemCreationClassName
hwuhSystemCreationClassName.description: Creation class name for the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwuhSystemName.name: hwuhSystemName
hwuhSystemName.description: Name of the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwuhUSBVersion.name: hwuhUSBVersion
hwuhUSBVersion.description: Latest USB version supported by the USB device. The property is expressed as a binary-coded decimal (BCD), where a decimal point is implied between the second and third digits. For example, a value of 0x201 indicates that version 2.01 is supported. This property is inherited from CIM_USBDevice.

wmiNetworkingDevice.name: wmiNetworkingDevice
wmiNetworkingDevice.description: The Networking Devices subcategory groups classes that represent the network interface controller, its configurations, and its settings.

win32NetworkAdapterTable.name: win32NetworkAdapterTable
win32NetworkAdapterTable.description: The Win32_NetworkAdapter WMI class represents a network adapter on a Windows operating system.

hwnaIndex.name: hwnaIndex
hwnaIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwnaAdapterType.name: hwnaAdapterType
hwnaAdapterType.description: Network medium in use. This property may not be applicable to all types of network adapters listed within this class Windows NT only. 'Ethernet 802.3' 'Token Ring 802.5' 'Fiber Distributed Data Interface (FDDI)' 'Wide Area Network (WAN)' 'LocalTalk' 'Ethernet using DIX header format' 'ARCNET' 'ARCNET (878.2)' 'ATM' 'Wireless' 'Infrared Wireless' 'Bpc' 'CoWan' '1394'

hwnaAdapterTypeID.name: hwnaAdapterTypeID
hwnaAdapterTypeID.description: Network medium in use. Gives the same information as the AdapterType property, except that the information is in the form of an integer. This property may not be applicable to all types of network adapters listed Windows NT only. This property is new for Windows XP.

hwnaAutoSense.name: hwnaAutoSense
hwnaAutoSense.description: If TRUE, the network adapter is capable of automatically determining the speed of the attached/network media. This property is inherited from CIM_NetworkAdapter.

hwnaAvailability.name: hwnaAvailability
hwnaAvailability.description: Availability and status of the device. Power Save - Unknown indicates that the device is known to be in a power save mode, but its exact status is unknown; Power Save - Low Power Mode indicates that the device is in a power save state but still functioning, and may exhibit degraded performance; Power Save - Standby indicates that the device is not functioning but could be brought to full power quickly; and Power Save - Warning indicates that the device is in a warning state, though also in a power save mode. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwnaCaption.name: hwnaCaption
hwnaCaption.description: Short description of the object a one-line string. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwnaConfigManagerErrorCode.name: hwnaConfigManagerErrorCode
hwnaConfigManagerErrorCode.description: Windows Configuration Manager error code. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwnaConfigManagerUserConfig.name: hwnaConfigManagerUserConfig
hwnaConfigManagerUserConfig.description: If TRUE, the device is using a user-defined configuration. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwnaCreationClassName.name: hwnaCreationClassName
