hwnaCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class to appear in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be uniquely identified. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwnaDescription.name: hwnaDescription
hwnaDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwnaDeviceID.name: hwnaDeviceID
hwnaDeviceID.description: Unique identifier of the network adapter from other devices on the system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwnaErrorCleared.name: hwnaErrorCleared
hwnaErrorCleared.description: If TRUE, the error reported in LastErrorCode is now cleared. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwnaErrorDescription.name: hwnaErrorDescription
hwnaErrorDescription.description: More information about the error recorded in LastErrorCode, and information on any corrective actions that may be taken. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwnaRegistryIndex.name: hwnaRegistryIndex
hwnaRegistryIndex.description: Index number of the network adapter, stored in the system registry. Example: 0

hwnaInstallDate.name: hwnaInstallDate
hwnaInstallDate.description: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwnaInstalled.name: hwnaInstalled
hwnaInstalled.description: If TRUE, the network adapter is installed in the system.

hwnaInterfaceIndex.name: hwnaInterfaceIndex
hwnaInterfaceIndex.description: Index value that uniquely identifies the local network interface. The value in this property is the same as the value in the InterfaceIndex property in the instance of Win32_IP4RouteTable that represents the network interface in the route table. Windows XP and earlier: The InterfaceIndex property is not available.

hwnaLastErrorCode.name: hwnaLastErrorCode
hwnaLastErrorCode.description: Last error code reported by the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwnaMACAddress.name: hwnaMACAddress
hwnaMACAddress.description: Media access control address for this network adapter. A MAC address is a unique 48-bit number assigned to the network adapter by the manufacturer. It uniquely identifies this network adapter and is used for mapping TCP/IP network communications.

hwnaManufacturer.name: hwnaManufacturer
hwnaManufacturer.description: Name of the network adapter's manufacturer. Example: '3COM'

hwnaMaxNumberControlled.name: hwnaMaxNumberControlled
hwnaMaxNumberControlled.description: Maximum number of directly addressable ports supported by this network adapter. A value of 0 should be used if the number is unknown.

hwnaMaxSpeed.name: hwnaMaxSpeed
hwnaMaxSpeed.description: Maximum speed, in bits per second, for the network adapter. This property is inherited from CIM_NetworkAdapter.

hwnaName.name: hwnaName
hwnaName.description: Label by which the object is known. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwnaNetConnectionID.name: hwnaNetConnectionID
hwnaNetConnectionID.description: Name of the network connection as it appears in the Network Connections Control Panel program. This property is new for Windows XP.

hwnaNetConnectionStatus.name: hwnaNetConnectionStatus
hwnaNetConnectionStatus.description: State of the network adapter's connection to the network. This property is new for Windows XP.

hwnaNetworkAddresses.name: hwnaNetworkAddresses
hwnaNetworkAddresses.description: Array of network addresses for an adapter. This property is inherited from CIM_NetworkAdapter.

hwnaPermanentAddress.name: hwnaPermanentAddress
hwnaPermanentAddress.description: Network address hard-coded into an adapter. This hard-coded address may be changed by firmware upgrade or software configuration. If so, this field should be updated when the change is made. The property should be left blank if no hard-coded address exists for the network adapter. This property is inherited from CIM_NetworkAdapter.

hwnaPNPDeviceID.name: hwnaPNPDeviceID
hwnaPNPDeviceID.description: Windows Plug and Play device identifier of the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: '*PNP030b'

hwnaPowerManagementCapabilities.name: hwnaPowerManagementCapabilities
hwnaPowerManagementCapabilities.description: Array of the specific power-related capabilities of a logical device. The Enabled value indicates that the power management features are currently enabled but the exact feature set is unknown or the information is unavailable. Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically indicates that a device can change its power state based on usage or other criteria. Power State Settable indicates that the SetPowerState method is supported. Power Cycling Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle). Timed Power On Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle) and Time set to a specific date and time, or interval, for power-on. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Not Supported 2 Disabled 3 Enabled 4 Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically 5 Power State Settable 6 Power Cycling Supported 7 Timed Power On Supported

hwnaPowerManagementSupported.name: hwnaPowerManagementSupported
hwnaPowerManagementSupported.description: If TRUE, the device can be power-managed (can be put into suspend mode, and so on). The property does not indicate that power management features are currently enabled, only that the logical device is capable of power management. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwnaProductName.name: hwnaProductName
hwnaProductName.description: Product name of the network adapter. Example: 'Fast EtherLink XL'

hwnaServiceName.name: hwnaServiceName
hwnaServiceName.description: Service name of the network adapter. This name is usually shorter than the full product name. Example: 'Elnkii'

hwnaSpeed.name: hwnaSpeed
hwnaSpeed.description: Estimate of the current bandwidth in bits per second. For endpoints which vary in bandwidth or for those where no accurate estimation can be made, this property should contain the nominal bandwidth. This property is inherited from CIM_NetworkAdapter.

hwnaStatus.name: hwnaStatus
hwnaStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwnaStatusInfo.name: hwnaStatusInfo
hwnaStatusInfo.description: State of the logical device. If this property does not apply to the logical device, the value 5 (Not Applicable) should be used. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwnaSystemCreationClassName.name: hwnaSystemCreationClassName
hwnaSystemCreationClassName.description: Value of the scoping computer's CreationClassName property. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwnaSystemName.name: hwnaSystemName
hwnaSystemName.description: Name of the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwnaTimeOfLastReset.name: hwnaTimeOfLastReset
hwnaTimeOfLastReset.description: Date and time the network adapter was last reset.

win32NetworkAdapterConfigTable.name: win32NetworkAdapterConfigTable
win32NetworkAdapterConfigTable.description: The Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration WMI class represents the attributes and behaviors of a network adapter. This class includes extra properties and methods that support the management of the TCP/IP and Internetworking Packet Exchange (IPX) protocols that are independent from the network adapter.

hwnacIndex.name: hwnacIndex
hwnacIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwnacArpAlwaysSourceRoute.name: hwnacArpAlwaysSourceRoute
hwnacArpAlwaysSourceRoute.description: If TRUE, TCP/IP transmits Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) queries with source routing enabled on Token Ring networks. By default (FALSE), ARP first queries without source routing, and then retries with source routing enabled if no reply is received. Source routing allows the routing of network packets across different types of networks.

hwnacArpUseEtherSNAP.name: hwnacArpUseEtherSNAP
hwnacArpUseEtherSNAP.description: If TRUE, Ethernet packets follow the IEEE 802.3 Sub-Network Access Protocol (SNAP) encoding. Setting this parameter to 1 forces TCP/IP to transmit Ethernet packets by using 802.3 SNAP encoding. By default (FALSE), the stack transmits packets in DIX Ethernet format. Windows NT/Windows 2000 systems can receive both formats.

hwnacCaption.name: hwnacCaption
hwnacCaption.description: Description of the CIM_Setting object a one-line string. This property is inherited from CIM_Setting.

hwnacDatabasePath.name: hwnacDatabasePath
hwnacDatabasePath.description: Valid Windows file path to standard Internet database files (HOSTS, LMHOSTS, NETWORKS, PROTOCOLS). The file path is used by the Windows Sockets interface. This property is only available on Windows NT/Windows 2000 systems.

hwnacDeadGWDetectEnabled.name: hwnacDeadGWDetectEnabled
hwnacDeadGWDetectEnabled.description: If TRUE, dead gateway detection occurs. With this feature enabled, Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) asks Internet Protocol (IP) to change to a backup gateway if it re-transmits a segment several times without receiving a response.

hwnacDefaultIPGateway.name: hwnacDefaultIPGateway
hwnacDefaultIPGateway.description: Array of IP addresses of default gateways that the computer system uses. Example: '192.168.12.1 192.168.46.1'

hwnacDefaultTOS.name: hwnacDefaultTOS
hwnacDefaultTOS.description: Default Type Of Service (TOS) value set in the header of outgoing IP packets. Request for Comments (RFC) 791 defines the values. Default: 0, Valid Range: 0 - 255.

hwnacDefaultTTL.name: hwnacDefaultTTL
hwnacDefaultTTL.description: Default Time To Live (TTL) value set in the header of outgoing IP packets. The TTL specifies the number of routers an IP packet can pass through to reach its destination before being discarded. Each router decrements by one the TTL count of a packet as it passes through and discards the packets if the TTL is 0 (zero). Default: 32, Valid Range: 1 - 255.

hwnacDescription.name: hwnacDescription
hwnacDescription.description: Description of the CIM_Setting object. This property is inherited from CIM_Setting.

hwnacDHCPEnabled.name: hwnacDHCPEnabled
hwnacDHCPEnabled.description: If TRUE, the dynamic host configuration protocol (DHCP) server automatically assigns an IP address to the computer system when establishing a network connection.

hwnacDHCPLeaseExpires.name: hwnacDHCPLeaseExpires
hwnacDHCPLeaseExpires.description: Expiration date and time for a leased IP address that was assigned to the computer by the dynamic host configuration protocol (DHCP) server. Example: 20521201000230.000000000

hwnacDHCPLeaseObtained.name: hwnacDHCPLeaseObtained
hwnacDHCPLeaseObtained.description: Date and time the lease was obtained for the IP address assigned to the computer by the dynamic host configuration protocol (DHCP) server. Example: 19521201000230.000000000

hwnacDHCPServer.name: hwnacDHCPServer
hwnacDHCPServer.description: IP address of the dynamic host configuration protocol (DHCP) server. Example: '10.55.34'

hwnacDNSDomain.name: hwnacDNSDomain
hwnacDNSDomain.description: Organization name followed by a period and an extension that indicates the type of organization, such as microsoft.com. The name can be any combination of the letters A through Z, the numerals 0 through 9, and the hyphen (-), plus the period (.) character used as a separator. Example: 'microsoft.com'

hwnacDNSDomainSuffixSearchOrder.name: hwnacDNSDomainSuffixSearchOrder
hwnacDNSDomainSuffixSearchOrder.description: Array of DNS domain suffixes to be appended to the end of host names during name resolution. When attempting to resolve a fully-qualified domain name (FQDN) from a host only name, the system will first append the local domain name. If this is not successful, the system will use the domain suffix list to create additional FQDNs in the order listed and query DNS servers for each Example: 'samples.microsoft.com example.microsoft.com'

hwnacDNSEnabledForWINSResolution.name: hwnacDNSEnabledForWINSResolution
hwnacDNSEnabledForWINSResolution.description: If TRUE, the Domain Name System (DNS) is enabled for name resolution over Windows Internet Naming Service (WINS) resolution. If the name cannot be resolved using DNS, the name request is forwarded to WINS for resolution.

hwnacDNSHostName.name: hwnacDNSHostName
hwnacDNSHostName.description: Host name used to identify the local computer for authentication by some utilities. Other TCP/IP-based utilities can use this value to acquire the name of the local computer. Host names are stored on DNS servers in a table that maps names to IP addresses for use by DNS. The name can be any combination of the letters A through Z, the numerals 0 through 9, and the hyphen (-), plus the period (.) character used as a separator. By default, this value is the Microsoft networking computer name, but the network administrator can assign another host name without affecting the computer name. Example: 'corpdns'

hwnacDNSServerSearchOrder.name: hwnacDNSServerSearchOrder
hwnacDNSServerSearchOrder.description: Array of server IP addresses to be used in querying for DNS servers.

hwnacDomainDNSRegistrationEnable.name: hwnacDomainDNSRegistrationEnable
hwnacDomainDNSRegistrationEnable.description: If TRUE, the IP addresses for this connection are registered in DNS under the domain name of this connection in addition to being registered under the computer's full DNS name. The domain name of this connection is either set using the SetDNSDomain() method or assigned by DSCP. The registered name is the host name of the computer with the domain name appended. This property is new for Windows XP.

hwnacForwardBufferMemory.name: hwnacForwardBufferMemory
hwnacForwardBufferMemory.description: Memory allocated by IP to store packet data in the router packet queue. When this buffer space is filled, the router begins discarding packets at random from its queue. Packet queue data buffers are 256 bytes in length, so the value of this parameter should be a multiple of 256. Multiple buffers are chained together for larger packets. The IP header for a packet is stored separately. This parameter is ignored and no buffers are allocated if the IP router is not enabled. The buffer size can range from the network MTU to the a value smaller than 0xFFFFFFFF. Default: 74240 (fifty 1480-byte packets, rounded to a multiple of 256).

hwnacFullDNSRegistrationEnabled.name: hwnacFullDNSRegistrationEnabled
hwnacFullDNSRegistrationEnabled.description: If TRUE, the IP addresses for this connection are registered in DNS under the computer's full DNS name. The full DNS name of the computer is displayed on the Network Identification tab in the System application in Control Panel. This property is new for Windows XP.

hwnacGatewayCostMetric.name: hwnacGatewayCostMetric
hwnacGatewayCostMetric.description: Array of integer cost metric values (ranging from 1 to 9999) to be used in calculating the fastest, most reliable, or least expensive routes. This argument has a one-to-one correspondence with the DefaultIPGateway property. Windows 2000 only.

hwnacIGMPLevel.name: hwnacIGMPLevel
hwnacIGMPLevel.description: Extent to which the system supports IP multicast and participates in the Internet Group Management Protocol. At level 0 (zero), the system provides no multicast support. At level 1, the system may only send IP multicast packets. At level 2, the system may send IP multicast packets and fully participate in IGMP to receive multicast packets.

hwnacConfigurationIndex.name: hwnacConfigurationIndex
hwnacConfigurationIndex.description: Index number of the Windows network adapter configuration. The index number is used when there is more than one configuration available.

hwnacInterfaceIndex.name: hwnacInterfaceIndex
hwnacInterfaceIndex.description: Index value that uniquely identifies a local network interface. The value in this property is the same as the value in the InterfaceIndex property in the instance of Win32_IP4RouteTable that represents the network interface in the route table. Windows XP and earlier: The InterfaceIndex property is not available.

hwnacIPAddress.name: hwnacIPAddress
hwnacIPAddress.description: Array of all of the IP addresses associated with the current network adapter. Example: '172.16.22.0'

hwnacIPConnectionMetric.name: hwnacIPConnectionMetric
hwnacIPConnectionMetric.description: Cost of using the configured routes for the IP bound adapter and is the weighted value for those routes in the IP routing table. If there are multiple routes to a destination in the IP routing table, the route with the lowest metric is used. The default value is 1. This property is new for Windows XP.

hwnacIPEnabled.name: hwnacIPEnabled
hwnacIPEnabled.description: If TRUE, TCP/IP is bound and enabled on this network adapter.

hwnacIPFilterSecurityEnabled.name: hwnacIPFilterSecurityEnabled
hwnacIPFilterSecurityEnabled.description: If TRUE, IP port security is enabled globally across all IP-bound network adapters and the security values associated with individual network adapters are in effect. This property is used in conjunction with IPSecPermitTCPPorts, IPSecPermitUDPPorts, and IPSecPermitIPProtocols. If FALSE, IP filter security is disabled across all network adapters and allows all port and protocol traffic to flow unfiltered.

hwnacIPPortSecurityEnabled.name: hwnacIPPortSecurityEnabled
hwnacIPPortSecurityEnabled.description: If TRUE, IP port security is enabled globally across all IP-bound network adapters. This property is obsolete. In place of this property, you should use IPFilterSecurityEnabled.

hwnacIPSecPermitIPProtocols.name: hwnacIPSecPermitIPProtocols
hwnacIPSecPermitIPProtocols.description: Array of the protocols permitted to run over the IP. The list of protocols is defined using the EnableIPSec method. The list will either be empty or contain numeric values. A numeric value of 0 (zero) indicates access permission is granted for all protocols. An empty string indicates that no protocols are permitted to run when IPFilterSecurityEnabled is TRUE.

hwnacIPSecPermitTCPPorts.name: hwnacIPSecPermitTCPPorts
hwnacIPSecPermitTCPPorts.description: Array of the ports that will be granted access permission for TCP. The list of protocols is defined using the EnableIPSec method. The list will either be empty or contain numeric values. A numeric value of 0 (zero)indicates access permission is granted for all ports. An empty string indicates that no ports are granted access permission when IPFilterSecurityEnabled is TRUE.

hwnacIPSecPermitUDPPorts.name: hwnacIPSecPermitUDPPorts
hwnacIPSecPermitUDPPorts.description: Array of the ports that will be granted User Datagram Protocol (UDP) access permission. The list of protocols is defined using the EnableIPSec method. The list will either be empty or contain numeric values. A numeric value of 0 (zero) indicates access permission is granted for all ports. An empty string indicates that no ports are granted access permission when IPFilterSecurityEnabled is TRUE.

hwnacIPSubnet.name: hwnacIPSubnet
hwnacIPSubnet.description: Array of all the subnet masks associated with the current network adapter. Example: '255.255.0'

hwnacIPUseZeroBroadcast.name: hwnacIPUseZeroBroadcast
hwnacIPUseZeroBroadcast.description: If TRUE, IP zeros-broadcasts are used (0.0.0.0), and the system uses ones-broadcasts (255.255.255.255). Computer systems generally use ones-broadcasts, but those derived from BSD implementations use zeros-broadcasts. Systems that do not use that same broadcasts will not interoperate on the same network. The default is FALSE.

hwnacIPXAddress.name: hwnacIPXAddress
hwnacIPXAddress.description: Internetworking Packet Exchange (IPX) address of the network adapter. The IPX address identifies a computer system on a network using the IPX protocol.

hwnacIPXEnabled.name: hwnacIPXEnabled
hwnacIPXEnabled.description: If TRUE, the or Internetwork Packet Exchange (IPX) protocol is bound and enabled for this adapter.

hwnacIPXFrameType.name: hwnacIPXFrameType
hwnacIPXFrameType.description: Array of frame type identifiers. The values in this array correspond to the elements in IPXNetworkNumber. Value Meaning 0 Ethernet II 1 Ethernet 802.3 2 Ethernet 802.2 3 Ethernet SNAP 255 AUTO

hwnacIPXMediaType.name: hwnacIPXMediaType
hwnacIPXMediaType.description: Internetworking Packet Exchange (IPX) media type identifier.

hwnacIPXNetworkNumber.name: hwnacIPXNetworkNumber
hwnacIPXNetworkNumber.description: Array of characters that uniquely identifies a frame/network adapter combination on the computer system. The NetWare Link (NWLink) IPX/SPX-compatible transport in Windows 2000 and Windows NT 4.0 and later use two distinctly different types of network numbers. This number is sometimes referred to as the external network number. It must be unique for each network segment. The order in this string list will correspond item-for-item with the elements in the IPXFrameType property.

hwnacIPXVirtualNetNumber.name: hwnacIPXVirtualNetNumber
hwnacIPXVirtualNetNumber.description: Unique identifier of the computer system on the network. It is represented in the form of an eight-character hexadecimal digit. Windows NT/Windows 2000 uses the virtual network number (also known as an internal network number) for internal routing.

hwnacKeepAliveInterval.name: hwnacKeepAliveInterval
hwnacKeepAliveInterval.description: Interval separating Keep Alive Retransmissions until a response is received. After a response is received, the delay until the next Keep Alive Transmission is again controlled by the value of KeepAliveTime. The connection will be aborted after the number of retransmissions specified by TcpMaxDataRetransmissions have gone unanswered. Default: 1000, Valid Range: 1 - 0xFFFFFFFF.

hwnacKeepAliveTime.name: hwnacKeepAliveTime
hwnacKeepAliveTime.description: The KeepAliveTime property indicates how often the TCP attempts to verify that an idle connection is still intact by sending a Keep Alive Packet. A remote system that is reachable will acknowledge the keep alive transmission. Keep Alive packets are not sent by default. This feature may be enabled in a connection by an application. Default: 7,200,000 (two hours)

hwnacMACAddress.name: hwnacMACAddress
hwnacMACAddress.description: Media Access Control (MAC) address of the network adapter. A MAC address is assigned by the manufacturer to uniquely identify the network adapter. Example: '00:80:C7:8F:6C:96'

hwnacMTU.name: hwnacMTU
hwnacMTU.description: Overrides the default Maximum Transmission Unit (MTU) for a network interface. The MTU is the maximum packet size (including the transport header) that the transport will transmit over the underlying network. The IP datagram can span multiple packets. The range of this value spans the minimum packet size (68) to the MTU supported by the underlying network.

hwnacNumForwardPackets.name: hwnacNumForwardPackets
hwnacNumForwardPackets.description: Number of IP packet headers allocated for the router packet queue. When all headers are in use, the router will begin to discard packets from the queue at random. This value should be at least as large as the ForwardBufferMemory value divided by the maximum IP data size of the networks connected to the router. It should be no larger than the ForwardBufferMemory value divided by 256, since at least 256 bytes of forward buffer memory are used for each packet. The optimal number of forward packets for a given ForwardBufferMemory size depends on the type of traffic on the network. It will be somewhere between these two values. If the router is not enabled, this parameter is ignored and no headers are allocated. Default: 50, Valid Range: 1 - 0xFFFFFFFE

hwnacPMTUBHDetectEnabled.name: hwnacPMTUBHDetectEnabled
hwnacPMTUBHDetectEnabled.description: If TRUE, detection of black hole routers occurs while TCP discovers the path of the Maximum Transmission Unit. A black hole router does not return ICMP Destination Unreachable messages when it needs to fragment an IP datagram with the Don't Fragment bit set. TCP depends on receiving these messages to perform Path MTU Discovery. With this feature enabled, TCP will try to send segments without the Don't Fragment bit set if several retransmissions of a segment go unacknowledged. If the segment is acknowledged as a result, the MSS will be decreased and the Don't Fragment bit will be set in future packets on the connection. Enabling black hole detection increases the maximum number of retransmissions performed for a given segment. The default value of this property is FALSE.

hwnacPMTUDiscoveryEnabled.name: hwnacPMTUDiscoveryEnabled
hwnacPMTUDiscoveryEnabled.description: If TRUE, the Maximum Transmission Unit (MTU) path is discovered over the path to a remote host. By discovering the MTU path and limiting TCP segments to this size, TCP can eliminate fragmentation at routers along the path that connect networks with different MTUs. Fragmentation adversely affects TCP throughput and network congestion. Setting this parameter to FALSE causes an MTU of 576 bytes to be used for all connections that are not to machines on the local subnet. The default is TRUE.

hwnacServiceName.name: hwnacServiceName
hwnacServiceName.description: Service name of the network adapter. This name is usually shorter than the full product name. Example: 'Elnkii'

hwnacSettingID.name: hwnacSettingID
hwnacSettingID.description: Identifier by which the CIM_Setting object is known. This property is inherited from CIM_Setting.

hwnacTcpipNetbiosOptions.name: hwnacTcpipNetbiosOptions
hwnacTcpipNetbiosOptions.description: Bitmap of the possible settings related to NetBIOSover TCP/IP. This property is new for Windows XP.

hwnacTcpMaxConnectRetransmission.name: hwnacTcpMaxConnectRetransmission
hwnacTcpMaxConnectRetransmission.description: Number of times TCP attempts to retransmit a Connect Request before terminating the connection. The initial retransmission timeout is 3 seconds. The retransmission timeout doubles for each attempt. Default: 3, Valid Range: 0 - 0xFFFFFFFF.

hwnacTcpMaxDataRetransmissions.name: hwnacTcpMaxDataRetransmissions
hwnacTcpMaxDataRetransmissions.description: Number of times TCP re-transmits an individual data segment (non-connect segment) before terminating the connection. The retransmission time-out doubles with each successive retransmission on a connection. Default: 5, Valid Range: 0 - 0xFFFFFFFF.

hwnacTcpNumConnections.name: hwnacTcpNumConnections
hwnacTcpNumConnections.description: Maximum number of connections that TCP can have open simultaneously. Default: 0xFFFFFE, Valid Range: 0 - 0xFFFFFE.

hwnacTcpUseRFC1122UrgentPointer.name: hwnacTcpUseRFC1122UrgentPointer
hwnacTcpUseRFC1122UrgentPointer.description: If TRUE, TCP uses the RFC 1122 specification for urgent data. If FALSE (default), TCP uses the mode used by Berkeley Software Design (BSD) derived systems. The two mechanisms interpret the urgent pointer differently and are not interoperable. Windows 2000 and Windows NT version 3.51 and later default to BSD mode.

hwnacTcpWindowSize.name: hwnacTcpWindowSize
hwnacTcpWindowSize.description: Maximum TCP Receive Window size offered by the system. The Receive Window specifies the number of bytes a sender may transmit without receiving an acknowledgment. In general, larger receiving windows will improve performance over high delay and high bandwidth networks. For efficiency, the receiving window should be an even multiple of the TCP Maximum Segment Size (MSS). Default: Four times the maximum TCP data size or an even multiple of TCP data size rounded up to the nearest multiple of 8192. Ethernet networks default to 8760. Valid range: 0 - 65535.

hwnacWINSEnableLMHostsLookup.name: hwnacWINSEnableLMHostsLookup
hwnacWINSEnableLMHostsLookup.description: If TRUE, local lookup files are used. Lookup files will contain a map of IP addresses to host names. If they exist on the local system, they will be found in %SystemRoot%\system32\drivers\etc.

hwnacWINSHostLookupFile.name: hwnacWINSHostLookupFile
hwnacWINSHostLookupFile.description: Path to a WINS lookup file on the local system. This file will contain a map of IP addresses to host names. If the file specified in this property is found, it will be copied to the %SystemRoot%\system32\drivers\etc folder of the local system. Valid only if the WINSEnableLMHostsLookup property is TRUE.

hwnacWINSPrimaryServer.name: hwnacWINSPrimaryServer
hwnacWINSPrimaryServer.description: IP address for the primary WINS server.

hwnacWINSScopeID.name: hwnacWINSScopeID
hwnacWINSScopeID.description: Value appended to the end of the NetBIOS name that isolates a group of computer systems communicating with only each other. It is used for all NetBIOS transactions over TCP/IP communications from that computer system. Computers configured with identical scope identifiers are able to communicate with this computer. TCP/IP clients with different scope identifiers disregard packets from computers with this scope identifier. Valid only when the EnableWINS method executes successfully.

hwnacWINSSecondaryServer.name: hwnacWINSSecondaryServer
hwnacWINSSecondaryServer.description: IP address for the secondary WINS server.

wmiPower.name: wmiPower
wmiPower.description: The Power subcategory groups classes that represent power supplies, batteries, and events related to these devices.

win32BatteryTable.name: win32BatteryTable
win32BatteryTable.description: The Win32_Battery WMI class represents a battery connected to the computer system. Windows 2000 and Windows 98 do not report instances of Win32_Battery unless Advanced Power Management (APM) is enabled on the system, and a battery is present.

hwbaIndex.name: hwbaIndex
hwbaIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwbaAvailability.name: hwbaAvailability
hwbaAvailability.description: Availability and status of the device. Power Save - Unknown indicates that the device is known to be in a power save mode, but its exact status is unknown; Power Save - Low Power Mode indicates that the device is in a power save state but still functioning, and may exhibit degraded performance; Power Save - Standby indicates that the device is not functioning but could be brought to full power quickly; and Power Save - Warning indicates that the device is in a warning state, though also in a power save mode. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwbaBatteryRechargeTime.name: hwbaBatteryRechargeTime
hwbaBatteryRechargeTime.description: Time required to fully charge the battery. This property is not supported. BatteryRechargeTime does not have a replacement property, and is now considered obsolete.

hwbaBatteryStatus.name: hwbaBatteryStatus
hwbaBatteryStatus.description: Status of the battery. The value 10 (Undefined) is not valid in the CIM schema because in DMI it represents that no battery is installed. In this case, the object should not be instantiated. This property is inherited from CIM_Battery.

hwbaCaption.name: hwbaCaption
hwbaCaption.description: Short description of the object a one-line string. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwbaChemistry.name: hwbaChemistry
hwbaChemistry.description: Enumeration that describes the battery's chemistry. This property is inherited from CIM_Battery.

hwbaConfigManagerErrorCode.name: hwbaConfigManagerErrorCode
hwbaConfigManagerErrorCode.description: Windows Configuration Manager error code. For more information, see the Remarks section of this topic. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwbaConfigManagerUserConfig.name: hwbaConfigManagerUserConfig
hwbaConfigManagerUserConfig.description: If true, the device is using a user-defined configuration. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwbaCreationClassName.name: hwbaCreationClassName
hwbaCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class that appears in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be identified uniquely. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwbaDescription.name: hwbaDescription
hwbaDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwbaDesignCapacity.name: hwbaDesignCapacity
hwbaDesignCapacity.description: Design capacity of the battery in milliwatt-hours. If the property is not supported, enter 0 (zero). This property is inherited from CIM_Battery.

hwbaDesignVoltage.name: hwbaDesignVoltage
hwbaDesignVoltage.description: Design voltage of the battery in millivolts. If the attribute is not supported, enter 0 (zero). This property is inherited from CIM_Battery.

hwbaDeviceID.name: hwbaDeviceID
hwbaDeviceID.description: Identifies the battery. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: 'Internal Battery'

hwbaErrorCleared.name: hwbaErrorCleared
hwbaErrorCleared.description: If true, the error reported in the LastErrorCode property is now cleared. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwbaErrorDescription.name: hwbaErrorDescription
hwbaErrorDescription.description: Free-form string that supplies more information about the error recorded in LastErrorCode property, and information about any corrective actions that may be taken. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwbaEstimatedChargeRemaining.name: hwbaEstimatedChargeRemaining
hwbaEstimatedChargeRemaining.description: Estimate of the percentage of full charge remaining. This property is inherited from CIM_Battery.

hwbaEstimatedRunTime.name: hwbaEstimatedRunTime
hwbaEstimatedRunTime.description: Estimate in minutes of the time to battery charge depletion under the present load conditions if the utility power is off, or lost and remains off, or a laptop is disconnected from a power source. This property is inherited from CIM_Battery.

hwbaExpectedBatteryLife.name: hwbaExpectedBatteryLife
hwbaExpectedBatteryLife.description: Amount of time it takes to completely drain the battery after it is fully charged. This property is no longer used and is considered obsolete.

hwbaExpectedLife.name: hwbaExpectedLife
hwbaExpectedLife.description: Battery's expected lifetime in minutes, assuming that the battery is fully charged. The property represents the total expected life of the battery, not its current remaining life, which is indicated by the EstimatedRunTime property. This property is inherited from CIM_Battery.

hwbaFullChargeCapacity.name: hwbaFullChargeCapacity
hwbaFullChargeCapacity.description: Full charge capacity of the battery in milliwatt-hours. Comparison of the value to the DesignCapacity property determines when the battery requires replacement. A battery's end of life is typically when the FullChargeCapacity property falls below 80% of the DesignCapacity property. If the property is not supported, enter 0 (zero). This property is inherited from CIM_Battery.

hwbaInstallDate.name: hwbaInstallDate
hwbaInstallDate.description: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwbaLastErrorCode.name: hwbaLastErrorCode
hwbaLastErrorCode.description: Last error code reported by the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwbaMaxRechargeTime.name: hwbaMaxRechargeTime
hwbaMaxRechargeTime.description: Maximum time, in minutes, to fully charge the battery. The property represents the time to recharge a fully depleted battery, not the current remaining charge time, which is indicated in the TimeToFullCharge property. This property is inherited from CIM_Battery.

hwbaName.name: hwbaName
hwbaName.description: Defines the label by which the object is known. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwbaPNPDeviceID.name: hwbaPNPDeviceID
hwbaPNPDeviceID.description: Windows Plug and Play device identifier of the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: '*PNP030b'

hwbaPowerManagementCapabilities.name: hwbaPowerManagementCapabilities
hwbaPowerManagementCapabilities.description: Array of the specific power-related capabilities of a logical device. The Enabled value indicates that the power management features are currently enabled, but the exact feature set is unknown or the information is unavailable. Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically indicates that a device can change its power state based on usage or other criteria. Power State Settable indicates that the SetPowerState method is supported. Power Cycling Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle). Timed Power On Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle) and Time set to a specific date and time, or interval, for power-on. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Not Supported 2 Disabled 3 Enabled 4 Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically 5 Power State Settable 6 Power Cycling Supported 7 Timed Power On Supported

hwbaPowerManagementSupported.name: hwbaPowerManagementSupported
hwbaPowerManagementSupported.description: If TRUE, the device can be power-managed (can be put into suspend mode, and so on). The property does not indicate that power management features are currently enabled, only that the logical device is capable of power management. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwbaSmartBatteryVersion.name: hwbaSmartBatteryVersion
hwbaSmartBatteryVersion.description: Data Specification version number supported by the battery. If the battery does not support this function, the value should be left blank. This property is inherited from CIM_Battery.

hwbaStatus.name: hwbaStatus
hwbaStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwbaStatusInfo.name: hwbaStatusInfo
hwbaStatusInfo.description: State of the logical device. If the property does not apply to the logical device, the value 5 (Not Applicable) should be used. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwbaSystemCreationClassName.name: hwbaSystemCreationClassName
hwbaSystemCreationClassName.description: Value of the scoping computer's CreationClassName property. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwbaSystemName.name: hwbaSystemName
hwbaSystemName.description: Name of the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwbaTimeOnBattery.name: hwbaTimeOnBattery
hwbaTimeOnBattery.description: Elapsed time in seconds since the computer system's UPS last switched to battery power, or the time since the system or UPS was last restarted, whichever is less. If the battery is 'on line', 0 (zero) is returned. This property is inherited from CIM_Battery.

hwbaTimeToFullCharge.name: hwbaTimeToFullCharge
hwbaTimeToFullCharge.description: Remaining time to charge the battery fully in minutes at the current charging rate and usage. This property is inherited from CIM_Battery.

win32CurrentProbeTable.name: win32CurrentProbeTable
win32CurrentProbeTable.description: The Win32_CurrentProbe WMI class represents the properties of a current monitoring sensor (ammeter).

hwcpIndex.name: hwcpIndex
hwcpIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwcpAccuracy.name: hwcpAccuracy
hwcpAccuracy.description: Accuracy of the sensor for the measured property. The value is recorded as plus/minus hundredths of a percent. Accuracy, along with resolution and tolerance, is used to calculate the actual value of the measured physical property. Accuracy may vary and depends on whether or not the device is linear over its dynamic range. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwcpAvailability.name: hwcpAvailability
hwcpAvailability.description: Availability and status of the device. Power Save - Unknown indicates that the device is known to be in a power save mode, but its exact status is unknown; Power Save - Low Power Mode indicates that the device is in a power save state but still functioning, and may exhibit degraded performance; Power Save - Standby indicates that the device is not functioning but could be brought to full power quickly; and Power Save - Warning indicates that the device is in a warning state, though also in a power save mode. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcpCaption.name: hwcpCaption
hwcpCaption.description: Short description of the object a one-line string. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwcpConfigManagerErrorCode.name: hwcpConfigManagerErrorCode
hwcpConfigManagerErrorCode.description: Windows Configuration Manager error code. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcpConfigManagerUserConfig.name: hwcpConfigManagerUserConfig
hwcpConfigManagerUserConfig.description: If TRUE, the device is using a user-defined configuration. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcpCreationClassName.name: hwcpCreationClassName
hwcpCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class that appears in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be identified uniquely. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcpCurrentReading.name: hwcpCurrentReading
hwcpCurrentReading.description: Current value indicated by the sensor. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwcpDescription.name: hwcpDescription
hwcpDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwcpDeviceID.name: hwcpDeviceID
hwcpDeviceID.description: Unique identifier of the current probe. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcpErrorCleared.name: hwcpErrorCleared
hwcpErrorCleared.description: If TRUE, the error reported in LastErrorCode is now cleared. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcpErrorDescription.name: hwcpErrorDescription
hwcpErrorDescription.description: More information about the error recorded in LastErrorCode, and information about any corrective actions that may be taken. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcpInstallDate.name: hwcpInstallDate
hwcpInstallDate.description: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwcpIsLinear.name: hwcpIsLinear
hwcpIsLinear.description: If TRUE, the sensor is linear over its dynamic range. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwcpLastErrorCode.name: hwcpLastErrorCode
hwcpLastErrorCode.description: Last error code reported by the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcpLowerThresholdCritical.name: hwcpLowerThresholdCritical
hwcpLowerThresholdCritical.description: Sensor threshold values specify the ranges (minimum and maximum values) to determine whether or not the sensor is operating under normal, non-critical, critical, or fatal conditions. If CurrentReading is between LowerThresholdCritical and LowerThresholdFatal, the current state is critical. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwcpLowerThresholdFatal.name: hwcpLowerThresholdFatal
hwcpLowerThresholdFatal.description: Sensor's threshold values specify the ranges (minimum and maximum values) for determining whether the sensor is operating under normal, non-critical, critical, or fatal conditions. If CurrentReading is below LowerThresholdFatal, the current state is fatal. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwcpLowerThresholdNonCritical.name: hwcpLowerThresholdNonCritical
hwcpLowerThresholdNonCritical.description: Sensor's threshold values specify the ranges (minimum and maximum values) for determining whether the sensor is operating under normal, non-critical, critical, or fatal conditions. If CurrentReading is between LowerThresholdNonCritical and UpperThresholdNonCritical, the sensor is reporting a normal value. If CurrentReading is between LowerThresholdNonCritical and LowerThresholdCritical, the current state is non-critical. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwcpMaxReadable.name: hwcpMaxReadable
hwcpMaxReadable.description: Largest value of the measured property that can be read by the numeric sensor. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwcpMinReadable.name: hwcpMinReadable
hwcpMinReadable.description: Smallest value of the measured property that can be read by the numeric sensor. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwcpName.name: hwcpName
hwcpName.description: Label by which the object is known. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwcpNominalReading.name: hwcpNominalReading
hwcpNominalReading.description: Normal or expected value for the numeric sensor. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwcpNormalMax.name: hwcpNormalMax
hwcpNormalMax.description: Normal or expected value for the numeric sensor. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwcpNormalMin.name: hwcpNormalMin
hwcpNormalMin.description: Guidance for the user as to the normal minimum range for the numeric sensor. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwcpPNPDeviceID.name: hwcpPNPDeviceID
hwcpPNPDeviceID.description: Windows Plug and Play device identifier of the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: '*PNP030b'

hwcpPowerManagementCapabilities.name: hwcpPowerManagementCapabilities
hwcpPowerManagementCapabilities.description: Array of the specific power-related capabilities of a logical device. The Enabled value indicates that the power management features are currently enabled but the exact feature set is unknown or the information is unavailable. Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically indicates that a device can change its power state based on usage or other criteria. Power State Settable indicates that the SetPowerState method is supported. Power Cycling Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle). Timed Power On Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle) and Time set to a specific date and time, or interval, for power-on. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Not Supported 2 Disabled 3 Enabled 4 Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically 5 Power State Settable 6 Power Cycling Supported 7 Timed Power On Supported

hwcpPowerManagementSupported.name: hwcpPowerManagementSupported
hwcpPowerManagementSupported.description: If TRUE, the device can be power-managed (can be put into suspend mode, and so on). The property does not indicate that power management features are currently enabled, only that the logical device is capable of power management. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcpResolution.name: hwcpResolution
hwcpResolution.description: Ability of the sensor to resolve differences in the measured property. This value may vary depending on whether the device is linear over its dynamic range. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwcpStatus.name: hwcpStatus
hwcpStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwcpStatusInfo.name: hwcpStatusInfo
hwcpStatusInfo.description: State of the logical device. If this property does not apply to the logical device, the value 5 (Not Applicable) should be used. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcpSystemCreationClassName.name: hwcpSystemCreationClassName
hwcpSystemCreationClassName.description: Value for the scoping computer's CreationClassName property. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcpSystemName.name: hwcpSystemName
hwcpSystemName.description: Name of the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwcpTolerance.name: hwcpTolerance
hwcpTolerance.description: Tolerance of the sensor for the measured property. Tolerance, along with resolution and accuracy, is used to calculate the actual value of the measured physical property. Tolerance may vary depending on whether the device is linear over its dynamic range. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwcpUpperThresholdCritical.name: hwcpUpperThresholdCritical
hwcpUpperThresholdCritical.description: Sensor's threshold values specify the ranges (minimum and maximum values) for determining whether the sensor is operating under normal, non-critical, critical, or fatal conditions. If CurrentReading is between UpperThresholdCritical and UpperThresholdFatal, the current state is critical. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwcpUpperThresholdFatal.name: hwcpUpperThresholdFatal
hwcpUpperThresholdFatal.description: Sensor's threshold values specify the ranges (minimum and maximum values) for determining whether the sensor is operating under normal, non-critical, critical, or fatal conditions. If CurrentReading is above UpperThresholdFatal, the current state is fatal. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwcpUpperThresholdNonCritical.name: hwcpUpperThresholdNonCritical
hwcpUpperThresholdNonCritical.description: Sensor's threshold values specify the ranges (minimum and maximum values) for determining whether the sensor is operating under normal, non-critical, critical, or fatal conditions. If CurrentReading is between LowerThresholdNonCritical and UpperThresholdNonCritical, the sensor is reporting a normal value. If CurrentReading is between UpperThresholdNonCritical and UpperThresholdCritical, the current state is non-critical. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

win32PortableBatteryTable.name: win32PortableBatteryTable
win32PortableBatteryTable.description: The Win32_PortableBattery WMI class contains the properties related to a portable battery, such a notebook computer battery.

hwpbIndex.name: hwpbIndex
hwpbIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwpbAvailability.name: hwpbAvailability
hwpbAvailability.description: Availability and status of the device. Power Save - Unknown indicates that the device is known to be in a power save mode, but its exact status is unknown; Power Save - Low Power Mode indicates that the device is in a power save state but still functioning, and may exhibit degraded performance; Power Save - Standby indicates that the device is not functioning but could be brought to full power quickly; and Power Save - Warning indicates that the device is in a warning state, though also in a power save mode. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpbBatteryRechargeTime.name: hwpbBatteryRechargeTime
hwpbBatteryRechargeTime.description: Time required to fully charge the battery. This property is inherited from CIM_Battery. Windows 2000: This property is not supported. Windows XP and Windows Server 2003: This property is removed.

hwpbBatteryStatus.name: hwpbBatteryStatus
hwpbBatteryStatus.description: Description of the battery's charge status. The value 10 (Undefined) is not valid in the Common Information Model (CIM) schema because in Desktop Management Interface (DMI) it represents that no battery is installed. In this case, this object should not be instantiated. This property is inherited from CIM_Battery.

hwpbCapacityMultiplier.name: hwpbCapacityMultiplier
hwpbCapacityMultiplier.description: Multiplication factor of the DesignCapacity value to ensure that the milliwatt hour value does not overflow for Smart Battery Data Specification (SBDS) implementations.

hwpbCaption.name: hwpbCaption
hwpbCaption.description: Short description of the object a one-line string. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpbChemistry.name: hwpbChemistry
hwpbChemistry.description: Chemistry of the battery. This property is inherited from CIM_Battery.

hwpbConfigManagerErrorCode.name: hwpbConfigManagerErrorCode
hwpbConfigManagerErrorCode.description: Windows Configuration Manager error code. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpbConfigManagerUserConfig.name: hwpbConfigManagerUserConfig
hwpbConfigManagerUserConfig.description: If TRUE, the device is using a user-defined configuration. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpbCreationClassName.name: hwpbCreationClassName
hwpbCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class that appears in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be uniquely identified. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpbDescription.name: hwpbDescription
hwpbDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpbDesignCapacity.name: hwpbDesignCapacity
hwpbDesignCapacity.description: Design capacity of the battery in milliwatt-hours. If this property is not supported, enter 0 (zero). This property is inherited from CIM_Battery.

hwpbDesignVoltage.name: hwpbDesignVoltage
hwpbDesignVoltage.description: Design voltage of the battery in Millivolts. If this attribute is not supported, enter 0 (zero). This property is inherited from CIM_Battery.

hwpbDeviceID.name: hwpbDeviceID
hwpbDeviceID.description: Battery identifier. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: 'Internal Battery'

hwpbErrorCleared.name: hwpbErrorCleared
hwpbErrorCleared.description: If TRUE, the error reported in LastErrorCode is now cleared. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpbErrorDescription.name: hwpbErrorDescription
hwpbErrorDescription.description: More information about the error recorded in LastErrorCode, and any corrective actions that may be taken. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpbEstimatedChargeRemaining.name: hwpbEstimatedChargeRemaining
hwpbEstimatedChargeRemaining.description: Estimate of the percentage of full charge remaining. This property is inherited from CIM_Battery.

hwpbEstimatedRunTime.name: hwpbEstimatedRunTime
hwpbEstimatedRunTime.description: Estimate in minutes of the time to battery charge depletion under the present load conditions if the utility power is off, or lost and remains off, or a laptop is disconnected from a power source. This property is inherited from CIM_Battery.

hwpbExpectedBatteryLife.name: hwpbExpectedBatteryLife
hwpbExpectedBatteryLife.description: Amount of time it takes to completely drain the battery after it has been fully charged. This property is inherited from CIM_Battery. Windows 2000: This property is not supported. Windows XP and Windows Server 2003: This property has been removed.

hwpbExpectedLife.name: hwpbExpectedLife
hwpbExpectedLife.description: Battery's expected lifetime in minutes, assuming that the battery is fully charged. This property represents the total expected life of the battery, not its current remaining life, which is indicated by the EstimatedRunTime property. This property is inherited from CIM_Battery.

hwpbFullChargeCapacity.name: hwpbFullChargeCapacity
hwpbFullChargeCapacity.description: Full charge capacity of the battery in milliwatt-hours. Comparison of this value to the DesignCapacity property determines when the battery requires replacement. A battery's end of life is typically when the FullChargeCapacity property falls below 80% of the DesignCapacity property. If this property is not supported, enter 0 (zero). This property is inherited from CIM_Battery.

hwpbInstallDate.name: hwpbInstallDate
hwpbInstallDate.description: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpbLastErrorCode.name: hwpbLastErrorCode
hwpbLastErrorCode.description: Last error code reported by the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpbLocation.name: hwpbLocation
hwpbLocation.description: Physical location of the battery. This property is filled by the computer manufacturer. Example: 'In the back, on the left-hand side'

hwpbManufactureDate.name: hwpbManufactureDate
hwpbManufactureDate.description: Date when the battery was manufactured.

hwpbMaxBatteryError.name: hwpbMaxBatteryError
hwpbMaxBatteryError.description: Difference between the highest estimated amount of energy left in the battery and the current amount reported by the battery.

hwpbMaxRechargeTime.name: hwpbMaxRechargeTime
hwpbMaxRechargeTime.description: Maximum time, in minutes, to fully charge the battery. This property represents the time to recharge a fully depleted battery, not the current remaining charge time, which is indicated in the TimeToFullCharge property. This property is inherited from CIM_Battery.

hwpbName.name: hwpbName
hwpbName.description: Label by which the object is known. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpbPNPDeviceID.name: hwpbPNPDeviceID
hwpbPNPDeviceID.description: Windows Plug and Play device identifier of the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: '*PNP030b'

hwpbPowerManagementCapabilities.name: hwpbPowerManagementCapabilities
hwpbPowerManagementCapabilities.description: Array of the specific power-related capabilities of a logical device. The Enabled value indicates that the power management features are currently enabled but the exact feature set is unknown or the information is unavailable. Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically indicates that a device can change its power state based on usage or other criteria. Power State Settable indicates that the SetPowerState method is supported. Power Cycling Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle). Timed Power On Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle) and Timeset to a specific date and time, or interval, for power-on. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Not Supported 2 Disabled 3 Enabled 4 Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically 5 Power State Settable 6 Power Cycling Supported 7 Timed Power On Supported

hwpbPowerManagementSupported.name: hwpbPowerManagementSupported
hwpbPowerManagementSupported.description: If TRUE, the device can be power-managed (can be put into suspend mode, and so on). The property does not indicate that power management features are currently enabled, only that the logical device is capable of power management. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpbSmartBatteryVersion.name: hwpbSmartBatteryVersion
hwpbSmartBatteryVersion.description: Smart Battery Data Specification version number supported by this battery. If the battery does not support this function, the value should be left blank. This property is inherited from CIM_Battery.

hwpbStatus.name: hwpbStatus
hwpbStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpbStatusInfo.name: hwpbStatusInfo
hwpbStatusInfo.description: State of the logical device. If this property does not apply to the logical device, the value 5 (Not Applicable) should be used. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpbSystemCreationClassName.name: hwpbSystemCreationClassName
hwpbSystemCreationClassName.description: Value of the scoping computer's CreationClassName property. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpbSystemName.name: hwpbSystemName
hwpbSystemName.description: Name of the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpbTimeOnBattery.name: hwpbTimeOnBattery
hwpbTimeOnBattery.description: Elapsed time in seconds since the computer system's UPS last switched to battery power, or the time since the system or UPS was last restarted, whichever is less. If the battery is online, 0 (zero) is returned. This property is inherited from CIM_Battery.

hwpbTimeToFullCharge.name: hwpbTimeToFullCharge
hwpbTimeToFullCharge.description: Remaining time in minutes to charge the battery fully at the current charge rate and usage. This property is inherited from CIM_Battery.

win32UninterruptPowerSupplyTable.name: win32UninterruptPowerSupplyTable
win32UninterruptPowerSupplyTable.description: The Win32_UninterruptiblePowerSupply WMI class represents the capabilities and management capacity of an uninterruptible power supply (UPS). The properties of the UPS device indicate when incoming power is trimmed or boosted, and the aggregated information of the batteries, generators, and so on, that comprise the device. These individual components (for example, multiple batteries) can also be independently modeled and associated with the UPS.

hwupsIndex.name: hwupsIndex
hwupsIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwupsActiveInputVoltage.name: hwupsActiveInputVoltage
hwupsActiveInputVoltage.description: Input voltage range currently in use. This property is inherited from CIM_PowerSupply.

hwupsAvailability.name: hwupsAvailability
hwupsAvailability.description: Availability and status of the device. Power Save - Unknown indicates that the device is known to be in a power save mode, but its exact status is unknown; Power Save - Low Power Mode indicates that the device is in a power save state but still functioning, and may exhibit degraded performance; Power Save - Standby indicates that the device is not functioning but could be brought to full power quickly; and Power Save - Warning indicates that the device is in a warning state, though also in a power save mode. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwupsBatteryInstalled.name: hwupsBatteryInstalled
hwupsBatteryInstalled.description: If TRUE, a battery is installed on the device.

hwupsCanTurnOffRemotely.name: hwupsCanTurnOffRemotely
hwupsCanTurnOffRemotely.description: If TRUE, the power supply can be turned off remotely.

hwupsCaption.name: hwupsCaption
hwupsCaption.description: Short description of an object a one-line string. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwupsCommandFile.name: hwupsCommandFile
hwupsCommandFile.description: Name of a command file to execute immediately before shutting down.

hwupsConfigManagerErrorCode.name: hwupsConfigManagerErrorCode
hwupsConfigManagerErrorCode.description: Windows Configuration Manager error code. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwupsConfigManagerUserConfig.name: hwupsConfigManagerUserConfig
hwupsConfigManagerUserConfig.description: If TRUE, the device is using a user-defined configuration. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwupsCreationClassName.name: hwupsCreationClassName
hwupsCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class to appear in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be uniquely identified. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwupsDescription.name: hwupsDescription
hwupsDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwupsDeviceID.name: hwupsDeviceID
hwupsDeviceID.description: Unique identifier of this UPS device with other devices on the system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwupsErrorCleared.name: hwupsErrorCleared
hwupsErrorCleared.description: If TRUE, the error reported in LastErrorCode is now cleared. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwupsErrorDescription.name: hwupsErrorDescription
hwupsErrorDescription.description: Free-form string that supplies more information about the error recorded in LastErrorCode, and information about corrective actions that can be taken. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwupsEstimatedChargeRemaining.name: hwupsEstimatedChargeRemaining
hwupsEstimatedChargeRemaining.description: Estimate of the percentage of full charge that remains for a UPS that uses battery technology. This property is inherited from CIM_UninterruptiblePowerSupply.

hwupsEstimatedRunTime.name: hwupsEstimatedRunTime
hwupsEstimatedRunTime.description: Estimated time, in minutes, until battery or generator depletion in the present load conditions if the utility power is off or lost and remains off. This property is inherited from CIM_UninterruptiblePowerSupply.

hwupsFirstMessageDelay.name: hwupsFirstMessageDelay
hwupsFirstMessageDelay.description: Length of time between initial power failure and the first message sent to users. If power is restored within the FirstMessageDelay value, no message is sent, but the event is logged.

hwupsInstallDate.name: hwupsInstallDate
hwupsInstallDate.description: Date and time the object is installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwupsIsSwitchingSupply.name: hwupsIsSwitchingSupply
hwupsIsSwitchingSupply.description: If TRUE, the power supply is a switching supply as opposed to linear. This property is inherited from CIM_PowerSupply.

hwupsLastErrorCode.name: hwupsLastErrorCode
hwupsLastErrorCode.description: Last error code the logical device reports. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwupsLowBatterySignal.name: hwupsLowBatterySignal
hwupsLowBatterySignal.description: If TRUE, the power supply has a low battery signal.

hwupsMessageInterval.name: hwupsMessageInterval
hwupsMessageInterval.description: Length of time between messages sent to users to inform the users of power failure.

hwupsName.name: hwupsName
hwupsName.description: Label for the object. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwupsPNPDeviceID.name: hwupsPNPDeviceID
hwupsPNPDeviceID.description: Plug and Play device identifier of the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: '*PNP030b'

hwupsPowerFailSignal.name: hwupsPowerFailSignal
hwupsPowerFailSignal.description: If TRUE, the power supply has a power failure signal.

hwupsPowerManagementCapabilities.name: hwupsPowerManagementCapabilities
hwupsPowerManagementCapabilities.description: Array of the specific power-related capabilities of a logical device. The Enabled value indicates that the power management features are currently enabled but the exact feature set is unknown or the information is unavailable. Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically indicates that a device can change its power state based on usage or other criteria. Power State Settable indicates that the SetPowerState method is supported. Power Cycling Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle). Timed Power On Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle) and Time set to a specific date and time, or interval, for power-on. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Not Supported 2 Disabled 3 Enabled 4 Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically 5 Power State Settable 6 Power Cycling Supported 7 Timed Power On Supported

hwupsPowerManagementSupported.name: hwupsPowerManagementSupported
hwupsPowerManagementSupported.description: If TRUE, the device can be power-managed (can be put into suspend mode, and so on). The property does not indicate that power management features are currently enabled, only that the logical device is capable of power management. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwupsRange1InputFrequencyHigh.name: hwupsRange1InputFrequencyHigh
hwupsRange1InputFrequencyHigh.description: Frequency, in hertz, at the high end of the power supply input frequency range 1. A value of 0 (zero) indicates DC. This property is inherited from CIM_PowerSupply.

hwupsRange1InputFrequencyLow.name: hwupsRange1InputFrequencyLow
hwupsRange1InputFrequencyLow.description: Frequency, in hertz, at the low end of the power supply input frequency range 1. A value of 0 (zero) indicates DC. This property is inherited from CIM_PowerSupply.

hwupsRange1InputVoltageHigh.name: hwupsRange1InputVoltageHigh
hwupsRange1InputVoltageHigh.description: Voltage level, in millivolts, above which the UPS must compensate by trimming the voltage. A value of 0 (zero)indicates that the voltage at trimming time is 'unknown'. This property is inherited from CIM_PowerSupply.

hwupsRange1InputVoltageLow.name: hwupsRange1InputVoltageLow
hwupsRange1InputVoltageLow.description: Voltage level, in millivolts, below which the UPS must compensate by boosting the voltage using its power source. A value of 0 (zero) indicates that the voltage at boosting time is 'unknown'. This property is inherited from CIM_PowerSupply.

hwupsRange2InputFrequencyHigh.name: hwupsRange2InputFrequencyHigh
hwupsRange2InputFrequencyHigh.description: Frequency, in hertz, at the high end of the power supply input frequency range 2. A value of 0 (zero) indicates DC. This property is inherited from CIM_PowerSupply.

hwupsRange2InputFrequencyLow.name: hwupsRange2InputFrequencyLow
hwupsRange2InputFrequencyLow.description: Frequency, in hertz, at the low end of the power supply input frequency range 2. A value of 0 (zero) indicates DC. This property is inherited from CIM_PowerSupply.

hwupsRange2InputVoltageHigh.name: hwupsRange2InputVoltageHigh
hwupsRange2InputVoltageHigh.description: Voltage level, in millivolts, above which the UPS must compensate by trimming the voltage. A value of 0 (zero)indicates that the voltage at trimming time is 'unknown'. This property is inherited from CIM_PowerSupply.

hwupsRange2InputVoltageLow.name: hwupsRange2InputVoltageLow
hwupsRange2InputVoltageLow.description: Voltage level, in millivolts, below which the UPS must compensate by using the power source to boost the voltage. A value of 0 (zero) indicates that the voltage at boosting time is 'unknown'. This property is inherited from CIM_PowerSupply.

hwupsRemainingCapacityStatus.name: hwupsRemainingCapacityStatus
hwupsRemainingCapacityStatus.description: Capacity remaining in the UPS' batteries and generator. Normal (2) indicates that the remaining estimated minutes of run-time is greater than the UPS' defined 'low power' state (typically two minutes). Low (3) indicates that the remaining estimated minutes of run-time is less than or equal to the UPS' defined 'low power' state. Depleted (4) indicates that the UPS will be unable to sustain the present load when and if the utility power is lost (including the possibility that the utility power is currently absent). This property is inherited from CIM_UninterruptiblePowerSupply.

hwupsStatus.name: hwupsStatus
hwupsStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwupsStatusInfo.name: hwupsStatusInfo
hwupsStatusInfo.description: State of the logical device. If this property does not apply to the logical device, the value 5 (Not Applicable) should be used. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwupsSystemCreationClassName.name: hwupsSystemCreationClassName
hwupsSystemCreationClassName.description: Value of the scoping computer's CreationClassName property. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwupsSystemName.name: hwupsSystemName
hwupsSystemName.description: Name of the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwupsTimeOnBackup.name: hwupsTimeOnBackup
hwupsTimeOnBackup.description: Elapsed time, in seconds, after the UPS last switched to battery power, generator, or the time after the UPS was last restarted, whichever is less. If the UPS is 'on line', 0 (zero) is returned. This property is inherited from CIM_UninterruptiblePowerSupply.

hwupsTotalOutputPower.name: hwupsTotalOutputPower
hwupsTotalOutputPower.description: Total output power of the power supply in milliwatts. The value 0 (zero) denotes 'unknown'. This property is inherited from CIM_PowerSupply.

hwupsTypeOfRangeSwitching.name: hwupsTypeOfRangeSwitching
hwupsTypeOfRangeSwitching.description: Type of input voltage range switching implemented in this power supply. This property is inherited from CIM_PowerSupply.

hwupsUPSPort.name: hwupsUPSPort
hwupsUPSPort.description: Name of the serial port to which the UPS is connected. Example: 'COM1:'

win32VoltageProbeTable.name: win32VoltageProbeTable
win32VoltageProbeTable.description: The Win32_VoltageProbe WMI class represents the properties of a voltage sensor (electronic voltmeter).

hwvpIndex.name: hwvpIndex
hwvpIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwvpAccuracy.name: hwvpAccuracy
hwvpAccuracy.description: Accuracy of the sensor for the measured property. The accuracy value is recorded as plus or minus hundredths of a percent. Accuracy, along with resolution and tolerance, is used to calculate the actual value of the measured physical property. The accuracy may vary and depends on whether or not the device is linear in its dynamic range. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwvpAvailability.name: hwvpAvailability
hwvpAvailability.description: Availability and status of the device. Power Save - Unknown indicates that the device is known to be in a power save mode, but its exact status is unknown; Power Save - Low Power Mode indicates that the device is in a power save state but still functioning, and may exhibit degraded performance; Power Save - Standby indicates that the device is not functioning but could be brought to full power quickly; and Power Save - Warning indicates that the device is in a warning state, though also in a power save mode. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwvpCaption.name: hwvpCaption
hwvpCaption.description: Short description of the object a one-line string. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwvpConfigManagerErrorCode.name: hwvpConfigManagerErrorCode
hwvpConfigManagerErrorCode.description: Windows Configuration Manager error code. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwvpConfigManagerUserConfig.name: hwvpConfigManagerUserConfig
hwvpConfigManagerUserConfig.description: If TRUE, the device is using a user-defined configuration. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwvpCreationClassName.name: hwvpCreationClassName
hwvpCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class to appear in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be uniquely identified. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwvpCurrentReading.name: hwvpCurrentReading
hwvpCurrentReading.description: Current value indicated by the sensor. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwvpDescription.name: hwvpDescription
hwvpDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwvpDeviceID.name: hwvpDeviceID
hwvpDeviceID.description: Unique identifier of the voltage probe. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwvpErrorCleared.name: hwvpErrorCleared
hwvpErrorCleared.description: If TRUE, the error reported in LastErrorCode is now cleared. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwvpErrorDescription.name: hwvpErrorDescription
hwvpErrorDescription.description: More information about the error recorded in LastErrorCode, and information about any corrective actions that may be taken. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwvpInstallDate.name: hwvpInstallDate
