hwvpInstallDate.description: Date and time the object is installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwvpIsLinear.name: hwvpIsLinear
hwvpIsLinear.description: If TRUE, the sensor is linear over its dynamic range. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwvpLastErrorCode.name: hwvpLastErrorCode
hwvpLastErrorCode.description: Last error code reported by the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwvpLowerThresholdCritical.name: hwvpLowerThresholdCritical
hwvpLowerThresholdCritical.description: Sensor threshold values specify the ranges (minimum and maximum values) to determine if the sensor is operating under normal, non-critical, critical, or fatal conditions. If CurrentReading is between LowerThresholdCritical and LowerThresholdFatal, the current state is critical. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwvpLowerThresholdFatal.name: hwvpLowerThresholdFatal
hwvpLowerThresholdFatal.description: Sensor threshold values specify the ranges (minimum and maximum values) to determine if the sensor is operating under normal, non-critical, critical, or fatal conditions. If CurrentReading is below LowerThresholdFatal, the current state is fatal. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwvpLowerThresholdNonCritical.name: hwvpLowerThresholdNonCritical
hwvpLowerThresholdNonCritical.description: Sensor threshold values specify the ranges (minimum and maximum values) to determine if the sensor is operating under normal, non-critical, critical, or fatal conditions. If CurrentReading is between LowerThresholdNonCritical and UpperThresholdNonCritical, the sensor is reporting a normal value. If CurrentReading is between LowerThresholdNonCritical and LowerThresholdCritical, the current state is non-critical. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwvpMaxReadable.name: hwvpMaxReadable
hwvpMaxReadable.description: Largest value of the measured property that the numeric sensor can read. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwvpMinReadable.name: hwvpMinReadable
hwvpMinReadable.description: Smallest value of the measured property that the numeric sensor can read. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwvpName.name: hwvpName
hwvpName.description: Label for an object. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwvpNominalReading.name: hwvpNominalReading
hwvpNominalReading.description: Normal or expected value for the numeric sensor. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwvpNormalMax.name: hwvpNormalMax
hwvpNormalMax.description: Normal or expected value for the numeric sensor. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwvpNormalMin.name: hwvpNormalMin
hwvpNormalMin.description: Guidance for the user to indicate the normal minimum range for the numeric sensor. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwvpPNPDeviceID.name: hwvpPNPDeviceID
hwvpPNPDeviceID.description: Windows Plug and Play device identifier of the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: '*PNP030b'

hwvpPowerManagementCapabilities.name: hwvpPowerManagementCapabilities
hwvpPowerManagementCapabilities.description: Array of the specific power-related capabilities of a logical device. The Enabled value indicates that the power management features are currently enabled but the exact feature set is unknown or the information is unavailable. Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically indicates that a device can change its power state based on usage or other criteria. Power State Settable indicates that the SetPowerState method is supported. Power Cycling Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle). Timed Power On Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle) and Time set to a specific date and time, or interval, for power-on. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Not Supported 2 Disabled 3 Enabled 4 Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically 5 Power State Settable 6 Power Cycling Supported 7 Timed Power On Supported

hwvpPowerManagementSupported.name: hwvpPowerManagementSupported
hwvpPowerManagementSupported.description: If TRUE, the device can be power-managed, which means that it can be put into suspend mode, and so on. The property does not indicate that power management features are currently enabled, but it does indicate that the logical device is capable of power management. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwvpResolution.name: hwvpResolution
hwvpResolution.description: Ability of the sensor to resolve differences in the measured property. This value may vary and depends on whether the device is linear in its dynamic range. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwvpStatus.name: hwvpStatus
hwvpStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwvpStatusInfo.name: hwvpStatusInfo
hwvpStatusInfo.description: State of the logical device. If this property does not apply to the logical device, the value 5 (Not Applicable) should be used. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwvpSystemCreationClassName.name: hwvpSystemCreationClassName
hwvpSystemCreationClassName.description: Value for the CreationClassName property of the scoping computer. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwvpSystemName.name: hwvpSystemName
hwvpSystemName.description: Name of the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwvpTolerance.name: hwvpTolerance
hwvpTolerance.description: Tolerance of the sensor for the measured property. Tolerance, along with resolution and accuracy, is used to calculate the actual value of the measured physical property. Tolerance may vary, and depends on whether the device is linear in its dynamic range. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwvpUpperThresholdCritical.name: hwvpUpperThresholdCritical
hwvpUpperThresholdCritical.description: Sensor threshold values specify the ranges (minimum and maximum values) to determine whether the sensor is operating under normal, non-critical, critical, or fatal conditions. If CurrentReading is between UpperThresholdCritical and UpperThresholdFatal, the current state is critical. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwvpUpperThresholdFatal.name: hwvpUpperThresholdFatal
hwvpUpperThresholdFatal.description: Sensor threshold values specify the ranges (minimum and maximum values) to determine whether the sensor is operating under normal, non-critical, critical, or fatal conditions. If CurrentReading is above UpperThresholdFatal, the current state is fatal. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

hwvpUpperThresholdNonCritical.name: hwvpUpperThresholdNonCritical
hwvpUpperThresholdNonCritical.description: Sensor threshold values specify the ranges (minimum and maximum values) to determine whether the sensor is operating under normal, non-critical, critical, or fatal conditions. If CurrentReading is between LowerThresholdNonCriticaland UpperThresholdNonCritical, the sensor is reporting a normal value. If CurrentReading is between UpperThresholdNonCritical and UpperThresholdCritical, the current state is non-critical. This property is inherited from CIM_NumericSensor.

wmiPrinting.name: wmiPrinting
wmiPrinting.description: The Printing subcategory groups classes that represent printers, printer configurations, and print jobs.

win32PrinterTable.name: win32PrinterTable
win32PrinterTable.description: The Win32_Printer WMI class represents a device connected to a Windows computer system that can reproduce a visual image on paper or other medium.

hwprIndex.name: hwprIndex
hwprIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwprAttributes.name: hwprAttributes
hwprAttributes.description: Attributes of a Windows printing device represented by a combination of flags. Value used to set the bit Meaning 0x1 Print jobs are buffered and queued. 0x2 Document to be sent directly to the printer. This value is used if print jobs are not being queued correctly. 0x4 Default printer on a computer. 0x8 Available as a shared network resource. 0x10 Attached to a network. If both Local and Network bits are set, this indicates a network printer. 0x20 Hidden from some users on the network. 0x40 Directly connected to a computer. If both Local and Network bits are set, this indicates a network printer. 0x80 Enable the queue on the printer if available. 0x100 Spooler should not delete documents after they are printed. 0x200 Start jobs that are finished spooling first. 0x400 Queue print jobs when a printer is not available. 0x800 Enable bi-directional printing. 0x1000 Allow only raw data type jobs to be spooled. 0x2000 Published in the network directory service.

hwprAvailability.name: hwprAvailability
hwprAvailability.description: Availability and status of a device. Power Save - Unknown indicates that the device is in a power save mode, but the exact status is unknown; Power Save - Low Power Mode indicates that the device is in a power save state but still functioning, and may exhibit degraded performance; Power Save - Standby indicates that the device is not functioning but can be brought to full power quickly; and Power Save - Warning indicates that the device is in a warning state, and a power save mode. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwprAvailableJobSheets.name: hwprAvailableJobSheets
hwprAvailableJobSheets.description: Array of all the job sheets available on a printer. Can also be used to describe the banner that a printer might provide at the beginning of each job, or other user-specified options. This property is inherited from CIM_Printer. This property is new for Windows XP.

hwprAveragePagesPerMinute.name: hwprAveragePagesPerMinute
hwprAveragePagesPerMinute.description: Printing rate that a printer can produce output the average number of pages per minute.

hwprCapabilities.name: hwprCapabilities
hwprCapabilities.description: Array of printer capabilities. This property is inherited from CIM_Printer. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Other 2 Color Printing 3 Duplex Printing 4 Copies 5 Collation 6 Stapling 7 Transparency Printing 8 Punch 9 Cover 10 Bind 11 Black and White Printing 12 One Sided 13 Two Sided Long Edge 14 Two Sided Short Edge 15 Portrait 16 Landscape 17 Reverse Portrait 18 Reverse Landscape 19 Quality High 20 Quality Normal 21 Quality Low

hwprCapabilityDescriptions.name: hwprCapabilityDescriptions
hwprCapabilityDescriptions.description: Array of free-form strings that provide detailed explanations for the printer features indicated in the Capabilities array. Each entry of this array is related to an entry in the Capabilities array that is located in the same index. This property is inherited from CIM_Printer.

hwprCaption.name: hwprCaption
hwprCaption.description: Short description of an object a one-line string. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwprCharSetsSupported.name: hwprCharSetsSupported
hwprCharSetsSupported.description: Array of available character sets for output. Strings provided in this property must conform to the semantics and syntax specified by section 4.1.2 ('Charset parameters') in RFC 2046 (MIME Part 2) and contained in the IANA character-set registry. Examples include utf-8, us-ascii and iso-8859-1. This property is inherited from CIM_Printer. This property is new for Windows XP.

hwprComment.name: hwprComment
hwprComment.description: Comment for a print queue. This property is new for Windows XP. Example: Color printer

hwprConfigManagerErrorCode.name: hwprConfigManagerErrorCode
hwprConfigManagerErrorCode.description: Windows Configuration Manager error code. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwprConfigManagerUserConfig.name: hwprConfigManagerUserConfig
hwprConfigManagerUserConfig.description: If TRUE, the device is using a user-defined configuration. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwprCreationClassName.name: hwprCreationClassName
hwprCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class to appear in the inheritance chain used to create an instance. When used with other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be identified uniquely. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwprCurrentCapabilities.name: hwprCurrentCapabilities
hwprCurrentCapabilities.description: Array of printer finishings and other capabilities that are being used currently. An entry in this property must also be listed in the Capabilities array. This property is inherited from CIM_Printer. This property is new for Windows XP. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Other 2 Color Printing 3 Duplex Printing 4 Copies 5 Collation 6 Stapling 7 Transparency Printing 8 Punch 9 Cover 10 Bind 11 Black and White Printing 12 One Sided 13 Two Sided Long Edge 14 Two Sided Short Edge 15 Portrait 16 Landscape 17 Reverse Portrait 18 Reverse Landscape 19 Quality High 20 Quality Normal 21 Quality Low

hwprCurrentCharSet.name: hwprCurrentCharSet
hwprCurrentCharSet.description: The character set currently being used for output. Strings provided in this property must conform to the semantics and syntax specified by section 4.1.2 ('Charset parameters') in RFC 2046 (MIME Part 2) and contained in the IANA character-set registry. Examples include utf-8, us-ascii and iso-8859-1. This property is inherited from CIM_Printer. This property is new for Windows XP.

hwprCurrentLanguage.name: hwprCurrentLanguage
hwprCurrentLanguage.description: Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: Printer language currently being used. The language being used must be listed in the LanguagesSupported property. This property is inherited from CIM_Printer. This property is new for Windows XP.

hwprCurrentMimeType.name: hwprCurrentMimeType
hwprCurrentMimeType.description: MIME type currently being used if the CurrentLanguage is a MIME type (value = 47). This property is inherited from CIM_Printer. This property is new for Windows XP.

hwprCurrentNaturalLanguage.name: hwprCurrentNaturalLanguage
hwprCurrentNaturalLanguage.description: Language that the printer is using for management currently. The language listed here must also be listed in the NaturalLanguagesSupported property. This property is inherited from CIM_Printer. This property is new for Windows XP.

hwprCurrentPaperType.name: hwprCurrentPaperType
hwprCurrentPaperType.description: Type of paper the printer is using. Must be expressed in the form specified by the ISO/IEC 10175 Document Printing Application (DPA), which is summarized in Appendix C of RFC 1759 (Printer MIB). This property is inherited from CIM_Printer. This property is new for Windows XP.

hwprDefault.name: hwprDefault
hwprDefault.description: If TRUE, the printer is the default printer on the computer. This property is new for Windows XP.

hwprDefaultCapabilities.name: hwprDefaultCapabilities
hwprDefaultCapabilities.description: Array of the finishings and other printer capabilities that are used by default. Each entry in the DefaultCapabilities array must also be listed in the Capabilities array. This property is inherited from CIM_Printer. This property is new for Windows XP. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Other 2 Color Printing 3 Duplex Printing 4 Copies 5 Collation 6 Stapling 7 Transparency Printing 8 Punch 9 Cover 10 Bind 11 Black and White Printing 12 One Sided 13 Two Sided Long Edge 14 Two Sided Short Edge 15 Portrait 16 Landscape 17 Reverse Portrait 18 Reverse Landscape 19 Quality High 20 Quality Normal 21 Quality Low

hwprDefaultCopies.name: hwprDefaultCopies
hwprDefaultCopies.description: Number of copies that are produced for one job unless otherwise specified. This property is inherited from CIM_Printer. This property is new for Windows XP.

hwprDefaultLanguage.name: hwprDefaultLanguage
hwprDefaultLanguage.description: Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: Default printer language. The language listed here must also be listed in the LanguagesSupported property. This property is inherited from CIM_Printer.

hwprDefaultMimeType.name: hwprDefaultMimeType
hwprDefaultMimeType.description: Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: MIME type currently being used, if the DefaultLanguage value is a MIME type (value = 47). This property is inherited from CIM_Printer.

hwprDefaultNumberUp.name: hwprDefaultNumberUp
hwprDefaultNumberUp.description: Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: Number of print-stream pages that the printer renders on one media sheet unless a job specifies otherwise. This property is inherited from CIM_Printer.

hwprDefaultPaperType.name: hwprDefaultPaperType
hwprDefaultPaperType.description: Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: Paper type that the printer uses unless a print job specifies a different paper type. The string must be expressed in the form specified by ISO/IEC 1017 Document Printing Application (DPA), which is summarized in Appendix C of RFC 1759 (Printer MIB). This property is inherited from CIM_Printer.

hwprDefaultPriority.name: hwprDefaultPriority
hwprDefaultPriority.description: Default priority value assigned to each print job.

hwprDescription.name: hwprDescription
hwprDescription.description: Description of an object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwprDetectedErrorState.name: hwprDetectedErrorState
hwprDetectedErrorState.description: Printer error information. This property is inherited from CIM_Printer.

hwprDeviceID.name: hwprDeviceID
hwprDeviceID.description: Unique identifier of the printer on a system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwprDirect.name: hwprDirect
hwprDirect.description: Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: If TRUE, the print job is sent directly to the printer. If FALSE, the print job is spooled.

hwprDoCompleteFirst.name: hwprDoCompleteFirst
hwprDoCompleteFirst.description: Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: If TRUE, the printer starts jobs that are finished spooling. If FALSE, the printer starts jobs in the order that the jobs are received.

hwprDriverName.name: hwprDriverName
hwprDriverName.description: Name of the Windows printer driver. Example: Windows NT Fax Driver

hwprEnableBIDI.name: hwprEnableBIDI
hwprEnableBIDI.description: Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: If TRUE, the printer can print bi-directionally.

hwprEnableDevQueryPrint.name: hwprEnableDevQueryPrint
hwprEnableDevQueryPrint.description: Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: If TRUE, the printer holds documents in the queue if document and printer setups do not match.

hwprErrorCleared.name: hwprErrorCleared
hwprErrorCleared.description: If TRUE, the error reported in LastErrorCode has been cleared. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwprErrorDescription.name: hwprErrorDescription
hwprErrorDescription.description: Information about the error recorded in LastErrorCode, and information about corrective actions that can be taken. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwprErrorInformation.name: hwprErrorInformation
hwprErrorInformation.description: Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: Array of supplemental information for the current error state indicated in DetectedErrorState. This property is inherited from CIM_Printer.

hwprExtendedDetectedErrorState.name: hwprExtendedDetectedErrorState
hwprExtendedDetectedErrorState.description: Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: Reports standard error information. Additional information should be recorded in DetectedErrorState.

hwprExtendedPrinterStatus.name: hwprExtendedPrinterStatus
hwprExtendedPrinterStatus.description: Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: Status information for a printer that is different from information specified in the Availability property.

hwprHidden.name: hwprHidden
hwprHidden.description: Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: If TRUE, the printer is hidden from network users.

hwprHorizontalResolution.name: hwprHorizontalResolution
hwprHorizontalResolution.description: Horizontal resolution of the printer in pixels per inch. This property is inherited from CIM_Printer.

hwprInstallDate.name: hwprInstallDate
hwprInstallDate.description: Date and time an object was installed. The object may be installed without a value being written to this property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwprJobCountSinceLastReset.name: hwprJobCountSinceLastReset
hwprJobCountSinceLastReset.description: Number of print jobs since the printer was last reset. This property is inherited from CIM_Printer.

hwprKeepPrintedJobs.name: hwprKeepPrintedJobs
hwprKeepPrintedJobs.description: Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: If TRUE, the print spooler does not delete the completed jobs.

hwprLanguagesSupported.name: hwprLanguagesSupported
hwprLanguagesSupported.description: Array of the print languages natively supported. This property is inherited from CIM_Printer. Value Meaning 1 Other 2 Unknown 3 PCL 4 HPGL 5 PJL 6 PS 7 PSPrinter 8 IPDS 9 PPDS 10 EscapeP 11 Epson 12 DDIF 13 Interpress 14 ISO6429 15 LineData 16 DODCA 17 REGIS 18 SCS 19 SPDL 20 TEK4014 21 PDS 22 IGP 23 CodeV 24 DSCDSE 25 WPS 26 LN03 27 CCITT 28 QUIC 29 CPAP 30 DecPPL 31 SimpleText 32 NPAP 33 DOC 34 imPress 35 Pinwriter 36 NPDL 37 NEC201PL 38 Automatic 39 Pages 40 LIPS 41 TIFF 42 Diagnostic 43 CaPSL 44 EXCL 45 LCDS 46 XES 47 MIME

hwprLastErrorCode.name: hwprLastErrorCode
hwprLastErrorCode.description: Last error code that the logical device reports. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwprLocal.name: hwprLocal
hwprLocal.description: Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: If TRUE, the printer is not attached to a network. If both the Local and Network properties are set to TRUE, then the printer is a network printer.

hwprLocation.name: hwprLocation
hwprLocation.description: Physical location of the printer. Example: Bldg. 38, Room 1164

hwprMarkingTechnology.name: hwprMarkingTechnology
hwprMarkingTechnology.description: Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: Marking technology that the printer uses. This property is inherited from CIM_Printer.

hwprMaxCopies.name: hwprMaxCopies
hwprMaxCopies.description: Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: Maximum number of copies the printer can produce for one job. This property is inherited from CIM_Printer.

hwprMaxNumberUp.name: hwprMaxNumberUp
hwprMaxNumberUp.description: Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: Maximum number of print-stream pages the printer can render on one media sheet such as paper. This property is inherited from CIM_Printer.

hwprMaxSizeSupported.name: hwprMaxSizeSupported
hwprMaxSizeSupported.description: Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: Largest job as a byte steam that the printer can accept in kilobytes. A value of 0 (zero) indicates that no limit is set. This property is inherited from CIM_Printer.

hwprMimeTypesSupported.name: hwprMimeTypesSupported
hwprMimeTypesSupported.description: Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: Array of detailed MIME type explanations that the printer supports. If data is provided, then the value 47 ('MIME') must be included in the LanguagesSupported property. This property is inherited from CIM_Printer.

hwprName.name: hwprName
hwprName.description: Label for an object. When inherited by a subclass, the property can be overridden to be a key property.

hwprNaturalLanguagesSupported.name: hwprNaturalLanguagesSupported
hwprNaturalLanguagesSupported.description: Windows XP and Windows Server 2003: Array of languages supported for strings that the printer uses for output of management information. Must conform to RFC 1766. For example, 'en' is used for English. This property is inherited from CIM_Printer.

hwprNetwork.name: hwprNetwork
hwprNetwork.description: Windows XP and Windows Server 2003: If TRUE, the printer is a network printer. If both the Local and Network properties are set to TRUE, then the printer is a network printer.

hwprPaperSizesSupported.name: hwprPaperSizesSupported
hwprPaperSizesSupported.description: Array of the paper types that the printer supports. This property is inherited from CIM_Printer. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Other 2 A 3 B 4 C 5 D 6 E 7 Letter 8 Legal 9 NA-10x13-Envelope 10 NA-9x12-Envelope 11 NA-Number-10-Envelope 12 NA-7x9-Envelope 13 NA-9x11-Envelope 14 NA-10x14-Envelope 15 NA-Number-9-Envelope 16 NA-6x9-Envelope 17 NA-10x15-Envelope 18 A0 19 A1 20 A2 21 A3 22 A4 23 A5 24 A6 25 A7 26 A8 27 A9A10 28 B0 29 B1 30 B2 31 B3 32 B4 33 B5 34 B6 35 B7 36 B8 37 B9 38 B10 39 C0 40 C1 41 C2 42 C3 43 C4 44 C5 45 C6 46 C7 47 C8 48 ISO-Designated 49 JIS B0 50 JIS B1 51 JIS B2 52 JIS B3 53 JIS B4 54 JIS B5 55 JIS B6 56 JIS B7 57 JIS B8 58 JIS B9 59 JIS B10

hwprPaperTypesAvailable.name: hwprPaperTypesAvailable
hwprPaperTypesAvailable.description: Windows XP and Windows Server 2003: Array of paper types that are currently available currently on the printer. Each string must be expressed in the format specified by ISO/IEC 10175 Document Printing Application (DPA), which is summarized in Appendix C of RFC 1759 (Printer MIB). Any paper size identified in this property must also appear in the PaperSizesSupported property. This property is inherited from CIM_Printer. Example: iso-a4-colored

hwprParameters.name: hwprParameters
hwprParameters.description: Windows XP and Windows Server 2003: Optional parameters for the print processor. Example: Copies=2

hwprPNPDeviceID.name: hwprPNPDeviceID
hwprPNPDeviceID.description: Windows plug and play device identifier of the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: *PNP030b

hwprPortName.name: hwprPortName
hwprPortName.description: Port that is used to transmit data to a printer. If a printer is connected to more than one port, the names of each port are separated by commas. Under Windows 95, only one port can be specified. Example: LPT1:, LPT2:, LPT3:

hwprPowerManagementCapabilities.name: hwprPowerManagementCapabilities
hwprPowerManagementCapabilities.description: Specific power capabilities of a logical device. The Enabled value indicates that the power management features are currently enabled, but the exact setting is unknown or the information is unavailable. Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically indicates that a device can change its power state based on usage or other criteria. Power State Settable indicates that the SetPowerState method is supported. Power Cycling Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5. Timed Power On Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 and Time set to a specific date and time, or interval to power ON. This property is inherited from CIM_UnitaryComputerSystem. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Not Supported 2 Disabled 3 Enabled 4 Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically 5 Power State Settable 6 Power Cycling Supported 7 Timed Power On Supported

hwprPowerManagementSupported.name: hwprPowerManagementSupported
hwprPowerManagementSupported.description: If TRUE, the power of the device can be managed, which means that it can be put into suspend mode, and so on. The property does not indicate that power management features are enabled, only that the logical device is capable of power management. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwprPrinterPaperNames.name: hwprPrinterPaperNames
hwprPrinterPaperNames.description: Array of paper sizes supported by the printer. The printer-specified names are used to represent supported paper sizes. Example: B5 (JIS)

hwprPrinterState.name: hwprPrinterState
hwprPrinterState.description: One of the possible states relating to this printer. This property is obsolete. In place of this property, use PrinterStatus.

hwprPrinterStatus.name: hwprPrinterStatus
hwprPrinterStatus.description: Status information for a printer that is different from information specified in the logical device Availability property. This property is inherited from CIM_Printer.

hwprPrintJobDataType.name: hwprPrintJobDataType
hwprPrintJobDataType.description: Data type of a print job waiting for the Windows printing device.

hwprPrintProcessor.name: hwprPrintProcessor
hwprPrintProcessor.description: Name of the print spooler that handles print jobs. Example: SPOOLSS.DLL

hwprPriority.name: hwprPriority
hwprPriority.description: Windows XP and Windows Server 2003: Priority of the printer. Jobs on a higher priority printer are scheduled first.

hwprPublished.name: hwprPublished
hwprPublished.description: Windows XP and Windows Server 2003: If TRUE, the printer is published in the network directory service.

hwprQueued.name: hwprQueued
hwprQueued.description: Windows XP and Windows Server 2003: If TRUE, the printer buffers and queues print jobs.

hwprRawOnly.name: hwprRawOnly
hwprRawOnly.description: Windows XP and Windows Server 2003: If TRUE, the printer accepts only raw data to be spooled.

hwprSeparatorFile.name: hwprSeparatorFile
hwprSeparatorFile.description: Name of the file used to create a separator page. This page is used to separate print jobs sent to the printer.

hwprServerName.name: hwprServerName
hwprServerName.description: Name of the server that controls the printer. If this string is NULL, the printer is controlled locally.

hwprShared.name: hwprShared
hwprShared.description: Windows XP and Windows Server 2003: If TRUE, the printer is available as a shared network resource.

hwprShareName.name: hwprShareName
hwprShareName.description: Share name of the Windows printing device. Example: \\PRINTSERVER1\PRINTER2

hwprSpoolEnabled.name: hwprSpoolEnabled
hwprSpoolEnabled.description: This property is obsolete; do not use. If TRUE, spooling is enabled for printer.

hwprStartTime.name: hwprStartTime
hwprStartTime.description: Date and time that a printer can start to print a job if the printer is limited to print at specific times. This value is expressed as the time elapsed since 12:00 AM GMT (Greenwich mean time).

hwprStatus.name: hwprStatus
hwprStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror- resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is on-line, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwprStatusInfo.name: hwprStatusInfo
hwprStatusInfo.description: State of the logical device. If this property does not apply to the logical device, the value 5 (Not Applicable) should be used. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwprSystemCreationClassName.name: hwprSystemCreationClassName
hwprSystemCreationClassName.description: Value of the scoping computer's CreationClassName property. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwprSystemName.name: hwprSystemName
hwprSystemName.description: Name of the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwprTimeOfLastReset.name: hwprTimeOfLastReset
hwprTimeOfLastReset.description: Date and time the printer was last reset. This property is inherited from CIM_Printer.

hwprUntilTime.name: hwprUntilTime
hwprUntilTime.description: Date and time that a printer can print the last job if the printer is limited to print at specific times. This value is expressed as the time elapsed since 12:00 AM GMT (Greenwich mean time).

hwprVerticalResolution.name: hwprVerticalResolution
hwprVerticalResolution.description: Vertical resolution of the printer in pixels per inch. This property is inherited from CIM_Printer.

hwprWorkOffline.name: hwprWorkOffline
hwprWorkOffline.description: Windows XP and Windows Server 2003: If TRUE, you can queue print jobs on the computer when the printer is offline.

win32PrinterConfigurationTable.name: win32PrinterConfigurationTable
win32PrinterConfigurationTable.description: The Win32_PrinterConfiguration WMI class defines the configuration for a printer device. This includes capabilities such as resolution, color, fonts, and orientation.

hwprcIndex.name: hwprcIndex
hwprcIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwprcBitsPerPel.name: hwprcBitsPerPel
hwprcBitsPerPel.description: This property must not be used.

hwprcCaption.name: hwprcCaption
hwprcCaption.description: Short description (one-line string) of the CIM_Setting object. This property is inherited from CIM_Setting.

hwprcCollate.name: hwprcCollate
hwprcCollate.description: If TRUE, the pages that are printed should be collated. To collate is to print out the entire document before printing the next copy, as opposed to printing out each page of the document the required number of times. This property is ignored unless the printer driver indicates support for collation.

hwprcColor.name: hwprcColor
hwprcColor.description: Color of the document. Some color printers have the capability to print using true black instead of a combination of cyan, magenta, and yellow (CMY). This usually creates darker and sharper text for documents. This option is only useful for color printers that support true black printing.

hwprcCopies.name: hwprcCopies
hwprcCopies.description: Number of copies to be printed. The printer driver must support printing multi-page copies. Example: 2

hwprcDescription.name: hwprcDescription
hwprcDescription.description: Description of the CIM_Setting object. This property is inherited from CIM_Setting.

hwprcDeviceName.name: hwprcDeviceName
hwprcDeviceName.description: Friendly name of the printer. This name is unique to the type of printer and may be truncated because of the limitations of the string from which it is derived. Example: 'PCL/HP LaserJet'

hwprcDisplayFlags.name: hwprcDisplayFlags
hwprcDisplayFlags.description: This property must not be used.

hwprcDisplayFrequency.name: hwprcDisplayFrequency
hwprcDisplayFrequency.description: This property must not be used.

hwprcDitherType.name: hwprcDitherType
hwprcDitherType.description: Dither type of the printer. This property can assume predefined values of 1 to 5, or driver-defined values from 6 to 256. Line art dithering is a special dithering method that produces well defined borders between black, white, and gray scalings. It is not suitable for images that include continuous graduations in intensity and hue such as scanned photographs.

hwprcDriverVersion.name: hwprcDriverVersion
hwprcDriverVersion.description: Version number of the Windows printer driver. The version numbers are created and maintained by the driver manufacturer.

hwprcDuplex.name: hwprcDuplex
hwprcDuplex.description: If TRUE, printing is done on both sides. If FALSE, printing is done on only one side of the media.

hwprcFormName.name: hwprcFormName
hwprcFormName.description: Name of the form used for the print job. This property is used only on Windows NT/Windows 2000 systems. Example: 'Legal'

hwprcHorizontalResolution.name: hwprcHorizontalResolution
hwprcHorizontalResolution.description: Print resolution in dots per inch along the X axis (width) of the print job (similar to the obsolete XResolution property). This value is only set when the PrintQuality property of this class is positive.

hwprcICMIntent.name: hwprcICMIntent
hwprcICMIntent.description: Specific value of one of the three possible color matching methods (called intents) that should be used by default. ICM applications establish intents by using the ICM functions. This property can assume predefined values of 1 to 3, or driver-defined values from 4 to 256. Non-ICM applications can use this value to determine how the printer handles color printing jobs.

hwprcICMMethod.name: hwprcICMMethod
hwprcICMMethod.description: How ICM is handled. For a non-ICM application, this property determines if ICM is enabled or disabled. For ICM applications, the system examines this property to determine which part of the computer system handles ICM support.

hwprcLogPixels.name: hwprcLogPixels
hwprcLogPixels.description: This property must not be used.

hwprcMediaType.name: hwprcMediaType
hwprcMediaType.description: Type of media being printed on. The property can be set to a predefined value or a driver-defined value greater than or equal to 256. This property is supported in Windows 95 and later.

hwprcName.name: hwprcName
hwprcName.description: Name of the printer with which this configuration is associated.

hwprcPaperSize.name: hwprcPaperSize
hwprcPaperSize.description: Size of the paper. Example: 'A4 or Letter'

hwprcPelsHeight.name: hwprcPelsHeight
hwprcPelsHeight.description: This property must not be used.

hwprcPelsWidth.name: hwprcPelsWidth
hwprcPelsWidth.description: This property must not be used.

hwprcPrintQuality.name: hwprcPrintQuality
hwprcPrintQuality.description: One of four quality levels of the print job. If a positive value is specified, the quality is measured in dots per inch.

hwprcScale.name: hwprcScale
hwprcScale.description: Factor by which the printed output is to be scaled. For example, a scale of 75 reduces the print output to 3/4 its original height and width.

hwprcSettingID.name: hwprcSettingID
hwprcSettingID.description: Identifier by which the CIM_Setting object is known. This property is inherited from CIM_Setting.

hwprcSpecificationVersion.name: hwprcSpecificationVersion
hwprcSpecificationVersion.description: Version number of the initialization data for the device associated with the Windows printer.

hwprcTTOption.name: hwprcTTOption
hwprcTTOption.description: How TrueType fonts should be printed.

hwprcVerticalResolution.name: hwprcVerticalResolution
hwprcVerticalResolution.description: Print resolution along the Y axis (height) of the print job (similar to the obsolete YResolution property). This value is only set when the PrintQuality property of this class is positive.

hwprcXResolution.name: hwprcXResolution
hwprcXResolution.description: This property must not be used.

hwprcYResolution.name: hwprcYResolution
hwprcYResolution.description: This property must not be used.

win32PrinterDriverTable.name: win32PrinterDriverTable
win32PrinterDriverTable.description: The Win32_PrinterDriver WMI class represents the drivers for a Win32_Printer instance. This class is new for Windows XP.

hwprdIndex.name: hwprdIndex
hwprdIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwprdCaption.name: hwprdCaption
hwprdCaption.description: Short description of the object a one-line string. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwprdConfigFile.name: hwprdConfigFile
hwprdConfigFile.description: Configuration file for this printer driver. Example: 'pscrptui.dll'

hwprdCreationClassName.name: hwprdCreationClassName
hwprdCreationClassName.description: Name of the class or the subclass used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of this class, this property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be uniquely identified. This property is inherited from CIM_Service.

hwprdDataFile.name: hwprdDataFile
hwprdDataFile.description: Data file for this printer driver. Example: 'qms810.ppd'

hwprdDefaultDataType.name: hwprdDefaultDataType
hwprdDefaultDataType.description: Default data type for this printer driver. Example: 'EMF'

hwprdDependentFiles.name: hwprdDependentFiles
hwprdDependentFiles.description: Array of dependent files for this printer driver.

hwprdDescription.name: hwprdDescription
hwprdDescription.description: Comment that describes the link. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwprdDriverPath.name: hwprdDriverPath
hwprdDriverPath.description: Path for this printer driver. Example: 'C:\\drivers\\pscript.dll'

hwprdFilePath.name: hwprdFilePath
hwprdFilePath.description: Path to the INF file being used. Example: 'c:\\temp\\driver'

hwprdHelpFile.name: hwprdHelpFile
hwprdHelpFile.description: Help file for this printer driver. Example: 'pscrptui.hlp'

hwprdInfName.name: hwprdInfName
hwprdInfName.description: Name of the INF file being used. The default is 'ntprint.INF'. This will only be different if the drivers are provided directly by the manufacturer of the printer and not the operating system.

hwprdInstallDate.name: hwprdInstallDate
hwprdInstallDate.description: Date and time when the object is installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwprdMonitorName.name: hwprdMonitorName
hwprdMonitorName.description: Name of the monitor for this printer driver. Example: 'PJL monitor'

hwprdName.name: hwprdName
hwprdName.description: Driver name for this printer. This is a compound key composed of the Name, Version, and SupportedPlatform values. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement and overrides the Name definition in that class.

hwprdOEMUrl.name: hwprdOEMUrl
hwprdOEMUrl.description: World Wide Web (WWW) link to the printer manufacturer's Web site. Note that this property is not populated when the Win32.inf file is used, and is only applicable for drivers provided directly from the manufacturer.

hwprdStarted.name: hwprdStarted
hwprdStarted.description: If TRUE, the service is started. If FALSE, the service is stopped. This property is inherited from CIM_Service.

hwprdStartMode.name: hwprdStartMode
hwprdStartMode.description: Start mode of the service is automatically started by an operating system, or only started when requested. This property is inherited from CIM_Service.

hwprdStatus.name: hwprdStatus
hwprdStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwprdSupportedPlatform.name: hwprdSupportedPlatform
hwprdSupportedPlatform.description: Operating environments that the driver is intended for. Example: 'Windows NT x86' or 'Windows IA64'

hwprdSystemCreationClassName.name: hwprdSystemCreationClassName
hwprdSystemCreationClassName.description: Scoping system's creation class name. This property is inherited from CIM_Service.

hwprdSystemName.name: hwprdSystemName
hwprdSystemName.description: Name of the system that hosts this service. This property is inherited from CIM_Service.

hwprdVersion.name: hwprdVersion
hwprdVersion.description: Operating system version for the printer driver.

win32PrintJobTable.name: win32PrintJobTable
win32PrintJobTable.description: The Win32_PrintJob WMI class represents a print job that a Windows application generates. Any unit of work generated by the print command of an application that is running on a Windows system is a descendent or member of this class.

hwprjIndex.name: hwprjIndex
hwprjIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwprjCaption.name: hwprjCaption
hwprjCaption.description: Short description of the object a one-line string. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwprjDataType.name: hwprjDataType
hwprjDataType.description: Format of the data for this print job. This instructs the printer driver to translate the data (generic text, PostScript, or PCL) before printing, or print in a raw format (for graphics and pictures). Example: 'TEXT'

hwprjDescription.name: hwprjDescription
hwprjDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwprjDocument.name: hwprjDocument
hwprjDocument.description: Name of the print job. The user sees this name when viewing documents that are waiting to be printed. Example: 'Microsoft Word - Review.doc'

hwprjDriverName.name: hwprjDriverName
hwprjDriverName.description: Name of the printer driver used for the print job.

hwprjElapsedTime.name: hwprjElapsedTime
hwprjElapsedTime.description: Length of time that the job has been executing. This property is inherited from CIM_Job.

hwprjHostPrintQueue.name: hwprjHostPrintQueue
hwprjHostPrintQueue.description: Name of the computer on which the print job is created.

hwprjInstallDate.name: hwprjInstallDate
hwprjInstallDate.description: Date and time the object is installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwprjJobId.name: hwprjJobId
hwprjJobId.description: Identifier number of the job. It is used by other methods as a handle to a job spooling to the printer.

hwprjJobStatus.name: hwprjJobStatus
hwprjJobStatus.description: Free-form string that represents the job status. This property is inherited from CIM_Job.

hwprjName.name: hwprjName
hwprjName.description: Name of the printer to which the print job is being spooled. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwprjNotify.name: hwprjNotify
hwprjNotify.description: User is to be notified when job completes or fails. This property is restricted to 16 characters in Windows 95/98 platforms. This property is inherited from CIM_Job.

hwprjOwner.name: hwprjOwner
hwprjOwner.description: User that submitted the job. This property is inherited from CIM_Job.

hwprjPagesPrinted.name: hwprjPagesPrinted
hwprjPagesPrinted.description: Number of pages that are printed. This value may be 0 (zero) if the print job does not contain page delimiting information.

hwprjParameters.name: hwprjParameters
hwprjParameters.description: Optional parameters to send to the print processor. For more information, see the PrintProcessor property.

hwprjPrintProcessor.name: hwprjPrintProcessor
hwprjPrintProcessor.description: Print processor service used to process the print job. A printer processor works in conjunction with the printer driver to provide additional translation of printer data for the printer, and can also be used to provide special options such as a title page for the job.

hwprjPriority.name: hwprjPriority
hwprjPriority.description: Urgency or importance of job execution. This property is inherited from CIM_Job.

hwprjStartTime.name: hwprjStartTime
hwprjStartTime.description: Date and time that the job begins. This property is inherited from CIM_Job.

hwprjStatus.name: hwprjStatus
hwprjStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwprjStatusMask.name: hwprjStatusMask
hwprjStatusMask.description: Bitmap of the possible statuses that relate to this print job.

hwprjTimeSubmitted.name: hwprjTimeSubmitted
hwprjTimeSubmitted.description: Time that the job is submitted. This property is inherited from CIM_Job.

hwprjTotalPages.name: hwprjTotalPages
hwprjTotalPages.description: Number of pages required to complete the job. This value may be 0 (zero) if the print job does not contain page-delimiting information.

hwprjUntilTime.name: hwprjUntilTime
hwprjUntilTime.description: Time when the job is invalid or should be stopped. This property is inherited from CIM_Job.

win32TCPIPPrinterPortTable.name: win32TCPIPPrinterPortTable
win32TCPIPPrinterPortTable.description: The Win32_TCPIPPrinterPort WMI class represents a TCP/IP service access point. This class has been added for Windows XP.

hwtppIndex.name: hwtppIndex
hwtppIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwtppByteCount.name: hwtppByteCount
hwtppByteCount.description: If TRUE, the computer counts the bytes in a document before sending them to the printer and the printer reports back the number of bytes actually read. This capability is used for diagnostics when missing bytes are detected in the print output.

hwtppCaption.name: hwtppCaption
hwtppCaption.description: Short description (one-line string) of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwtppCreationClassName.name: hwtppCreationClassName
hwtppCreationClassName.description: Name of the class or the subclass used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of this class, this property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be uniquely identified. This property is inherited from CIM_ServiceAccessPoint.

hwtppDescription.name: hwtppDescription
hwtppDescription.description: Detailed description of the functionality managed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwtppHostAddress.name: hwtppHostAddress
hwtppHostAddress.description: Address of the device or print server.

hwtppInstallDate.name: hwtppInstallDate
hwtppInstallDate.description: Date and time when the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwtppName.name: hwtppName
hwtppName.description: Identifier for the service access point that provides an indication of the functionality that is managed. This functionality is described in more detail in the object's Description property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwtppPortNumber.name: hwtppPortNumber
hwtppPortNumber.description: Number of the TCP port used by the port monitor to communicate with the device.

hwtppProtocol.name: hwtppProtocol
hwtppProtocol.description: Printing protocol used. Some printers support only LPR.

hwtppQueue.name: hwtppQueue
hwtppQueue.description: Name of the print queue on the server when used with the LPR protocol.

hwtppSNMPCommunity.name: hwtppSNMPCommunity
hwtppSNMPCommunity.description: Security level value for the device. Example: 'public''

hwtppSNMPDevIndex.name: hwtppSNMPDevIndex
hwtppSNMPDevIndex.description: SNMP index number of this device for the SNMP agent.

hwtppSNMPEnabled.name: hwtppSNMPEnabled
hwtppSNMPEnabled.description: If TRUE, this printer supports RFC1759 (Simple Network Management Protocol) and can provide rich status information from the device.

hwtppStatus.name: hwtppStatus
hwtppStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwtppSystemCreationClassName.name: hwtppSystemCreationClassName
hwtppSystemCreationClassName.description: Creation class name of the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_ServiceAccessPoint.

hwtppSystemName.name: hwtppSystemName
hwtppSystemName.description: Name of the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_ServiceAccessPoint.

hwtppType.name: hwtppType
hwtppType.description: Bitmap showing the type of service access point (SAP). This property is inherited from CIM_ServiceAccessPoint.

wmiTelephony.name: wmiTelephony
wmiTelephony.description: The Telephony subcategory groups classes that represent 'plain old telephone' modem devices and their associated serial connections.

win32POTSModemTable.name: win32POTSModemTable
win32POTSModemTable.description: The Win32_POTSModem WMI class represents the services and characteristics of a Plain Old Telephone Service (POTS) modem on a Windows system.

hwpmIndex.name: hwpmIndex
hwpmIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwpmAnswerMode.name: hwpmAnswerMode
hwpmAnswerMode.description: Current auto-answer/call-back setting for the modem. This property is inherited from CIM_PotsModem.

hwpmAttachedTo.name: hwpmAttachedTo
hwpmAttachedTo.description: Port to which the POTS modem is attached. Example: 'COM1'

hwpmAvailability.name: hwpmAvailability
hwpmAvailability.description: Availability and status of the device. Power Save - Unknown indicates that the device is known to be in a power save mode, but its exact status is unknown; Power Save - Low Power Mode indicates that the device is in a power save state but still functioning, and may exhibit degraded performance; Power Save - Standby indicates that the device is not functioning but could be brought to full power quickly; and Power Save - Warning indicates that the device is in a warning state, though also in a power save mode. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpmBlindOff.name: hwpmBlindOff
hwpmBlindOff.description: Command string used to detect a dial tone before dialing. Example: 'X4'

hwpmBlindOn.name: hwpmBlindOn
hwpmBlindOn.description: Command string used to dial whether or not there is a dial tone. Example: 'X3'

hwpmCaption.name: hwpmCaption
hwpmCaption.description: Short description (one-line string) of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpmCompatibilityFlags.name: hwpmCompatibilityFlags
hwpmCompatibilityFlags.description: All modem connection protocols with which this modem device is compatible.

hwpmCompressionInfo.name: hwpmCompressionInfo
hwpmCompressionInfo.description: Data compression characteristics of the modem. This property is inherited from CIM_PotsModem.

hwpmCompressionOff.name: hwpmCompressionOff
hwpmCompressionOff.description: Command string used to disable hardware data compression. Example: 'S46=136'

hwpmCompressionOn.name: hwpmCompressionOn
hwpmCompressionOn.description: Command string used to enable hardware data compression. Example: 'S46=138'

hwpmConfigManagerErrorCode.name: hwpmConfigManagerErrorCode
hwpmConfigManagerErrorCode.description: Windows Configuration Manager error code. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpmConfigManagerUserConfig.name: hwpmConfigManagerUserConfig
hwpmConfigManagerUserConfig.description: If TRUE, the device is using a user-defined configuration. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpmConfigurationDialog.name: hwpmConfigurationDialog
hwpmConfigurationDialog.description: Modem initialization string. This property is comprised of command strings from other properties of this class.

hwpmCountriesSupported.name: hwpmCountriesSupported
hwpmCountriesSupported.description: Array of countries/regions in which the modem can operate. This property is inherited from CIM_PotsModem.

hwpmCountrySelected.name: hwpmCountrySelected
hwpmCountrySelected.description: Country/region for which the modem is currently programmed. When multiple countries/regions are supported, this property defines which one is currently selected for use. This property is inherited from CIM_PotsModem.

hwpmCreationClassName.name: hwpmCreationClassName
hwpmCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class to appear in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be uniquely identified. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpmCurrentPasswords.name: hwpmCurrentPasswords
hwpmCurrentPasswords.description: List of currently defined passwords for the modem. This array may be left blank for security reasons. This property is inherited from CIM_PotsModem.

hwpmDCB.name: hwpmDCB
hwpmDCB.description: Control settings for a serial communications device, in this case, the modem device.

hwpmDefault.name: hwpmDefault
hwpmDefault.description: If TRUE, this POTS modem is the default modem on the Windows computer system.

hwpmDescription.name: hwpmDescription
hwpmDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpmDeviceID.name: hwpmDeviceID
hwpmDeviceID.description: Unique identifier of this POTS modem from other devices on the system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpmDeviceLoader.name: hwpmDeviceLoader
hwpmDeviceLoader.description: Name of the device loader for the modem. A device loader loads and manages device drivers and enumerators for a given device.

hwpmDialType.name: hwpmDialType
hwpmDialType.description: Type of dialing method used. This property is inherited from CIM_PotsModem.

hwpmErrorCleared.name: hwpmErrorCleared
hwpmErrorCleared.description: If TRUE, the error reported in LastErrorCode is now cleared. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpmErrorControlForced.name: hwpmErrorControlForced
hwpmErrorControlForced.description: Command string used to enable error correction control when establishing a connection. This increases the reliability of the connection. Example: '+Q5S36=4S48=7'

hwpmErrorControlInfo.name: hwpmErrorControlInfo
hwpmErrorControlInfo.description: Error correction characteristics of the modem. This property is inherited from CIM_PotsModem.

hwpmErrorControlOff.name: hwpmErrorControlOff
hwpmErrorControlOff.description: Command string used to disable error control. Example: '+Q6S36=3S48=128'

hwpmErrorControlOn.name: hwpmErrorControlOn
hwpmErrorControlOn.description: Command string used to enable error control. Example: '+Q5S36=7S48=7'

hwpmErrorDescription.name: hwpmErrorDescription
hwpmErrorDescription.description: More information about the error recorded in LastErrorCode, and information on any corrective actions that may be taken. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpmFlowControlHard.name: hwpmFlowControlHard
hwpmFlowControlHard.description: Command string used to enable hardware flow control. Flow control consists of signals sent between computers that verify that both computers are ready to transmit or receive data. Example: '&K1'

hwpmFlowControlOff.name: hwpmFlowControlOff
hwpmFlowControlOff.description: Command string used to disable flow control. Flow control consists of signals sent between computers that verify that both computers are ready to transmit or receive data. Example: '&K0'

hwpmFlowControlSoft.name: hwpmFlowControlSoft
hwpmFlowControlSoft.description: Command string used to enable software flow control. Flow control consists of signals sent between computers that verify that both computers are ready to transmit or receive data. Example: '&K2'

hwpmInactivityScale.name: hwpmInactivityScale
hwpmInactivityScale.description: Multiplier used with the InactivityTimeout property to calculate the timeout period of a connection.

hwpmInactivityTimeout.name: hwpmInactivityTimeout
hwpmInactivityTimeout.description: Time limit (in seconds) for automatic disconnection of the phone line, if no data is exchanged. A value of 0 indicates that this feature is present but not enabled. This property is inherited from CIM_PotsModem.

hwpmModemIndex.name: hwpmModemIndex
hwpmModemIndex.description: Index number for this POTS modem. Example: 0

hwpmInstallDate.name: hwpmInstallDate
hwpmInstallDate.description: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpmLastErrorCode.name: hwpmLastErrorCode
hwpmLastErrorCode.description: Last error code reported by the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpmMaxBaudRateToPhone.name: hwpmMaxBaudRateToPhone
hwpmMaxBaudRateToPhone.description: Maximum settable communication speed for accessing the phone system. This property is inherited from CIM_PotsModem.

hwpmMaxBaudRateToSerialPort.name: hwpmMaxBaudRateToSerialPort
hwpmMaxBaudRateToSerialPort.description: Maximum settable communication speed to the COM port for an external modem. Enter 0 if not applicable. This property is inherited from CIM_PotsModem.

hwpmMaxNumberOfPasswords.name: hwpmMaxNumberOfPasswords
hwpmMaxNumberOfPasswords.description: Number of passwords definable in the modem itself. If this feature is not supported, enter 0. This property is inherited from CIM_PotsModem.

hwpmModel.name: hwpmModel
hwpmModel.description: Model of this POTS modem. Example: 'Sportster 56K External'

hwpmModemInfPath.name: hwpmModemInfPath
hwpmModemInfPath.description: Path to this modem's .inf file. This file contains initialization information for the modem and its driver. Example: 'C:\WINNT\INF'

hwpmModemInfSection.name: hwpmModemInfSection
hwpmModemInfSection.description: Name of the section in the modem's .inf file that contains information about the modem.

hwpmModulationBell.name: hwpmModulationBell
hwpmModulationBell.description: Command string used to instruct the modem to use Bell modulations for 300 and 1200 bps. Example: 'B1'

hwpmModulationCCITT.name: hwpmModulationCCITT
hwpmModulationCCITT.description: Command string used to instruct the modem to use CCITT modulations for 300 and 1200 bps. Example: 'B0'

hwpmModulationScheme.name: hwpmModulationScheme
hwpmModulationScheme.description: Modulation scheme of the modem. This property is inherited from CIM_PotsModem.

hwpmName.name: hwpmName
hwpmName.description: Label by which the object is known. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpmPNPDeviceID.name: hwpmPNPDeviceID
hwpmPNPDeviceID.description: Windows Plug and Play device identifier of the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: '*PNP030b'

hwpmPortSubClass.name: hwpmPortSubClass
hwpmPortSubClass.description: Definition of the port used for this modem.

hwpmPowerManagementCapabilities.name: hwpmPowerManagementCapabilities
hwpmPowerManagementCapabilities.description: Array of the specific power-related capabilities of a logical device. The Enabled value indicates that the power management features are currently enabled but the exact feature set is unknown or the information is unavailable. Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically indicates that a device can change its power state based on usage or other criteria. Power State Settable indicates that the SetPowerState method is supported. Power Cycling Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle). Timed Power On Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle) and Time set to a specific date and time, or interval, for power-on. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Not Supported 2 Disabled 3 Enabled 4 Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically 5 Power State Settable 6 Power Cycling Supported 7 Timed Power On Supported

hwpmPowerManagementSupported.name: hwpmPowerManagementSupported
hwpmPowerManagementSupported.description: If TRUE, the device can be power-managed (can be put into suspend mode, and so on). The property does not indicate that power management features are currently enabled, only that the logical device is capable of power management. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpmPrefix.name: hwpmPrefix
hwpmPrefix.description: Dialing prefix used to access an outside line.

hwpmProperties.name: hwpmProperties
hwpmProperties.description: List of all the properties (and their values) for this modem.

hwpmProviderName.name: hwpmProviderName
hwpmProviderName.description: Network path to the computer that provides the modem services.

hwpmPulse.name: hwpmPulse
hwpmPulse.description: Command string used to instruct the modem to use pulse mode for dialing. Pulse dialing is necessary for phone lines that are unable to handle tone dialing. Example: 'P'

hwpmReset.name: hwpmReset
hwpmReset.description: Command string used to reset the modem for the next call. Example: 'AT&F'

hwpmResponsesKeyName.name: hwpmResponsesKeyName
hwpmResponsesKeyName.description: Response this modem might report to the operating system during the connection process. The first two characters specify the type of response. The second two characters specify information about the connection being made. The second two characters are used only for Negotiation Progress or Connect response codes. The next eight characters specify the modem-to-modem line speed negotiated in bits per second (bps). The characters represent a 32-bit integer doubleword format (byte and word reversed). The last eight characters indicate that the modem is changing to a different port or Data Terminal Equipment (DTE) speed. Usually this field is not used because modems make connections at a locked port speed regardless of the modem-to-modem or Data Communications Equipment (DCE) speed.

hwpmRingsBeforeAnswer.name: hwpmRingsBeforeAnswer
hwpmRingsBeforeAnswer.description: Number of rings before the modem answers an incoming call. This property is inherited from CIM_PotsModem.

hwpmSpeakerModeDial.name: hwpmSpeakerModeDial
hwpmSpeakerModeDial.description: Command string used to turn the modem speaker on after dialing a number, and turning the speaker off when a connection has been established. Example: 'M1'

hwpmSpeakerModeOff.name: hwpmSpeakerModeOff
hwpmSpeakerModeOff.description: Command string used to turn the modem speaker off. Example: 'M0'

hwpmSpeakerModeOn.name: hwpmSpeakerModeOn
hwpmSpeakerModeOn.description: Command string used to turn the modem speaker on. Example: 'M2'

hwpmSpeakerModeSetup.name: hwpmSpeakerModeSetup
hwpmSpeakerModeSetup.description: Command string used to instruct the modem to turn the speaker on (until a connection is established). Example: 'M3'

hwpmSpeakerVolumeHigh.name: hwpmSpeakerVolumeHigh
hwpmSpeakerVolumeHigh.description: Command string used to set the modem speaker to the highest volume. Example: 'L3'

hwpmSpeakerVolumeInfo.name: hwpmSpeakerVolumeInfo
hwpmSpeakerVolumeInfo.description: Describes the volume level of the audible tones from the modem. This property is inherited from CIM_PotsModem.

hwpmSpeakerVolumeLow.name: hwpmSpeakerVolumeLow
hwpmSpeakerVolumeLow.description: Command string used to set the modem speaker to the lowest volume. Example: 'L1'

hwpmSpeakerVolumeMed.name: hwpmSpeakerVolumeMed
hwpmSpeakerVolumeMed.description: Command string used to set the modem speaker to a medium volume. Example: 'L2'

hwpmStatus.name: hwpmStatus
hwpmStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwpmStatusInfo.name: hwpmStatusInfo
hwpmStatusInfo.description: State of the logical device. If this property does not apply to the logical device, the value 5 (Not Applicable) should be used. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpmStringFormat.name: hwpmStringFormat
hwpmStringFormat.description: Type of characters used for text passed through the modem. Values are: 'ASCII string format' 'DBCS string format' 'UNICODE string format'

hwpmSupportsCallback.name: hwpmSupportsCallback
hwpmSupportsCallback.description: If TRUE, the modem supports call-back. This property is inherited from CIM_PotsModem.

hwpmSupportsSynchronousConnect.name: hwpmSupportsSynchronousConnect
hwpmSupportsSynchronousConnect.description: If TRUE, synchronous, as well as asynchronous, communication is supported. This property is inherited from CIM_PotsModem.

hwpmSystemCreationClassName.name: hwpmSystemCreationClassName
hwpmSystemCreationClassName.description: Value of the scoping computer's CreationClassName property. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpmSystemName.name: hwpmSystemName
hwpmSystemName.description: Name of the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwpmTerminator.name: hwpmTerminator
hwpmTerminator.description: String that marks the end of a command string. Example: '<cr'

hwpmTimeOfLastReset.name: hwpmTimeOfLastReset
hwpmTimeOfLastReset.description: Date and time the modem was last reset. This property is inherited from CIM_PotsModem.

hwpmTone.name: hwpmTone
hwpmTone.description: Command string that instructs the modem to use tone mode for dialing. The phone line must support tone dialing. Example: 'T'

hwpmVoiceSwitchFeature.name: hwpmVoiceSwitchFeature
hwpmVoiceSwitchFeature.description: Command strings used to activate the voice capabilities of a voice modem. Example: 'AT+V'

wmiVideoMonitor.name: wmiVideoMonitor
wmiVideoMonitor.description: The Video and Monitors subcategory groups classes that represent monitors, video cards, and their associated settings.

win32DesktopMonitorTable.name: win32DesktopMonitorTable
win32DesktopMonitorTable.description: The Win32_DesktopMonitor WMI class represents the type of monitor or display device attached to the computer system.

hwdmIndex.name: hwdmIndex
hwdmIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwdmAvailability.name: hwdmAvailability
hwdmAvailability.description: Availability and status of the device. Power Save - Unknown indicates that the device is known to be in a power save mode, but its exact status is unknown; Power Save - Low Power Mode indicates that the device is in a power save state but still functioning, and may exhibit degraded performance; Power Save - Standby indicates that the device is not functioning but could be brought to full power quickly; and Power Save - Warning indicates that the device is in a warning state, though also in a power save mode. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwdmBandwidth.name: hwdmBandwidth
hwdmBandwidth.description: Monitor's bandwidth in megahertz. If unknown, enter 0. This property is inherited from CIM_DesktopMonitor.

hwdmCaption.name: hwdmCaption
hwdmCaption.description: Short description (one-line string) of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwdmConfigManagerErrorCode.name: hwdmConfigManagerErrorCode
hwdmConfigManagerErrorCode.description: Windows Configuration Manager error code. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwdmConfigManagerUserConfig.name: hwdmConfigManagerUserConfig
hwdmConfigManagerUserConfig.description: If TRUE, the device is using a user-defined configuration. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwdmCreationClassName.name: hwdmCreationClassName
hwdmCreationClassName.description: Name of the first concrete class to appear in the inheritance chain used in the creation of an instance. When used with the other key properties of the class, the property allows all instances of this class and its subclasses to be uniquely identified. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwdmDescription.name: hwdmDescription
hwdmDescription.description: Description of the object. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwdmDeviceID.name: hwdmDeviceID
hwdmDeviceID.description: Unique identifier of a desktop monitor. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwdmDisplayType.name: hwdmDisplayType
hwdmDisplayType.description: Type of desktop monitor or CRT. This property is inherited from CIM_DesktopMonitor.

hwdmErrorCleared.name: hwdmErrorCleared
hwdmErrorCleared.description: If TRUE, the error reported in LastErrorCode is now cleared. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwdmErrorDescription.name: hwdmErrorDescription
hwdmErrorDescription.description: Free-form string supplying more information about the error recorded in LastErrorCode, and information on any corrective actions that may be taken. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwdmInstallDate.name: hwdmInstallDate
hwdmInstallDate.description: Date and time the object was installed. This property does not need a value to indicate that the object is installed. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwdmIsLocked.name: hwdmIsLocked
hwdmIsLocked.description: If TRUE, the device is locked, preventing user input or output. This property is inherited from CIM_UserDevice.

hwdmLastErrorCode.name: hwdmLastErrorCode
hwdmLastErrorCode.description: Last error code reported by the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwdmMonitorManufacturer.name: hwdmMonitorManufacturer
hwdmMonitorManufacturer.description: Name of the monitor manufacturer. Example: 'NEC'

hwdmName.name: hwdmName
hwdmName.description: Label by which the object is known. When subclassed, the property can be overridden to be a key property. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwdmPixelsPerXLogicalInch.name: hwdmPixelsPerXLogicalInch
hwdmPixelsPerXLogicalInch.description: Resolution along the X axis (horizontal direction) of the monitor.

hwdmPixelsPerYLogicalInch.name: hwdmPixelsPerYLogicalInch
hwdmPixelsPerYLogicalInch.description: Resolution along the Y axis (vertical direction) of the monitor.

hwdmPNPDeviceID.name: hwdmPNPDeviceID
hwdmPNPDeviceID.description: Windows Plug and Play device identifier of the logical device. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Example: '*PNP030b'

hwdmPowerManagementCapabilities.name: hwdmPowerManagementCapabilities
hwdmPowerManagementCapabilities.description: Array of the specific power-related capabilities of a logical device. The Enabled value indicates that the power management features are currently enabled but the exact feature set is unknown or the information is unavailable. Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically indicates that a device can change its power state based on usage or other criteria. Power State Settable indicates that the SetPowerState method is supported. Power Cycling Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle). Timed Power On Supported indicates that the SetPowerState method can be invoked with the PowerState parameter set to 5 (Power Cycle) and Time set to a specific date and time, or interval, for power-on. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Not Supported 2 Disabled 3 Enabled 4 Power Saving Modes Entered Automatically 5 Power State Settable 6 Power Cycling Supported 7 Timed Power On Supported

hwdmPowerManagementSupported.name: hwdmPowerManagementSupported
hwdmPowerManagementSupported.description: If TRUE, the device can be power-managed (can be put into suspend mode, and so on). The property does not indicate that power management features are currently enabled, only that the logical device is capable of power management. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwdmScreenHeight.name: hwdmScreenHeight
hwdmScreenHeight.description: Logical height of the display in screen coordinates. This property is inherited from CIM_DesktopMonitor.

hwdmScreenWidth.name: hwdmScreenWidth
hwdmScreenWidth.description: Logical width of the display in screen coordinates. This property is inherited from CIM_DesktopMonitor.

hwdmStatus.name: hwdmStatus
hwdmStatus.description: Current status of the object. Various operational and non-operational statuses can be defined. Operational statuses include: 'OK', 'Degraded', and 'Pred Fail' (an element, such as a SMART-enabled hard drive, may be functioning properly but predicting a failure in the near future). Non-operational statuses include: 'Error', 'Starting', 'Stopping', and 'Service'. The latter, 'Service', could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither 'OK' nor in one of the other states. This property is inherited from CIM_ManagedSystemElement.

hwdmStatusInfo.name: hwdmStatusInfo
hwdmStatusInfo.description: State of the logical device. If this property does not apply to the logical device, the value 5 (Not Applicable) should be used. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwdmSystemCreationClassName.name: hwdmSystemCreationClassName
hwdmSystemCreationClassName.description: Value of the scoping computer's CreationClassName property. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

hwdmSystemName.name: hwdmSystemName
hwdmSystemName.description: Name of the scoping system. This property is inherited from CIM_LogicalDevice.

win32VideoControllerTable.name: win32VideoControllerTable
win32VideoControllerTable.description: The Win32_VideoController WMI class represents the capabilities and management capacity of the video controller on a Windows computer system.

hwvcIndex.name: hwvcIndex
hwvcIndex.description: The value of this object uniquely identifies the instance entry for this class.

hwvcAcceleratorCapabilities.name: hwvcAcceleratorCapabilities
hwvcAcceleratorCapabilities.description: Array of graphics and 3D capabilities of the video controller. This property is inherited from CIM_VideoController. Value Meaning 0 Unknown 1 Other 2 Graphics Accelerator 3 3D Accelerator

hwvcAdapterCompatibility.name: hwvcAdapterCompatibility
hwvcAdapterCompatibility.description: General chip set used for this controller to compare compatibilities with the system.

hwvcAdapterDACType.name: hwvcAdapterDACType
hwvcAdapterDACType.description: Name or identifier of the digital-to-analog converter (DAC) chip. The character set of this property is alphanumeric.

hwvcAdapterRAM.name: hwvcAdapterRAM
